His hopes and dreams are to have a greenhouse to grow tomatoes and cucumbers and to have, together with his family, a better standard of living.

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad “We thank you for having confidence in us and for helping us with our businesses. Thank you for your contributions so that we and our families can have a better quality of life.”

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for his sorghum planting.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a 49-year-old widow who lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her, but she never lost hope and she brought up her children with great effort. Now her children are older and do different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially.   
Safia spends her time at home carrying out her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her third son, who has a shop in the market selling DVDs and CDs. He sells the latest movies on DVD and songs on CD to his customers. With this loan, he will buy the latest variety of movies and songs to sell in his shop. This will allow him to fulfill customer demand and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past five years and Safia is very confident that her son’s business will grow well after the investment of this loan.  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Safia.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and CDs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 47 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 21 años respectivamente. Ella vive en el municipio de Soledad, desarrolla la actividad de docente y también es una gran emprendedora; pues tiene un negocio de confecciones en el que se dedica a la producción de uniformes deportivos   y a otras líneas en generales,  porque además trabaja todo tipo de ropa sobre medida y por encargo. Sus principales clientes son los que venden en almacenes deportivos del centro de la ciudad, y comités de deportes regionales, además de los  sectores aledaños; Su meta es lograr un crecimiento importante hasta lograr convertirse en una distribuidora de ropa deportiva para toda la costa. Su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo que maneja, pues la clientela gradualmente se incrementa  y le resulta insuficiente para lograr un servicio efectivo. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará una máquina plana que agilice el proceso de acabado y con ello incrementará su potencial productivo. Carmen maneja su negocio con mucha disciplina, y se esmera en lograr lo que se propone, sus estados financieros muestran cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 10 días una rotación de inventarios de 8 días, mientras su autonomía es del 99,6%. Y   desde estos indicadores se potencializa su crecimiento empresarial
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, is married and has two children, ages 13 and 21.  She lives in the town of Soledad and works as a teacher but is also an entrepreneur who has a sewing business and makes sports uniforms and other general clothing.  Her garments are made to order.  Her main customers are the sporting goods stores in the center of town, the regional sports committees and the village areas.  Her goal is to grow enough to become a distributor of sports clothes along the entire cost.  

Her greatest challenge is having enough work capital because her customer base is increasing and she does not have enough funds to offer an effective service.  With her credkiva, her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she will buy a flat machine which will facilitate the finishing process so she can increase her productivity.  Carmen manages her business with much discipline and works hard to reach her goals.  Her accounts show a record of accounts-receivable of every 10 days and an inventory turnover of 8 days.  Her autonomy rating is 99.6%.  Her business growth will be based on these factors.

loans.use: To buy a flat machine to facilitate the finishing process.

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: Susana tiene 34 D. edad y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y 03 hijos que en la actualidad depenD. D. ellos. Susana se dedica a la venta ambulatoria D. mazamorra, la cual lleva aproximadamente 02 años dedicándose a dicha actividad, esta idea surgió con la idea D. querer progresar es por ello que  Susana toma la decisión D. emprender su propio negocio, también nos cuenta que se dedica a la confección  D. tejidos  D. chompas, carteras, chalinas, entre otros, la cual trabaja sobre pedidos. Susana tiene como meta instalar una bodega en su domicilio donD. ofrezca productos D. primera necesidad, pues sabe que D. este modo generaría  mayores ingresos. Con el fin D. mejorar su economía  Susana solicito su último préstamo para la compra D. insumos D. la preparación D. mazamorras como maíz, arroz, leche, azúcar, etc. La alcancía comunal “Mujeres Empresarias” es un grupo conformado por 07 socios comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad.La señora Magna no pudo estar presente en el desembolso por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Susana is 34 years old and her family consists of herself, her husband and 3 children who are currently dependent on them. Susana is a street vendor of mazamorra [corn pudding], an activity which she has been doing for approximately 2 years. The idea came about with the thought of wanting to progress, which is why Susana decided to start her own business. 

She also tells us that she knits sweaters, purses, scarves and other things, which she makes upon request. Susana has a goal of establishing a store in her home that offers basic necessities, since she knows that she will generate a better income that way. With the goal of improving her finances, Susana's latest loan request is for buying ingredients to prepare mazamorra such as corn, rice, milk, sugar, etc. 

The communal bank "Mujeres Empresarias" is a group composed of 7 members partnered with the program Prosperidad. Magna was unable to be present for this loan due to work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Nosheen's Group

texts.en:
Nosheen is married and her husband operates a business making shoes. He has been operating his business for many years and he has a lot of contacts who give him orders regularly.  
Nosheen is a housewife who stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is a very good administrator and manages her household expenses very well. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter, all of whom are enrolled in a local school and getting an education.  
Nosheen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who has a large order to fulfill. With this loan, he will buy leather, shoe polish and nails in bulk quantities. Nosheen is very confident that her husband’s business will grow well after this loan investment and that he will be able to successfully complete the client's order on time.  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nosheen.

loans.use: to buy leather, shoe polish and nails for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy larger volumes of ordered merchandise and ingredients to make desserts.

loans.name: Catalina Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Catalina tiene 29 años, es madre soltera con un hijo de 3 años de edad. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería en general tal como ropa, zapatos cosméticos, útiles escolares, etc. La señora empezó este negocio cuando tuvo a su primer hijo, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos con que brindarle una manutención necesaria a su niño pequeño. Cabe señalarse, ella trabaja en una zona franca desde hace dos años, y ella aprovecha trabajar allí para distribuir sus productos con sus compañeros de trabajo. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar unas compras de sus artículos, principalmente artículos escolares, ya que desea aprovechar las ventas que se aproximan.
texts.en:
Catalina is 29 years old. She is a single mother with a 3 year old child. She has a business selling general goods such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, school supplies, etc. She began this business when she had her first child, looking for a different source of income to provide child support for her little one.

It should be pointed out that she has worked in a free trade zone for two years. She takes advantage of working there to distribute her merchandise with her colleagues. She is currently seeking a loan in order to buy some items, mostly school supplies to take advantage of coming sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetics and school supplies.

loans.name: Guissella Ivania

texts.es:
Doña Guissella es comerciante, su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, casada, y madre de tres hijos, su esposo esta laborando en los Estados Unidos, pues es dificil, pero fue el medio de sobresalir adelante con la familia.
Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio, luego atraves de financiamiento en Afodenic, logro el aumento en la compra de mas ropa en estilo y marca. Y que ha venido equilibrando en once ciclos de prestamos.
Lo que comprara con este nuevo prestamo es ropa, de dama, caballero y cosmeticos para seguir manteniendo su clientela, ya que parte de sus ventas son por encargos de los cuales tiene muchos y que desea tener sastifechos  a sus clientes.
Su meta es seguir creciendo en ventas, para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Guissella is a merchant and sells new clothing for a living.  She is married and has three children and her husband is working the United States.  This situation is difficult for her but it was the only way the family could get ahead.

She started her business with money her husband gave her.  Her subsequent financing has been through Afodenic enabling her to buy more stylish, brand name clothing.  She has been able to reach a phase of stability after eleven loan cycles.

She plans to use the new loan to buy women's and men's clothing and cosmetics in order to keep her customer base.  Part of her sales come from orders she already has received and she wants to keep her customers satisfied.  

Her goal is to increase sales and continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of garments to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es:
Paulina es una de las fundadoras de la Alcancía Comunal “Don Bosco” grupo que  está conformada por 08 Integrantes emprendedores y responsables ya que no han tenido problemas con su pago.
Paulina tiene 45 años de edad  es madre soltera y tiene 05 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos ya que están en etapa escolar, ella cuenta con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual lleva 06 años dedicándose a dicho rubro, pero también nos manifiesta que brinda servicios domestico de limpieza, cocina y lavado de ropa, es así como Paulina se ha ganado  la vida,  gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo a logrado que sus hijos estudien ya que nos manifiesta que no le fue fácil ya que tuvo que  enfrentarse solo y hacer el papel de padre y madre para sus hijos, pero eso no fue obstáculo para ella, pues ella sabe que el amor de madre no tiene límites. El deseo de  Paulina es de contar con casa propia, ya que solo viven como guardianes en una vivienda. Con el crédito brindado lo va utilizar para la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, leche, en mayor cantidad para así poder ofrecer  a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Don Bosco” agradecen a los prestamistas KIVA.
texts.en:
Paulina is one of the founders of the “Don Bosco” Communal Bank team that is made up of 8 responsible entrepreneurial members that have not had any problems meeting their payments.

Paulina is 45 years old, is a single mother, and has 5 children. She currently continues to support 2 of them since they are of school age.  She has a small grocery store and has devoted 6 years to this field, but she also states that she offers domestic cleaning, cooking and clothes washing. This is how Paulina has made a living.

Thanks to Paulina’s effort and the work she has done, her children are studying. She tells us that it was not easy since she had to do it alone and play the role of both father and mother to her children. But this was not an obstacle for her because she knows that the love of a mother has no limits.

Paulina’s wish is to have her own home, because they live as caretakers in a house. She is going to use the loan she gets to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks, and milk in large quantities in order to be able to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soft drinks and milk.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a very active and talented lady who supports her family financially by sewing clothes for customers in her neighborhood. She learned this skill from her mother and now she is taking advantage of her skills. 
Bushra's husband works in a private organization on a monthly wage. Bushra has three children. Her eldest daughter is studying while the other two children are not of school age yet. 
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her clothes sewing business. With this loan, she will buy a new sewing machine, which will allow her to complete her orders in a shorter period of time and therefore earn more profits. Bushra is very confident that her business will grow in a positive direction after this loan investment.  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bushra.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira is married and her husband has a construction supplies business. He offers his services to different construction companies and earns an income for the family. Nasira is a very active and talented lady who supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. She has six children. Two of her children work, two are studying and the others are free and don't do anything.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders on time and earn more income. She has 10 years of experience in her business and is very confident that an investment will help her grow her business further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasira.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing buisness

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca, es originaria de una localidad muy  bonita, en donde las personas  la mayoría es católica y tiene una capilla que pertenece a  la virgen de Guadalupe, ella vive en unión libre con el señor Oscar y con quien procreo  dos hijos que  aun están a su  responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de quesos, en donde lleva  ochos años y tres meses en lo que se está muy contenta ya que  le ha ido bien  pues ha tenido un buen ingreso para su  hogar.

    Su motivo a esta actividad inicio sola  para tener sus propios ingresos  y apoyar a su esposo quien trabaja en el campo  y para eso mejor decido dio trabajar.

      más grande sueño es que con el tiempo y sus ahorros pueda tener una casa más amplia en donde vivir con su pequeña familia
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca is from a pretty town where there is a Lady of Guadalupe Chapel and most residents are Catholic.  She lives with her common-law husband, Oscar, and their two children who are still in their care.

She is requesting a loan to buy and sell cheese.  She is happy with the business she has been in for eight years and three months.  It has been successful and provided a good income for the household.

The reason she started this activity was to have her own income and help her husband who works in the fields.  Her goal for the future is to save enough money to buy a larger house for her small family.

loans.use: To buy and sell cheese.

loans.name: Maria Ysabet

texts.es:
Doña María ysabet, es casada con el señor Carmelino y con quien  procreo  cinco hijos quienes y ya están casado  y son su más grande  alegría.

   Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra  de ropas para damas, caballero y niños, para luego venderlo fuera y dentro  de  su localidad, en esta actividad lleva cinco años  y seis  meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen resultado.

    Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad  fueron sus hijos quienes  la apoyaron para  poner su negocio,  y con ellos se pueda ayudar en tener un mejor ingreso para sostenerse.

    Lo único  que desea es que con esta actividad  y el préstamo pueda seguir trabajando, así apoyar a sus nietos  con algunos gastos que sedan en su  educación.
texts.en:
Doña María Ysabet is married to Mr. Carmelino and they have five children who are all married.  They are also her greatest reason for happiness.

She plans to use the loan to buy women's, men's and children's clothing to sell in and outside her town.  She has been in this business for five years and six months and claims it is going well and showing a profit.

Her children were the ones who encouraged her to start the activity which has provided more income to support herself.

Her goal now is to continue with her work with the help of the loan so she can support her grandchildren and provide them with an education.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Asbeli Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Asbeli del Carmen, vive en una colonia muy bonita en donde las personas soy muy trabajadoras, ella es casada con el señor  Joaquín Antonio  y con quien procreo  dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en  la compra de  mercancía como son ropa, para damas, caballero, niñas y niños, en donde lleva  practicando  cinco años  y seis meses, en la que comenta que le va bien ya que  ha tenido un buen resultado.

   Para iniciar con esta actividad  lo animo su mama quien también se dedica a lo mismo  y así  apoyarse con un poco de dinero  y su esposo no se vea muy presionado con los gastos que se generan en su hogar.
 
   Lo único que desea es que logres  tener  un ahorro para  que con el tiempo tenga un negocio más grande, así  tener  un mejor ahorro para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Asbeli del Carmen lives in a very pretty town where people are very hard-working. She is married to Joaquín Antonio and they have 2 children that are still their responsibility.  

She has applied for the loan to buy merchandise such as clothing for women, men, and children. She has done this work for 5 1/2 years. She says that it is going well, as she has had a good profit.  Her mother, who works in the same activity, encouraged her to start her business.  It enables her to bring in a little money, so her husband isn't so pressed with the household expenses.  

All she wants is to manage to save, so that in time she can have a larger business, and so have more funds for helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell outside the community.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora  Gabriela, vive en una colonia muy cercana del pueblo, ella  es casada con el señor Luis Antonio  y con quien procreo tres hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella solicito  el préstamo  en el mantenimiento de  su camioneta  de transporte, en donde lleva practicando siete años   y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido  un buen resultado para su familia.

   Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su esposo quien  es que maneja la camioneta  para atender bien a sus clientes que son los que lo motiva a seguir trabajando por que le comentan que es muy amable en dar el servicio.

    Lo  que desea es que  con su préstamo que solito pueda continuar trabajando y así tener un mejor ahorro para darle lo mejor asus hijos que son su motivo de seguir adelnate.
texts.en:
Gabriela lives in a neighborhood that’s quite near to town.  She’s married to Luis Antonio and they have three children still in their care.

She requested the loan to service her transportation van that’s she’s been operating for seven years.  She comments that she does well since she’s obtained good results for her family.

What motivated her to go into this activity was her husband who drives the van to provide good service to their customers who motivate her to continue working because they comment that he is very kind to them when providing the service.

She hopes that with the loan she requested she will be able to stay in business and have savings to provide the best for her children who are the motivation for her to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz  de 50 años vive en Soledad, municipio ubicado en el área metropolitana de Barranquilla y allí tiene una peluquería donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal, a través de sus líneas de corte de cabello, manicure, pedicure, masajes, peinados y maquillaje;  negocio que inició desde hace 19 años con un receso, por enfermedad de su madre con la cual en el  año 2003 se trasladó a otra ciudad donde continuaron, para finalmente radicarse hace 8 meses en el  municipio de Soledad,  donde funciona actualmente.  Su meta es continuar acreditando su negocio y cuenta con toda su experiencia para lograrlo; su desafío es lograr acceder a un capital de trabajo para realizar las compras de sus insumos de contado y obtener descuentos, esta justamente  la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará tintes, esmaltes, agua oxigenada, champó y silicona en mayor volumen. Con ello responderá a la competencia que es también un gran desafío, para lograr fidelizar sus clientes. El negocio de Luz rota sus cuentas por cobrar cada 25 días, mientras sus inventarios lo hacen cada 5 y alcanza una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 45%., registros financieros desde los cuales auguramos, que con inyecciones de capital de trabajo podrá lograr su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en:
Luz, 50, lives in Soledad, a town located in Barranquilla’s metropolitan area.  She has a barber shop there where she provides image improvement services through haircuts, manicure, pedicure, massages, hair styling and make-up.  She started the business 19 years ago with just one break when, due to her mother’s illness in 2003, they moved to a different city and continued there but 8 months ago returned to stay for good in Soledad where the business currently operates.

Her goal is to continue to finance her business and she has all the necessary experience to do so.  Her challenge is to access working capital to pay cash for her purchases of supplies so that she can qualify for discounts.  This is precisely the reason for calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy dyes, nail polish, peroxide, shampoo and silicone in large amounts.  With this she’ll be able to face competition which is another great challenge and turn her customers into regular ones.

Luz’s business turns over her accounts receivable every 25 days while her inventory does so every five and her profit margin on sales reaches 45%, financial parameters with which we can predict, with injections of capital, her reaching her potential growth.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of beauty supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana es cliente antigua, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras al por mayor, las verduras D. temporada que traen desD. la zona D. rio abajo, ella tiene por allá parcelas D. sembradíos, por lo que cada época D. siembra manda insumos como semillas abonos fungicidas, etc., en el momento D. la visita ella se encontraba con la venta D. achojchas, espinacas, carotes, berenjenas, repollos, zapallo en su puesto del mercado campesino en la zona D. San Pedro. Con el dinero del credito comprara semillas y abono, la Sra. Juana tiene el esposo que se dedica a la jardinería, ella tiene hijos ya independientes, y bajo su cuidado esta su nieta D. 12 años, es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana is a long-standing client of our institution who sells vegetables wholesale.  She transports seasonal vegetables from Río Abajo where she has plots of farmland.  Every sowing season she orders supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, fungicides etc.  When we visited her, we found Juana selling 'achojchas' (a native vegetable, similar to a cucumber), spinach, carrots, eggplants, cabbages and pumpkins from her stall in the rural market in San Pedro.

Juana will use her loan money to buy seeds and fertilizers.  Her husband is a gardener and her children live independently.  She has a 12-year-old granddaughter in her care.  Juana is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: G.s. Guisquiliapa Group

texts.es: La señora Aura Lila tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera con un niño de tres años, ella habita en Guisquiliapa. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, nacatamales y productos derivados del maíz, tienen 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual dio inicio debido a que mi mama me impulso a generar nuestros propios ingresos desde pequeña, ella nos enseño a hacer las tortillas, además que antes salían a venderlas. Otro integrante del grupo es doña Dora Elizabeth la cual tiene 24 años de edad, es casada, Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, además vende frijoles cocidos y demás productos derivados de maíz como tortilla dulce, etc. Ella inicio el negocio ante la falta de empleo que aqueja el país, por lo que tuvo que buscar una forma de generar ingresos propios para el sostenimiento del hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de maíz, bolsas, cal, comal entre otros. La señora Guadalupe del Socorro también pertenece al grupo, la cual  tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor cultivando unas tierras de su propiedad. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo a su negocio que es la venta de nacatamales, tortillas, manuelitas, etc. Ella sale a vender de manera ambulante sus productos, aunque las personas que ya la conocen le solicitan le envié tortillas diariamente.
texts.en:
22-year-old Aura Lila is a single mother who has a three-year-old son.  She lives in Guisquiliapa.  Aura Lila makes tortillas, nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and corn-based products.  She has been in this business for five years and started out in the business because her mother pushed her to make her own income from a young age.  Her mother taught her how to make tortillas and, before that, she used to go out and sell them.

Another member of this group is Dora Elizabeth who is 24 years old and married.  Her business is making tortillas.  She also sells baked beans and  other corn-based products such as 'tortilla dulce' (sweet tortillas) etc.  She started her business because of the lack of work that plagues her country.  She had to find a way of making her own income in order to support her household.  Her loan will be used to buy corn, bags, lime and a 'comal' (pan for making tortillas), etc.

Guadalupe del Socorro also belongs to the group.  She is 45 years old, married, and has five grown-up children.  Her husband works as a farmer, growing crops on some land that he owns.  She is requesting this loan to invest in her business selling nacatamales, tortillas, 'manuelitas' (typical Nicaraguan food), etc.  She goes out to sell her food as a street vendor though people who already know her ask her to send them tortillas every day.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, lime and a 'comal' (pan for making tortillas)

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is a very hardworking lady who owns & operates a business sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. She earns a good income, which helps her pay utilities. She has given birth to four sons and two daughters. All of them are getting their education. Her husband operates a donkey cart and provides loading and unloading services to his customers. He works very hard to afford the living expense of his family. 

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a new donkey cart, which will enable him to put heavy loads on it. He has been operating his business for many years and Bilqees is very confident that an investment will help him grow his business further and increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora  Juanita  tiene  treinta y tres años de edad , se  dedica  a la venta de abarrotes  desde hace siete años y a  la venta de quesos desde hace tres años  con su esposo , Gregorio  tiene la edad de  cuarenta años.
Es una  señora muy trabajadora  le gusta  ayudar  a su esposo  en lo necesario  cuando  ella va  ordeñar  ella se queda  atendiendo la tienda .
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  una  mujer  Tania  y dos varones Ricardo  y Enrique.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar  más  mercancía para su tienda como es: arroz, maíz, productos enlatados, jitomate, fríjol, aceite, tomates, etc.
Esta muy contenta  con su negocio  cada día gana más clientes  tanto en sus  quesos  como  en su tienda.
Uno de sus sueños  es hacer su tienda de abarrotes más grande  de la que horita tiene  ya que desea vender también medicamentos.
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Juanita is 33 years old and has been selling groceries for the last seven years; she’s also sold cheese for the last three years with her husband, Gregorio, 40.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help her husband as much as possible.   When he goes off to milk the cows she stays to watch the store.

She has three children; one girl, Tania and two boys, Ricardo and Enrique.

She asked for the loan to buy more stock merchandise for her store like: rice, corn, canned goods, red tomatoes, beans, oil, green tomatoes, etc.

She is very happy with her business.  Every day she acquires new customers both in the store and for the cheese.

One of her dreams is to enlarge the grocery store because she’d like to also sell medicine.

She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it gives people who want to have their own businesses and get ahead to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Martha Norma

texts.es:
La señora  Martha Norma,   tiene treinta y cuatro  años  de edad, se dedica  a la venta de pan   desde  hace cuatro años y a la venta de quesos desde siete meses   con su  esposo , Gil dardo que  tiene  la edad de  cuarenta  y dos años .
Es  una señora muy trabajadora le gusta ayudar a su esposo en lo necesario  cuando su esposo va a ordeñar al campo cuando su esposo regresa ella  se dedica a cuajar la leche   y hacer los quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar  insumos para la elaboración de pan como es : harina, leche , levadura, manteca  y huevos.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos una mujer  Ricarda de nueve  años   y  Lorena  de doce años de edad  y un varon Gilberto de  cinco años de edad .
Esta muy contenta con  su negocio   por que cada día va ganando mas clientes  y su negocio va creciendo , le  gusta mucho tener su propio  negocio por que  le ayuda a su  esposo en los gastos  de la casa  y a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener  una panadería mas grande  de la que tiene   de la horita tiene  ya que quisiera  vender pasteles.
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Martha Norma, 44, has been selling bread for the last four years and cheese for the last seven months with her husband, Gildardo, 42.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help her husband as much as possible.  When her husband heads out to the fields to milk the cows and then when he returns she takes over curdling the milk and making the cheese.

She asked for the loan to buy bread making supplies like: flour, milk, yeast, shortening and eggs.

She has three children: a girl, Ricarda, 9, and Lorena, 12, and one boy, Gilberto, 5.

She is very happy with her business because she’s gaining new customers every day and the business is growing.  She very much likes having her own business because she helps her husband with household expenses and with her children’ schooling costs.

One of her dreams is to have a larger bakery than the one she has now because she’d like to also sell cakes.

She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support they give people who want to have their own business to get ahead and help their families.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Tomasa Bertoldina

texts.es:
La señora  Tomasa Bertoldina  , se dedica a  al venta  de  pollos  es una señora muy trabajadora  desde  los doce años  empezó a trabajar  con su madre vendiendo tamales.
Su esposo  Florentino la  ayuda en la venta de pollos cuando sale temprano de su trabajo se dedica a entregar los pedidos de los pollos  ya que ese  negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias y  cada día obtienen mas clientes  por el buen trato que les da .
Tiene la cantidad de  cuatro hijos una mujer  Tania y tres varones  Rubén , Timoteo y Javier   ellos también le ayudan en el negocio   antes de  irse a la escuela   le ponen el agua a hervir para   que maten los pollos , le limpian las mesas para que  doña Tomasa  despache y le van a comprar lo que necesita.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comparar mas pollos ya que desea vender pollos por mayoreo  para obtener mas ganancias  y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y ayudarle  a su esposo en los gastos de la casa  y tener dinero guardado para alguna emergencia.
Esta  muy contenta  por  que  sus  sueños  poco a poco se van asiendo realidad  gracias a dios y al apoyo que le ha dado fundación realidad para  salir adelante.
texts.en:
Tomasa Bertoldina sells chickens.  She’s a very hard working woman who started to sell tamales twelve years ago with her mother.

Her husband, Florentino, helps her with the chicken sales.  When he gets off work early he takes over delivering the chickens because this is a very profitable business and every day they get new customers thanks to the good service he provides.

She has four children: a girl, Tania, and three boys, Rubén, Timoteo and Javier.  They also help with the business.  Before going off to school they put water to boil to kill the chickens and clean off the tables so that Tomasa can serve her customers and they go to buy her whatever she may need.

She requested the loan to buy more chickens because she wants to sell chickens at wholesale to obtain more profits and provide a better life for her children and help her husband with household expenses and to have money saved for any emergency.

She is very happy because her dreams are little by little coming true thanks be to God and the help she’s gotten from Fundación Realidad to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Norma es cliente antigua de Emprender, ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio, adornos, regalos y otros objetos como tarjetas, libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de San Miguel un lugar muy concurrido de la zona Sur, ella vive en casa familiar con sus hermanos, quienes se colaboran en sus actividades, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería para las fiestas de fin de año, además tiene propuestas para la venta de chocolatería, y tarjetas de navidad, por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Norma is a long standing Emprender client.  She sells stationery, office supplies, decorations, gifts and other objects like greeting cards, books, etc.  She sells a variety of products according to the season.  Her book store is located in the San Miguel zone which is a very busy area in the south.  She lives in the family home with her siblings who collaborate with her activities.  

She is asking for the loan to stock up on merchandise for the end of year festivities.  In addition, she has prospects for chocolates and Christmas card sales.  Because of her store’s location, sales are good and she’s a person who pays her debts; she’s responsible and hardworking and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora  Socorro , se dedica a la venta  de pan desde hace diez años  es una señora muy reconocida en su localidad por el  riquísimo pan que  elabora , empezó hacer pan desde los trece años puesto que su madre Albina se dedicaba a la  elaboración de pan .
Su  esposo  Amadeo  le ayuda  a amasar los ingredientes para el pan y  a vender el pan de casa en casa.
Tiene la cantidad  de dos hijos varones  Gilberto  y Fernando  quienes ayudan comprando los ingredientes que necesita  un día antes de que vaya hacer el pan .
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de pan como son :  harina, levadura , huevos , manteca etc.
Antes no contaba con una panadería  pero gracias a las ganancias  ahora ya cuenta con una panadería  , sale a vender pan  a otras localidades y en ocasiones  sale a vender en su localidad  de casa en casa  ya que sus hijos se quedan atendiendo la panadería.
Esta  muy contenta  por que cumplió uno de sus sueños que es  tener una panadería pero le gustaría elaborar pasteles  para bodas es una persona  que le gusta  cumplir sus metas.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad  por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
Socorro has been selling bread for the last ten years.  She is very well known in her community because of the delicious bread she makes.  She started out 13 years ago because her mother, Albina, also baked bread.  Her husband, Amadeo, helps her knead the dough and to sell the bread door to door.  She has two sons, Gilberto and Fernando, who help her buy the ingredients she needs the day before she’s going to bake the bread.  She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make bread like: flour, yeast, eggs, shortening, etc.

She didn’t used to have a bakery but thanks to profits she now has one.  She goes out to other localities to sell bread and sometimes goes out in her own location to sell door to door while her children stay tending to the bakery.

She is very happy because one of her dreams came true: to have a bakery.  But, she’d like to bake wedding cakes also.  She’s a person who likes to reach her goals.  

She thanks Fundación Realidad for helping her to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Norma Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Norma se dedica a la venta de cajeta, desde hace siete años, tambien lava y plancha, ya que le gusta ganar su dinero para apoyar a sus hijos, su esposo labora en una empresa privada en operaciones de servicios.
Desde joven a prendio ah hacer cajeta, en su  ciudad natal de Matagalpa, luego se traslado a la capital y siguio con el oficio y de alguna manera ayudar a los gstos del hogar.
Como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su vivienda, que ha venido mejorando junto a su esposo y en estos meses con financiamiento que Afodenic, ha dado en cuatro ciclos, las mejoras han sido, techo, repellos a las paredes, division de cuartos el cual esta contenta.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo comprara, materiales de construccion para terminar otra division en la sala, cambio de puerta, y verja que falta. Logrando mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Norma has been selling caramel for the last seven years.  She also takes in washing and ironing because she likes to earn money to support her children.  Her husband works for a private firm in service operations.

She learned how to make caramel while still very young in her hometown of Matagalpa.  When she moved to the capital she continued with this occupation to help out somehow with household expenses.

Her objective has been to build her house, something she’s been improving with her husband and these last few months with help from Afodenic which has given her four cycles.  The improvements have been:  roof, plastering walls, room divisions and she’s happy with this.

Today, with this new loan, she will buy building materials and supplies to finish another division in the living room, to replace a door and install a missing grate thus attaining home improvement.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is very active and has a business selling clothes to earn money for her family. She purchases the clothes from wholesale markets and sells to her community clients for a profit. Her husband is a tailor by profession. His shop is located in the market through which he operates his business. He is very skillful and his clients trust his work and give him regular orders. Naseem is the mother of two sons. The eldest son is also a tailor and the younger one works in a factory.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s tailoring business. He is in the process of establishing his business and needs an investment to purchase a sewing machine. He will also hire a worker on pay to facilitate more clients. Naseem is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for his business.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Olgalidia

texts.es:
La señora Olga lidia, vive en una localidad, muy bonita ya que en  ese  lugar  hay una laguna muy grande y es visitada por muchas personas  madre soltera con un  hijo a su responsabilidad once años.


   Ella es ama de casa  se dedica tambien a la costura de ropas y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de ingredientes  para la  elaboración de panes, así tambien nos cometa que compra  mercancía para surtir su tienda desbarrotes.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó hace poco ya  que su mama tambien se de dedica a  alo mismo y decidió practicarlo y le va bien.

   Lo quemas desea es que con estas actividades que practica pueda tener sus  propios ahorros para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Olga Lidia lives in a very pretty place where there is a large lagoon that’s visited by many people.  She’s a single mother of an 11-year-old son in her care.

She is a housewife and also a dressmaker and asked for the loan to buy bread making supplies.  She also mentioned that she will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

Her inspiration for this type of activity started a short time ago since her mother also does the same thing and she decided to do it too and does well.

What she wants the most is that with these activities that she carries out she’ll be able to have her own savings to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy bread making supplies.

loans.name: Ambrosio

texts.es: Ambrosio de 47 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar turístico muy cerca al mar, con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 19 a 23 años. Allí tiene una tienda, donde vende ranchos, víveres, enlatados, lácteos y artículos de la canasta familiar. Sus principales clientes son mujeres amas de casa, que día a día hacen sus compras, para la preparación de los alimento que consumen sus familias. Este negocio inició hace 2 años, cuando Ambrosio se dio cuenta que tenía una gran oportunidad de emprenderlo,  porque hacer las compras de los productos de la canasta familiar en pequeñas cantidades y muy cerca a su casa, era la necesidad de todos, pues no existía y aun  no tiene competencia cercana. Desde sus inicios el negocio funcionó y gradualmente sus ingresos han aumentado, su local cuenta con condiciones especiales en su atención y también sus  instalaciones gozan de aire acondicionado, pues  el calor de la Costa caribe agota rápidamente y que sus clientes  se refresquen en este ambiente y compren sus productos de manera tranquila, es el objetivo que persigue Ambrosio lo cual hace que las amas de casa acudan   frecuentemente a hacer sus compras.Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará viveres en mayor volumen y de contado, con lo cual logrará descuentos por esta modalidad, lo cual favorece sus transacciones comerciales. Su meta mas adelante es adecuar su vivienda para ubicar su tienda en su propia casa, porque el lugar donde se encuentra es arrendado y su gran desafio es lograr disminuír sus gastos. Mientras Ambrosio trabaja para alcanzar sus sueños, maneja en su tienda un margen de utilidad no menor del 20% y una rotación de inventarios de 20 dias, indicadores desde los cuales se proyecta su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en:
Ambrosio, 47, lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, a tourist destination very near the ocean, with his wife and two children who are 19 and 23 years old.  He has a store there where he sells snacks, foodstuffs, canned goods, dairy products and other items used for family’s basic needs.  His main customers are housewives who shop daily to prepare their families’ meals.  He started the business two years ago when Ambrosio noticed that he had a good opportunity to embark on it because everyone needs to be able to buy basic need items in small amounts and near their homes and no other competition existed nearby.

Since the beginning the business worked out and gradually his income has increased.  His store is special because of the service and also because it’s air conditioned and the heat in the Caribbean quickly exhausts people and his customers can refresh themselves in this environment and buy their products comfortably.  Ambrosio’s goal is that the housewives come frequently to shop.

His Kiva loan will be the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy larger volumes of groceries and to pay cash which will win discounts for him that are favorable for his commercial transactions.  

His goal for later on is to equip his house in order to install his store there because where he’s located at present is a rented locale and his great challenge is to reduce his costs.  While Ambrosio works to attain his dreams, he operates with a profit margin of no less than 20% and an inventory turnover rate of 20 days, indicators that predict growth potential.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of groceries.

loans.name: Blanca Mireli

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Mireli vive en una barrio de una localidad muy bonita, ella es casada  con el señor  Freddy con quien procreo dos hijos que  aun están a su responsabilidad.
Solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes  como son:  harina , huevo, aceite, queso, azúcar, entre otros para la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva practicando once años seis meses y cometa que le va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado su ingresó económico.
  Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad fue  su suegra, ya que desde que se caso le comenzó a ayudar y fue como aprendio y desde entonces lo practica y lo vende en la misma localidad.
    Su más grande sueño es que con el préstamo y  su actividad pueda tener sus propios ahorros para  apoyar a sus hijos en su educación.
texts.en:
Blanca Mireli lives in a neighborhood in a very pretty location.  She’s married to Freddy and they have two children who are still dependent on them.

She asked for the loan to buy ingredients like: flour, eggs, oil, cheese and sugar, among others, to make bread, something she’s been doing for eleven and a half years.  She comments that she does well since she’s improved her income that way.

What motivated her to go into this was her mother-in-law because she started helping her since she got married and that’s how she learned and now she practices it and sells it in the same location.

Her greatest dream is that with the loan and her activity she’ll be able to have her own savings to help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy bread baking supplies.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es: Martha Cecilia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella se levanta todos los días desde las siete d la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos y familiares. El negocio lo empezó desde muy temprana edad y que le ayudaba a su mama, pues fue ella quien le enseño esta actividad. Actualmente Martha solicita este crédito para la compra de ropa, calzado, perfume, toalla, sabanas, bolsos y prendas.
texts.en: Martha Cecilia sells general merchandise.  She rises every day at 7am and goes until 8pm.  Most of her customers are neighbors, friends and family members.  The business started when she was very young because she used to help her mother who taught her the occupation.  Currently, Martha is asking for this loan to buy clothes, footwear, perfume, towels, sheets, purses and other items.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, perfume, towels, sheets, purses and other items.

loans.name: Maria Elcira

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican al comercio, transporte público y turismo.

María se dedica a la venta de cerveza en un local propio, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace varios años, tiene más clientela lo fines de semana por diferentes eventos que hay, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer María a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza y otras bebidas, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que su familia se supere poco a poco.
texts.en:
María is a 50-year-old mother who lives in her own home with her two children. They receive all of the basic services. María resides in the urban section of Chiclayo Province. All of the residents in this area engage in retail, public transportation, and tourism.

María has been selling beer from her own shop for several years. She has more customers on the weekend because there are different events taking place, which allows her to increase her earnings and improve the quality of life for her family.

María is taking the opportunity to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can buy large quantities of beer and other beverages. She hopes to generate more revenue and expand her customer base so that she can repay this loan and help her family move forward a little bit at a time.

loans.use: to buy beer and other beverages in large quantities.

loans.name: Maykell Neftaly

texts.es: Maykell Neftaly se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte desde hace más de cinco años. Unos de sus mayores desafíos ha sido no poder comprarle ciertos repuestos a su moto taxi, ya que algunas veces no genera las ganancias suficientes. Maykell inicio este negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable es así como decide empezar esta actividad. El crédito es para la compra de llantas, focos, embragues, tapizar asientos, y comprar otros repuestos.
texts.en:
Maykell Neftaly has been providing transportation services for more than five years. One of his greatest challenges is not being able to buy certain parts for his motorcycle taxi because sometimes he does not generate enough income. Maykell started this business because he did not have a stable job and therefore decided to pursue this activity.

This loan will be used to buy tires, headlights, clutches, upholstered seats, and other spare parts.

loans.use: buy tires, headlights, clutches, upholstered seats, and other spare parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Robeth

texts.es:
La señora Robeth, es casada con el señor Alfredo y con quien procreo cuatro hijos quines ya están casados, ella vive  en un lugar muy bonito ya que hay muchos árboles de pino.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su  tienda de abarrotes y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos lleva  trece años y dos meses.

   Su motivo a esta actividad  fue ella misma ya que trabajo en una tienda de abarroter gubernamental y de ahí nació su inspiración en  poner este negocio  que le ha dado un buen resultado.

    Lo que desea es que con esta actividad pueda  seguir trabajando  para  poder apoyar a sus nietos con sus estudios, así tambien comprar un lugar para  construir su tienda más amplia.
texts.en:
Sra. Robeth is married to Sr. Alfredo and they have four children who are already married. She lives in a very beautiful place that has many pine trees.

Robeth is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise in order to restock her grocery store. She says that she has been doing well and has been in business for 13 years and 2 months.

Her reason for starting this business is because she had experience working at a grocery store owned by the government. There she was inspired to start this business which has given her good results.

What she wants from her business is the ability to continue working so that she can support her grandchildren with their studies. Robeth also wants to buy a place where she can build a larger store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Illimo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Magaly se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales como aves de corral y alimento balanceado para los mismos, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Magaly es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Magaly is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. They receive services such as running water and electricity. Magaly resides in the rural section of the District of Illimo, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture and livestock breeding.

Magaly has been raising and selling pigs for a few years. The animals are kept in a pen behind her house and fed a diet of balanced feed. Once the animals have reached optimal growth, she offers them for sale to her customers. With the income she earns, Magaly is able to cover her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to buy more animals, such as chickens, and the appropriate balanced feed. As soon as the animals are fattened, Magaly will sell them at different markets in the area in hopes of obtaining the best price. This will allow her to obtain more income so that she can have a better quality of life. Magaly is a hardworking and responsible person. Her only wish is for her family to move forward.

loans.use: to buy more animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora  Sofía, vive en un  localidad muy bonita   ya que su casa está a unos metros de la  laguna verde, ella es casada con el señor Alberto  y sus hijos ya están todos casados.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para  invertirlo en la compra de  pollos  de  rancho  y de granja para  luego venderlo en pies, en esta actividad lleva  dos años y seis meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso en su hogar.

   Lo que lo inspiro a esta actividad fue ella misma para tener como solventar sus gastos y apoyar a su esposo  quien ya esta grandecito de edad y trabaja en el campo.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir adelante gata que dios le preste vida .
texts.en:
Sra. Sofia lives in a beautiful town where her house is a few meters from a natural lake. She is married to Sr. Alberto and her children are already married.

Sofia is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of live free-range and farm-raised chickens that she will sell later. She has been in business for two years and six months and says that she has done well. Her business has allowed her to earn a good household income.

Sofia was inspired to start her business because she needed to contribute to the expenses and help her husband who works in the fields even though he is of advanced age.

Her greatest wish is that her business enables her to continue forward in the life that God has given her.

loans.use: to purchase live chickens for eventual resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and fodder for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Ma Lucita

texts.es:
La señora Ma Lucita,  vive en un lugar muy cercano de un pueblo que es  muy visitado por personas de otras regiones, ella es casada con el señor  Constancio  y con quine procreo cuatro hijo s que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ellas es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  pollos de granja para luego venderlo aliñado en la misma localidad, en esta a actividad lleva  un años y cuatro meses en la que cometa que le va bien  ya que con ello se está apoyando para solventar algunos gastos que  se generan con la educación de sus hijos.

   Lo que lo inspiro ha esta actividad fue su familia para así apoyar a su esposo a sacarlos adelante,  y que mejor que un negocio  como este en ello  también elabora panes para tener más dinero.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda aumentar su ingreso y con el tiempo  temer un lugar en donde pueda vender su  pollo destazados.
texts.en:
Sra. Ma Lucita lives in a place that is near a town that is frequently visited by people from other regions. She is married to Sr. Constancio and has four children who are still her responsibility.

Ma Lucita is a homemaker who is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of farm-raised chickens that she will sell dressed in her town. She has been in business for one year and four months. Ma Lucita says that she has done well and is able to contribute to some of the expenses related to the education of her children.

Ma Lucita’s family inspired her to start this business so that she could help her husband get ahead. What’s even better is that she also makes bread as way of earning more money.

What Ma Lucita desires most is to increase the profits from her business so that in time she will be able to acquire a place where she can sell butchered chickens.

loans.use: to purchase farm-raised chickens that she will sell butchered.

loans.name: Delis

texts.es: Delis  de 49 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena   con su hijo de 14 años y su cónyuge; allí tiene un negocio donde vende mercancías en general, sus clientes son vecinos del barrio y trabajadores de diferentes empresas de la ciudad, a quienes les otorga  créditos por sus compras en plazos que con ellos pacta. Con su negocio ha logrado satisfacer todas sus necesidades básicas, especialmente en momentos en los cuales se ha requerido en su hogar. Delis quiere seguir creciendo y aumentar sus clientes, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr compras oportunas,  con las cuales impactarlos, especialmente en las épocas de mayor repunte comercial, como la que se acerca, el mes del amor y de la amistad, donde todos acuden a ella,  para poder obsequiar a sus seres queridos detalles   con los que muestran su aprecio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará sabanas, accesorios femeninos, perfumes vestido y calzado al por mayor, para ganar descuentos por las compras en  volumen y de contado
texts.en:
Delis is 49 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and their 14-year-old son. She has a business where she sells general merchandise. Her customers consist of neighbors from the area and workers from different companies throughout the city. Delis extends credit to her customers and allows them to pay in installments based on the agreements she sets up with them. Through her business Delis has been able to satisfy all of her basic necessities, especially during times when her family needed her the most. She wants to continue growing and expanding her customer base, but her operating capital is insufficient for taking advantage of buying opportunities that could have a significant impact. As a result, she will miss out on seasons when she could see a spike in her sales, such as during the month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day). During this time, loved ones exchange gifts as a way of showing their appreciation for one another.

For this reason Delis is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to purchase bed sheets, women’s accessories, perfumes, dresses, and shoes in bulk so that she can receive discounts for buying in volume and paying with cash.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets, women’s accessories, perfumes, dresses, and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresita, vive en una localidad en la  en eses lugar hay muchos  árboles  de pinos, ella  es  casada con el señor  Miguel  y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que aun están a su  responsabilidad.
    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra  de   catálogos  para vender cosmeticos, en ésta actividad lleva  un  año en lo que comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello ha tenido  un buen resultado  en sus ingresos de su hogar.
  A ella la motivo una compañera  para  que  venda cosmeticos y se animo, pues así tendría mejores ingresos  y  también apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos.
  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  pueda mejorar su estado económico  y sacar adelante a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresita lives in a town where there are many pine trees. She is married to Sr. Miguel and they have four children who are their responsibility.

Teresita is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of catalogs for selling cosmetics. She has been in this business for one year and says that she is doing well. Teresita has achieved good results with her household income.

Her husband encouraged her to sell cosmetics as a way of bringing in more income. Teresita is also able to help her husband with providing an education for their children. What she desires most from her small business is to improve her financial situation so that her small family can move forward.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics of various brands.

loans.name: La Flor Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama La Flor, está conformado por la señora Gudelia va a comprar con su crédito harina, pintura, bolsa, cinta y aceite para elaborar obleas, la señora Gudelia Elizabeth va a comprar ropa, pantalones, blusas, faldas, las señoras María Teresa y Efrén Angélica van a comprar dulces alegría, palanqueta, cocadas, jamoncillo, gálea, obleas, tamarindo, cocos, camotes, garapiñados, la señora Manuela  Elizabeth va a comprar obleas, bolsas, diurex, cajas para recortar obleas. La señora Gudelia Elizabeth tiene 42 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella es casada tiene tres hijos 2 hombres y una mujer  los dos más pequeños estudian la secundaria, ellos viven en un pueblo muy conocido porque siembran y elaboran el amaranto hacen los dulces palanquetas de alegria, jamoncillo, obleas, granola, palanqueta de cacahuate, dulces de coco, etc. Ella tiene una tienda de ropa y regalos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar ropa pants, blusas, faldas, pantalón para caballero, camisas playeras ropa interior para niños, peluches y uniformes para los niños de primaria y secundaria, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, su hermana le dijo que pusieran una tienda de ropa y regalos y cada una de ellas aporto la cantidad de $7,000.00 y fueron a la ciudad de México a surtirse de mercancía, su negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo e ingresos para la familia y la mercancía no se echa a perder, ella le gusta su negocio porque le ha ayudado económicamente a su familia, a sus hijos no les falta nada como vende uniformes de ahí toma lo que les falte para el uniforme de la escuela, cuando ella sale a cobrar sus hijos le ayudan a atender a los clientes. Su negocio es popular por el buen precio en sus productos y las facilidades de pagos a sus clientes, su negocio enfrenta los desafíos de costos elevados en los uniformes los proveedores les aumentan el precio el iniciar las clases. Ella tiene sus sueños y esperanzas en seguir vendiendo y que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas con Kiva y Fundación Realidad por los préstamos que le dan y que nos sigan apoyando con sus préstamos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called “La Flor” (The Flower) and consists of the following members: • Sra. Gudelia will use her loan to buy flour, paint, bags, ribbons, and oil for making wafers. • Sra. Gudelia Elizabeth will buy clothing, trousers, blouses, and skirts. • Sras. María Teresa and Efrén Angélica will buy amaranth candy, peanut brittle, macaroons, milk candy, wafers, tamarind candy, coconuts, sweet potatoes, and caramelized peanuts. • Sra. Manuela Elizabeth will buy wafers, bags, tape, and boxes for repackaging the wafers.

Sra. Gudelia Elizabeth is 42 years old and studied through the third year of high school. She is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. The two younger children are high school students. They live in a town that is known for growing amaranth used in making amaranth candy, milk candy, wafers, granola, peanut brittle, coconut candy, and other sweets. Gudelia Elizabeth has a store where she sells clothing and gifts. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as trousers, blouses, skirts, men’s slacks, boys' undershirts, plush toys, and uniforms for elementary and high school students. Gudelia Elizabeth started her business four years ago. Along with her sister, she established a clothing and gift shop and each of them contributed $7000 which they used to travel to Mexico City to stock up on merchandise. This business is important to Gudelia Elizabeth because it provides work and income for her family. Also, the goods are not perishable. She enjoys her business because it has helped her family financially. Her children do not lack anything because they take any school uniforms that have not been sold. When Gudelia Elizabeth goes out to collect payments, she takes her children with her so that they can attend to the customers. Her business is popular because of the good prices for her products and the payment options offered to her customers. The challenges her business faces include the rising costs of uniforms from her distributors, who mark up the price before classes start. Gudelia Elizabeth hopes and dreams of continuing her sales so that her children can continue studying.

The members of this group are very grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loans that have been provided and the continued support.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, skirts, men’s slacks, boys' undershirts, plush toys, and school uniforms.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La señora  Lorena   tiene 34 años de edad, se dedica  a la venta de antojitos mexicanos desde  hace cuatro años y a la venta de quesos desde 7 meses con su esposo Venancio que  tiene  la edad de  42 años.
Es una señora muy trabajadora, le gusta ayudar a su esposo en lo necesario cuando su esposo va a ordeñar al campo y regresa, ella se dedica a cuajar la leche y hacer los quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar  insumos para la  elaboración de  comida  como es : jitomate , cebolla , maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, carnes frías  etc.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos una mujer  Maritza  de nueve  años de edad  y dos varones Manuel de doce años de edad y Enrique de  dieciocho  años  de edad .
Esta muy contenta con  su negocio   por que cada día va ganando mas clientes  y su negocio va creciendo , le  gusta mucho tener su propio  negocio por que  le ayuda a su  esposo en los gastos  de la casa  y a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
Uno de sus sueños es poner una fonda  mas grande  que tenga juegos para  niños .
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Lorena, 34, has sold Mexican fast food snacks for the last four years and has sold cheese with her husband, Venancio, 42, for the last 7 months.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help out her husband as much as possible.  When her husband goes out to the fields to milk the cows she takes care of curdling the milk and makes the cheese.

She asked for the loan to buy ingredients to make the food like: tomatoes, onions, corn to make tortillas, cold cuts, etc.

She has three children: a girl, Maritza, 9, and two boys, Manuel, 12, and Enrique, 18.  

She is very happy with her business because she’s acquiring new customers daily and the business is growing.  She likes having her own business because she helps her husband with household expenses and with her children’s education.  

One of her dreams is to set up a larger eatery that also has a play area for the children.  She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it gives to people who want to have their own business to get ahead and help their families.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
La señora  Bonifacia   tiene  treinta y tres años de edad , se  dedica  a la venta de ropa  desde hace siete años y a  la venta de cosméticos desde hace tres años  con su esposo , Rolando   tiene la edad de  cuarenta años quien se dedica  mas a la tienda de ropa.
Es una  señora muy trabajadora  le gusta  ayudar  a su esposo  en lo necesario  cuando  ella  
No tiene tanto trabajo  con los cosméticos y la ropa  le ayuda a su esposo en una tienda de  abarrotes que tienen en su casa .
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  una  mujer  Michel y dos varones Cristopher  y Rolando.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar  más  mercancía para su tienda mas ropa ya que en  ocasiones sus clientes  le piden ropa por  mayoreo  y no cuenta  con los recursos necesario para  hacer el pedido.
Esta muy contenta  con su negocio  cada día gana más clientes  tanto en la ropa  como en cosméticos.
Uno de sus sueños  es hacer su tienda de ropa mas grande para  ofrecer un mejor servicio  a s sus  clientes.
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is 33 years old. She has been selling clothing for seven years and cosmetics for three years along with her husband, Rolando. He is 40 years old and he mostly sells the clothing.

She is a very hardworking woman and she likes to help her husband with things when she isn’t too busy with the cosmetics and clothing. She helps her husband with a small grocery store they have in their house.

She requested the loan to buy more merchandise for her store, more clothing, because sometimes her customers ask her for wholesale quantities of clothing and she doesn’t have the resources necessary to fill those requests. She is very happy with her business. Each day she gains more customers, both for the clothing and the cosmetics. One of her dreams is to have a larger clothing store so she can offer improved service to her customers.

She thanks the Fundación Realidad for the support it gives to people to want to have their own business and get ahead in order to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Banco Comunal Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Mujeres de Confianza está conformado por Lisbeth Isabel, Luisa Reyna, Rosa Eufemia, Inocencia Iris, Leoncia, María Antonia, Blanca Beligna, María Ofelia y Reyna Isabel. En el caso de Leoncia se dedica a la venta de tamales rellenos y cosa d horno tiene más de dos años en esta actividad, lo inicio cuando trabajaba planchando fue con el paso del tiempo que ahorro cierto dinero y fue cuando inicio con la venta d cosa de horno y tamales. El crédito es para la compra de maíz, leña, bicarbonato y bolsa.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres de Confianza" (Reliable Women) communal bank is made up of Lisbeth Isabel, Luisa Reyna, Rosa Eufemia, Inocencia Iris, Leoncia, María Antonia, Blanca Beligna, María Ofelia, and Reyna Isabel.   Leoncia sells stuffed tamales, and baked goods. 

She has been doing this for 2 years. She began her business when she was working doing ironing. Over time, she saved some money, and that was when she started selling tamales and baked goods.  She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood, baking soda and bags.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, baking soda and bags.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
El  señor  Abel  tiene cincuenta y cuatro  años  de edad , se dedica  a su tienda de abarrotes desde  hace siete años .
No tiene  hijos por problemas médicos esta muy contento vive  con su madre y su hermana.
Le gusta mucho su  negocio   ya que le deja  muy buenas ganancias y  así pueda  ayudar  a su mama ya esta es una  señora  mayor  y a si mismo llenar  su inventario para que su tienda no este  escasa de mercancía.
Pidió el préstamo para  comparar  mas mercancía para  su tienda  y también  desea  vender medicamentos como son: galletas, productos enlatados, café , arroz, frijol, jitomates ,cebollas. Y de medicamentos como son :paracetamol, aspirinas , estomaquil, sueros, xl3 etc.  ya que  en su colonia no hay cerca una farmacia 
Uno de  sus  sueños es  tener una farmacia ya que desde  muy joven le gusta lo que es la medicina y gracias a sus ganancias y al apoyo de fundación realidad esta  seguro que lo  va a lograr.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de ellos .
texts.en:
Sr. Abel is 54 years old and has had a grocery store for seven years.  He does not have children due to medical problems but is quite content living with his mother and sister.

He enjoys his business very much since he earns a very good income that allows him to help his mother, who is now older, and to restock his inventory so that his store is not low on merchandise.

He requested the loan to buy more merchandise for his store and he also wants to sell medications. He will buy items such as cookies, tin goods, coffee, rice, beans, tomatoes and onions. Among medications, he will buy acetaminophen, aspirin, Estomaquil [an upset stomach remedy], serums, xl3 [a cold remedy], etc., since there is no pharmacy nearby in his district. One of his dreams is to have his own pharmacy since as a young child he has always liked anything to do with medicine and, thanks to his profits and support from FRAC, he is sure he will make his dream a reality.

He thanks FRAC for the support they have provided to help him get ahead and to realize his dreams and he is grateful to be a part of them.

loans.use: to sell merchandise in his grocery store.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor  Gilberto  tiene  cuarenta  años de edad , se dedica  a la venta de pescado desde hace tres años  junto con su esposa  Rocío .
Tiene la  cantidad de un hijo varón  Carlos Arturo de  dieciocho años de edad estudia  la preparatoria.
Le   gusta mucho su negocio le deja muy buenas  ganancias , el  empezó a vender  junto con su esposa de casa en casa   vendían solamente pescado  ,ahora cuenta con un local propio en el mercado  donde venden también pulpo , ti Chinda , chuleta de pescado y camarón.
Los fines de semana van a otras localidades a vender y entregar pescado por mayoreo.
Pidió el  préstamo para comprar mas pescado  para  poder tener mas ganancias y   ofrecerle una mejor vida  a su esposa y a  su hijo para que pueda terminar sus estudios.
Uno de sus sueños es tener un restaurante de  marisco ya que  sabe hacer comida de  marina.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de ellos .
texts.en:
Señor Gilberto is forty years old.   Along with his wife Rocío, he sells fish for a living.  He has a son named Carlos Arturo who is 18 years old and is a high school student.  He really likes his business because he makes a good living.  He started selling house to house with his wife and they sold only fish.  Now, he has a fixed location in the market where he also sells octopus, clams, fish fillets and shrimp.  On the weekends he goes to other locations to sell and deliver fish he sells wholesale.  

He is requesting a loan to buy more fish so he can increase his earnings and give his family a better life and so that his son can finish his studies.  One of his dreams is to have a seafood restaurant since he knows how to prepare seafood.  He is grateful for the support Fundación has given him to get ahead and fulfill his dreams and for being involved with them.

loans.use: buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Adalgiza

texts.es: Adalgiza de 48 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 16 y 18 años respectivamente.  Adalgiza tiene desde  hace 10 años un negocio de vender mercancía variada, como cosméticos y ropa a través de revistas especializadas, con la cual promueve su venta y también comercializa productos de dulcería.   Su iniciativa surgió para apoyar la gestión de su hogar que hasta ese momento se encontraba a cargo de su esposo. Adalgiza inicialmente tuvo la experiencia de vender jugos y bolis (Congelados a base de frutas naturales), preparado por ella misma, pero gradualmente fue agregando a su mercado natural, mercancía variada, dulces y ahora hasta servicio de telecomunicaciones, actividad en la cual su hijo la apoya. Su sueño es ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales exitosos y esta es el impulso con el cual diariamente se levanta a trabajar.
