Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, comprará cosméticos y dulces, y otras mercancías sobre pedidos, que han hecho sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es lograr capital de trabajo para comprar de contado y en mayor volumen y esto es justamente lo que resolverá con su financiamiento mediante la línea de Kiva. Sus clientes son los niños de los hogares infantiles, las madres comunitarias, vecinas y referidos que sus clientes envían constantemente.
texts.en:
Adalgiza, 48, lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with her husband and two children who are 16 and 18 years old respectively.  Adalgiza has been selling assorted merchandise like cosmetics and clothing via catalogue sales for the last ten years; she also sells candy products.  

She was encouraged to start this in order to help with household expenses which up to then were entirely in her husband’s hands.  Adalgiza initially had the experience of selling juice and "bolis" (frozen fruit treats) that she, herself, made but gradually started adding to her natural market assorted merchandise, candy and now even telephone services, an activity her son helps her with.  Her dream is to see her children become accomplished professionals and this is what motivates her to get up every day and go to work.  

She will use her Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy cosmetics and candy and other merchandise to order that her customers have placed with her.  Her greatest challenge is having working capital to buy everything for cash and in large amounts and this is precisely what the Kiva loan will make possible for her.  Her customers are the children from day care centers, mothers in the community, neighbors and people her customers constantly refer to her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, candy and other merchandise to order.

loans.name: David Israel

texts.es:
David, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, tiene 30 años de edad, de oficio mecánico, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Aprendió este oficio desde los 10 años de edad, cuando el puso su pequeño taller fue con capital propio, este ha sido su primer negocio, el aprendió a reparar vehículos en general pero se especializo en las motos.   
Solicito el crédito para comprar repuestos para vehículos y motos. Con este crédito le permitirá comprar inventario de mejor calidad ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes con precios accesibles y mejorar sus ingresos. Su próxima meta es ampliar su negocio comprar variedad de artículos y repuestos para motos y vehículos .
texts.en:
David lives in the city of Estelí.  He is 30 years old and a mechanic by trade.  He has a three year old child.  

He learned his trade from the age of 10.  When he started his small workshop with his own capital, it was his first business.  He learned to repair vehicles in general, but he specializes in motorbikes.

He is requesting the loan to buy spare parts for his vehicles and motorbikes.  With the loan, he will be able to buy better quality inventory and offer better products to his customers with affordable prices, and so increase his income.

His next goal is to expand his business by buying a variety of items and spare parts for motorbikes and vehicles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for vehicles and motorbikes.

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda, de 47 años, es una mujer entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Deonicio de 48 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.Donatilda desde muy niña trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres. con sus ahorros acumulados mas la herencia que heredo de sus padres hoy tiene 04hectareas de terreno y los trabaja con mucho ahínco y ha logrado volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, cacao, café y hojas de coca productos que luego los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir con los gastos familiares, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los secaderos. Por ello contrata jornaleros para que le apoyen en el traslado. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en corto tiempo. Más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos.Este será su crédito numero 12 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder cumplir con sus objetivos, Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en su anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables.	
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprara plantas de cacao para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar buena ventaja de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Donatilda, aged 47, is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house together with her partner Deonicio, aged 48, and her three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Since she was a very young child, Donatilda has worked in her parents' fields.  From her accumulated savings, and her inheritance from her parents, she today has 4 hectares of fields.  She works the fields with great effort, and has been able to return them to high productivity.  She grows cocoa, coffee and coca products and leaves, which she later sells in the distribution centers in the cities of San Francisco and Quimbiri, where she sells them at wholesale.

Her crops have given her the necessary income to keep herself and to cover the family expenses.  What she most likes about her work is looking after the crops, as she feels very happy doing so. 

She has been doing this work for 23 years, and what she thinks is most difficult is transporting her products from the farm to the dryers.  She hires laborers to help her with the transportation.

With the requested loan, she will buy more cocoa plants to later graft them and take good advantage of the crop in a short time.  Later on, she wants to buy new fields to increase her crops.  This will be her 12th loan with MFP, she is therefore hoping for a small loan to be able to complete her goals.  On the other hand, she agrees to comply once again with her repayments.  Additionally, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank, because all the members are responsible people.

With the 3,000 New Soles, she will buy cocoa plants to graft later on, and to take good advantage of the crop in a short time.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants for later grafting, and to take good advantage of the crop in a short time.

loans.name: Harold Fermín

texts.es: Harold Fermín tiene 64 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más 8 años que tiene este medio de ingreso. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar productos como granos básicos, detergentes, pan, gaseosa, jugos, papel higiénico y otros productos. El financiamiento puede ayudar a aumentar su inventario y además proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que necesitan. Su sueño es convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Harold Fermín is 64 years old; his business is a general store.  He has had this means of income for more than eight years.  The majority of his customers come looking for products like bulk grains, detergents, bread, soda, juice, toilet paper and other products.

The loan can help him to grow his inventory and also provide his clients with what they need.

His dream is to convert his general store into a distributorship.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, detergent, bread, soda, juice, toilet paper and other products.

loans.name: José Noé

texts.es: José Noé tiene 57 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos. Está ubicado en la comarca los zarzales. Tiene más de quince años de tener este negocio. Lo inicio por sus padres ya que ellos le enseñaron este medio d vida para que José aprendiera a mantener a su familia ya que él tiene siete hijos pero actualmente todos trabajan d manera independiente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra d cerdos. El sueña mantener este negocio que le proporciona en pan de cada día.
texts.en:
José Noé is 57 years old; his business is buying and selling pigs.  He lives in the "Los Zarzales" region.  He has been working in this business for more than 15 years.  It was started by his parents, who taught him this means of living so that José could learn to keep his family  He has seven children, but currently they all work independently.  

The goal of the loan is to buy pigs.

He dreams of keeping this business going, as it provides his daily bread.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gloria Matilde

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado por salir adelante, comenzó su negocio con muchas dificultades debido a los pocos recursos que tenia para la adecuación de los equipos, en su negocio gloria presta el servicio de Internet y sala de computo, pero afirma que es complicado ya que el mantenimiento es costoso, por lo cual necesita una buena inversión que le ayude a alcanzar un equilibrio económico.

Sueña con llegar a comprar una casa en Medellín, municipio del departamento de Antioquia, pues es conciente que allí su hijo tendrá mas posibilidades de progresar y como madre soltera ese ha sido su mayor anhelo durante estos 24 años, sin embargo es conciente que actualmente no tiene el capital necesario para comprar 2 equipos de cómputo con lo cual sus ingresos se incrementarán notablemente, es por este motivo que hoy Gloria solicita un crédito que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is an entrepreneurial woman who has worked hard to get ahead in life.  She had a really difficult time starting her business owing to the limited resources she had available to set up her equipment.  Gloria provides an Internet service and IT room but she says that it is difficult because the maintenance costs are high.  For this reason, she needs to make a good investment which will help her achieve financial stability.

Gloria dreams of buying a house in Medellín, in Antioquia department, as she is aware that her son would have more opportunities to make progress there.  As a single mother, that has been her main desire over the past 24 years.  Gloria currently doesn't have the money she needs to buy two computers which would help her increase her income significantly.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two computers

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina es una mujer trabajadora, con ganas de salir adelante y día a día se esfuerza mas y mas para lograr crecer económicamente; ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales ya 2 están casados; la Sra. Catalina se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno en el distrito de Socso, Provincia Camaná; lleva 10 años en esta crianza, el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la construcción de un corral para su ganado ya que no cuenta con uno. Su principal desafío es la distancia que la separa de su familia ya que ella vive en Socso cuidando el ganado y su familia en Camana, sus sueños de la Sra. Catalina es crecer día a día en su negocio y tener más reses y dar una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia. Ella está muy agradecida con el crédito otorgado ya que con ello mejorara su crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina is a hard-working woman with the desire to move ahead in life.  Every day she strives more and more to achieve financial growth.  She is married and has three grown children, two of whom are already married.

Señora Catalina works raising cattle in the district of Socso in Camaná province.  She has been working with livestock for 10 years.

She will invest the loan being offered in the construction of a corral for her cattle, as she doesn't have one.  

Her main challenge is the distance that separates her from her family, as she lives in Socso looking after the cattle, and her family live in Camana.

Señora Catalina's dreams are to grow her business on a daily basis, and to have more cattle and to give her whole family a better quality of life.

She is very grateful for the loan that's been offered, as with it she can improve her cattle raising.

loans.use: to construct a corral for her cattle.

loans.name: Mayra Rafaela

texts.es: Mayra Rafaela tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que posee este medio de vida. Ella es una persona emprendedora por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes. El motivo de crédito es para la compra de ropa en general, perfumes, calzado, cremas, body, tratamientos. Sueña con aumentar cada día su inventario para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Mayra Rafaela has a business selling general merchandise.  She has had this means of living for more than five years.  She is an entrepreneurial person, who is always keeping an eye on what her customers want.

The reason for the loan is to buy clothes in general, perfumes, footwear, creams, and body products.

She dreams of growing her inventory on a daily basis to get more earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothes in general, perfumes, footwear, creams, and body products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lotion, soap, perfume, treatments, shampoo, lip pencils, nail polish, lipstick etc.

loans.name: Norma Petronila

texts.es:
Doña petronila tiene la edad de 50 años, de profesion docente de primaria, casada, su esposo labora como fotografo profesional, madre de tres hijos, el mayor trabaja.
Como objetivo ha sido la mejora  a su casa, que junto a su esposo han construido, y que se han esforzado mucho para hacer posible un techo para sus hijos, hoy en dia doña Petronila fue asendida  a directora del centro escolar, por su buena conducta, por su buen su trabajo, el cual esta sastifecha.
Lo que quiere hacer es un muro perimetral, y quedar dividido con el vecino sus tierras, ya que solo una parte tiene cerrada y la otra parte no, es por eso necesita comenzar el muro, el cual dara seguridad a su propiedad, el cual busca financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde comprara materiales de construccion en arena, bloques, cemento, hierro, piedrin, para comenzar su obra.
texts.en:
Doña Petronila is 50 years old.  She is a primary school teacher by profession, and her husband works as a professional photographer.  She is the mother of three children, the oldest of whom works.

Her objective has been to improve her house, which she built with her husband.  They have worked hard to put a roof over their children's heads.  

Currently Doña Petronila has been promoted to be Director of an educational center, as a result of her good conduct and good work, which she is satisfied about.

What she wants to do is build a perimeter wall to keep her land separate from her neighbor, as only a part is closed off and the other part is not.  This is why she needs to start the wall, which will provide her property with security.  She is looking for financing for Afodenic for this, so she can buy construction materials of sand, cinderblocks, iron and gravel so she can start her work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to start building a perimeter wall to secure her property.

loans.name: Georgina Ancelma

texts.es: Georgina Ancelma tiene 56 años, su actividad es la elaboración de cruces y cuidar tumbas. Hace más de 33 años que tiene este medio de vida, a pesar de ciertos problemas de salud que Gregoria tiene ella tiene que levantarse todos los días para generar ingresos. Es por medio de su hermano que ella se dedicó a este negocio. El objetivo del financiamiento es para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, cera para brillo entre otros.
texts.en:
Georgina Ancelma is 56.  Her work is the making of crosses, and looking after tombs. She has earned her living in this way for 33 years.  In spite of some health problems that Gregoria has, she has to get up every day to earn income. She began her business through her brother. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy cement, sand, bricks, wax polish, and other things.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, and wax polish.

loans.name: Mercedez De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes   vive en  un barrio muy pequeño   que se encuentra a media hora del pueblo, ella es  madre soltera con dos hijos a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de ropas para damas, cabellaros y niños, así poder tener un ingreso del cual ella pueda disponer  y  mejorar su calidad de vida.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por una  compañera quien la invito  a vender junto con ella y así  es como se asocio y  hace poco decidió poner su propio negocio, así tener un mejor ingreso para sostenerse con su familia.

     Lo que más desea  es que con  esta actividad pueda  tener un poco más de ahorros para solventar sus gastos, así  también  agrandar más su actividad.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in a small neighborhood, located half an hour from town.  She is a single mother with 2 children that she is responsible for. She applied for the loan to buy women's, men's and children's clothing.  In this way, she can earn some disposable income and improve her quality of life.  

She was inspired to start her business by a friend who invited her to sell with her, and eventually they became partners. A short time ago she decided to set up her own business, in order to have income to support herself and her family.  

What she most wants is to save some money from this work, in order to meet her expenses, and also to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Justa Rufina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Justa, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos,  tres mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años que estudia en el colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, nos cuenta que su esposo sale todos los días muy temprano a la ciudad de Portoviejo a proveerse de los mejores productos que encuentra en los mercados  mayoristas y también recorre los campos para comprar directamente a los agricultores, luego en su carro recorrer por toda la localidad y sitios cercanos vendiendo sus productos. Lleva más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y con esto  han podido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta la ayuda que le dan y así ella puede ayudar a su esposo en su negocio.
 
Su sueño  tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The 'María Auxiliadora' community bank meets in Sequita parish, in Montecristi.  This is a prosperous canton in Manabí which is full of hard-working, committed people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and devote themselves to their families.

Here we meet 43-year-old Justa who is married and has four children.  Three of her children are grown up but her youngest son is 17 years old and in high school.  All her children still live with her.  Her husband is a driver.

Our friend is requesting this loan for her husband's business selling fruit and vegetables.  She tells us that her husband goes out very early every morning to the city of Portoviejo to stock up with the best produce that is to be found in the wholesale markets.  He also travels through the countryside and buys directly from farmers.  He then travels through the town and nearby places selling his products.  He has been in this business for more than ten years and it has enabled him to get ahead in life.

This loan will be used to buy fruit and vegetables.  Just has been a member of her community bank since it was created.  She likes the help that she receives which enables her to help her husband in his business.

Justa's dream is to own a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Olga Lidia, vive en una región muy linda  ya que las personas hablan dos idiomas y se dedica abordar mantas. Ella es casada con el señor  Tomas y con quien procreo dos  hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes como son: harina, huevo, aceite, queso, entre otros para la elaboración de  pan, en donde lleva practicando un año y le va bien ya que con ello apoya a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa.

   Su motivo a esta actividad fue su familia ya que para darle lo  mejor necesita tener un trabajo el cual pueda  tener una mejor solvencia  económica para sus gatos generados en su hogar.

     Lo que desea es que con el préstamo  pueda mejorar su ingreso para  comprar mas ingredientes y seguir trabajando con la actividad que tanto le gusta.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga Lidia lives is a very pretty region where the people speak two languages and embroider blankets. She is married to Sr. Tomás with whom she has two children who are still dependents.

   She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients, such as flour, eggs, oil and cheese, among other items, in order to make bread, which she has been doing for one year. She has been doing well and is able to help her husband with household expenses.

  Her family has motivated her to do this work since in order to give them the best she needs to have work which generates more income to cover household expenses. 

  With the loan, she wants to be able to improve her income in order to buy more ingredients and continue doing the work that she enjoys so much.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladis vive en un lugar  muy bonito, en donde  las personas cosechan moras, ella es casada con el señor Román y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que  aun están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de refracción para su taxi, así tenerlo en buen estado para que los pasajero se sientan seguros, en esta actividad lleva cuatro años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingresos para su familia.

   Quien la animo a esta actividad fue su esposo quien es el que se encargar de conducir el taxi, así  tener una mejor ganancias para salir adelante.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda mejorar su ingreso para apoyar a sus hijos en su crecimiento, así también comprar material para construir una galerita para estacionar su taxi.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys lives in a very pretty place, where people harvest berries. She is married to Sr. Román with whom she has four children, who are all still dependents.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts for her taxi, thereby keeping it in good condition so that the passengers feel safe. She has been doing this job for four years and notes that it is going well and that it has generated a good income for her family.

The person who encouraged her in this work was her husband who drives the taxi, thereby earning a better income in order to get ahead. 

What she wants most is for this work to increase their income so they can support their children as they grow and also  buy material to build a place to park their taxi.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia, vive en un lugar muy bonito en donde celebra la fiesta de san Andrés, ella es casada con el señor José Alfredo y con quien procreo tres hijos que a un  están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  refracciones y mantenimiento de su taxi, en donde lleva practicando un año y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido una mejor ganancia.
 
    Lo que lo inspiro  a esta a actividad fue su  familia para sí apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  y ve que le está dando resultado.
 
    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad  pueda mejorar  su calidad de vida para seguir adelante con su pequeña familia que es lo más importante para ella.
texts.en:
Señora Ofelia lives in a very beautiful area where they celebrate the festival of San Andrés.  She is married to Señor José Alfredo, with whom she has three children for whom she is still responsible.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of spare parts and maintenance for her taxi.  She has been doing this work for a year, and comments that it's going well for her and that she has earned better profits.

What inspired her in this activity was her family and being able to support her husband with the household income, and she sees that she's getting results.

What she most wants it that she can improve her quality of life with this small business, so that she can continue moving forward in life with her small family, which is the most important thing for her.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts for her passenger taxi.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es: La Sra. Gabina es madre soltera, su esposo la abandono y ella sola ha sabido salir adelante junto a sus hijos; la Sra. Gabina es una mujer muy emprendedora, luchadora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante; ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa, lleva en este negocio más de 2 años; sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y también vende en la feria dominical,  su principal desafío es la ausencia que ha causado el padre de sus hijos ya que sola tiene que sacar adelante a sus vástagos. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería de temporada (invierno). Sus sueños de la Sra. Gabina es tener su propia tienda de ropa y darles a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que es una ayuda grande para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gabina is a single mother.  Her husband left her and she has managed to get herself and her children ahead in life on her own.  Gabina is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who has a great desire to get ahead.  Her business is selling clothes.  She has been in this business for more than two years.  Her main customers are her neighbors and she also sells in the Sunday market.  Her main challenge is the absence of her children's father since it means that she has to bring up her offspring herself.  

Gabina will invest her loan in buying more seasonal (winter) merchandise.  Her dreams are to own her own clothes store and to provide her children with a good education.  She is very grateful for the loan that she is being given as it will be a big help in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal (winter) merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Bertha tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa de habitacion, la venta de ropa que ha venido creciendo su inventario al introducir mas variedad, lograndolo con prestamo en Afodenic.
Es casada, madre de tres hijos, su esposo lobora como albañil, anteriormente ha trabajado en servicios domesticos, parte de su capital al negocio lo obtuvo de sus ahorros.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara, ropa para niñas, ropa interior, zapatos y cosmeticos logrando introducir nuevos productos que le ayude a mejorara sus ventas. parte de sus venta son encargada, al credito, el cual tiene varios años trabajando asi. Contenta por poder seguir proyectandose en su negocio el cual depende sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Bertha has a small business out of her home selling clothes.  She has been increasing her inventory to introduce more variety, which she has achieved with a loan from Afodenic.

She is married and the mother of three children. He husband works in construction.  Earlier she worked in domestic services, and part of her capital for her business came from her savings.

With this new loan, she will buy children's clothing, underwear, shoes, and cosmetics.  She will be able to introduce new products which will help her improve her sales.  Part of her sales are charged on credit; she has been working in this way for several years.  

She is happy to be able to continue building this business on which her children depend.

loans.use: to invest in clothes, shoes and cosmetics, so she can achieve increased sales and have good earnings, to meet her repayment commitments.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemi, es  de una colonia  muy bonita ella es casada con el señor Arisain y con quien procreo  dos hijos que  a un están a su  responsabilidad.

    Ella es ama de casa  y se dedica a la elaboración de  panes  y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la  compra de ingredientes como son: harina, huevo, aceite, queso, entre otros en esta actividad lleva  cinco  años  y cuatro meses  y comenta que le va bien.

     Su motivo ha esta actividad inicio por si  sola ya que   cementa que  comenzó apoyando a una señora y le llamo mucho la tención, fue como  comenzó y da gracias  adiós porque le va bien.

    Lo que más desea es  que con su  negocio y el préstamo pueda trabajar más días  a la semana  para comenzar a comprar material y  componer su horno.
texts.en:
Señora Noemi is from a very beautiful town.  She is married to Señor Arisain with whom she has two children who are still her responsibility.

She manages the home, and works baking bread.  She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients, such as flour, eggs, oil, and cheese among other things.  She has been working in this activity for five years and four months, and comments that it's going well.

Her motive for starting this business? She says that she started it on her own; she started off helping out another woman, and it caught her attention. This is how she got her start, and she gives thanks to God because it is going very well for her

What she most desires is that with her business and the loan, she will be able to work more days in the week.  She will start by buying ingredients and repairing her oven.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Genny Amparo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Genny, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos, tres de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y los tres menores que estudian en colegio y escuela, cuatro de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante y agricultor.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedican a  la venta de frutas y legumbres, para lo cual se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta donde vende sus productos por las calles en un triciclo, él vende productos que el mismo cultiva y también compra en el mercado de Manta los productos que le hacen falta, trabaja los días martes, jueves y sábados ya que los otros días se dedica a la agricultura. Lleva realizando esto por más de 15 años y esta es la fuente del sustento de la familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The  members of the "María Auxiliadora" communal bank meet in Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province. It is full of hard-working, committed people, who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish where the residents are decent people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families. 

This is where we met Genny, who is 45, married, with 6 children. Three of her children are adults, and the three youngest go to school; 4 of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant and farmer.  She is undertaking the loan for her husband's business.  He sells fruits and vegetables. For this, he travels to the city of Manta, where he sells his products in the street from a tricycle.

He sells products that he himself grows, and also buys products he needs in the Manta market. He works Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, since on the other days he farms. He's been doing this for more than 15 years, and this is the main source of livelihood for the family. This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables.  

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and likes the easier terms for getting loans. Her dream is to have a well-constructed house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
La señora Minerva, vive e en lugar muy bonito ya que ay una laguna muy grande  que  es visitado por muchas personas, ella vive en unión  libre con el señor  Enrique y con quien procreo  un hijo que aun esta a su responsabilidad.

    Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de pollos, en donde lleva practicando  dos años y siete meses en la que comenta que le va bien.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad inicio por si sola  así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa a un que su familia es pequeña quiere darle lo mejor.

      Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad pueda tener sus ahorros para seguir trabajo  hasta que dios le preste vida y seguir apoyando a su hijo en su educación.
texts.en:
Minerva lives in a very beautiful place next to a large lake. Many people go there to visit. She is in a common law marriage with Enrique, with whom she has a son whom she is still raising.  

She is a housewife who asked for the loan to invest in buying ans selling chickens. She has been doing this for two years and seven months and says that it is going well for her.  

Her inspiration for this activity started with herself. She did it to support her husband with the household income, because her family is small and she wants to give it the best. 

Her greatest wish is to be able to have some savings with this activity so she work for as long as she lives and keep supporting her son in his education.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of chickens to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: Rómulo tiene 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene 8 hijos actualmente sigue apoyando a dos de ellos ya que están estudiando. El señor Rómulo se dedica a diversas actividades, actualmente brinda servicio de jardinería y carpintería, son trabajos eventuales que el cumple ya que nos manifiesta que no cuenta con un trabajo estable, es por ello que ha tenido que esforzarse  mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, para obtener un ingreso mas, como actividad segundaria y con los conocimientos que tenia decidió dedicarse   a la apicultura (crianza de abejas), gracias a su trabajo a podido mejorar su vivienda y darles educación a sus hijos. Su mayor deseo  es que sus hijos sean profesionales y seguir trabajando positivamente. Con el último crédito que solicito va invertir en la crianza de abejas comprando cajones, mascaras, ceras y panales. Rómulo es integrante de  la Alcancía Comunal “Las Talentosas” la cual cuenta con 07 socios que  son personas empeñosas que su mayor deseo es de seguir progresando cada día, ellos agradecen al Programa- Prosperidad.Flor  tuvo que retirarse temprano por motivo de trabajo es por ello que lo adjuntamos  a la fotografía.
texts.en:
Rómulo, 64, is married and has 8 children; he currently has two of them dependent on him since they are still in school.  Rómulo does a variety of things; he currently provides gardening and carpentry services.  These are occasional jobs that he carries out because he tells us that he does not have steady employment.  Because of this, he’s had to exert much effort to support his family.  

In order to have an additional source of income, as a secondary activity and thanks to knowledge he had, he decided to go into apiculture (beekeeping).  Thanks to his work he’s managed to improve his house and provide his children with an education.  His greatest wish is that his children become professionals and to continue to work positively.

With this most recent loan he requested he will invest in his beekeeping buying boxes, masks, wax and hives.  Rómulo is a member of the “Las Talentosas” (The Talented Ones) communal bank which has 7 members who are dedicated people whose greatest wish is to continue making daily progress.  They all thank the Prosperidad Program.

Flor had to leave early because of work so that’s why we added her picture.

loans.use: to buy boxes, masks, wax and hives.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Basilia; tiene 51 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos todos ellos estudiantes en diferentes ramas y en el colegio los últimos;  La socia se dedica a embotellar agua, la socia se dedica  embotellar agua mineral, la socia tiene una planta de procesamiento de agua es pequeña y ella trabaja en esto junto con sus familia, la socia está encargada de el proceso final que es el embotellamiento de agua y la verificación final de las maquinas. La socia es socia del banco comunal  y trabajando con este sistema de banca ella empezó a crecer poco a poco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una maquinaria para el embotellamiento de agua.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "COMUZONE II." The bank is located in Huanchac District, in Cusco Province and Department.

Basilia is 51 years old and married. She has 4 children, each of them students; the younger ones are in secondary school and the others are in different majors. Basilia bottles mineral water and has a small water-processing plant that she runs with her family. She is in charge of the last step, which is the bottling of the water and the final check-up of the equipment.

Basilia is a member of the communal bank, and she started to grow little by little working with this bank system. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a machine to bottle water.

She is grateful for the support offered and accordingly she is committed to fulfilling the payment installments in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a machine to bottle water.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac, en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La  socia Clara; tiene 52 años D. edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 6 hijos y son todos ellos estudiantes;  la socia se dedica a administra su tienda D. abarrotes, la socia invierte todo el crédito en la compra D. productos D. primera necesidad que son los productos que salen diario, entre estos están, leche, huevos, azúcar, arroz, fideos, aceite, harinas y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D.  productos D. primera necesidad como leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, huevos, entre otros.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Comuzone II” communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

Member Clara, 52, is married and has six children, all students.  She runs her grocery store.  She invests the entire loan in the purchase of basic need items which are the ones that sell daily.  Among them are: milk, eggs, sugar, rice, noodles, oil, flour and others.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of basic need items like milk, rice, sugar, noodles, oil and eggs, among others.

She is grateful for the support provided and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ana Isela

texts.es:
Ana Isela  es de una colonia que está muy cerca del pueblo que se llama coapilla, es un lugar muy bonito, ella es soltera  tiene diesi nueve años  de edad y vive con sus  padres.

     Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ropas para luego venderlo  fuera de su colonia en la que comenta que le  va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado sus ingresos para poyara su  familia.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  por una tía  ya que necesita tener sus propios ingresos para poyar a sus papas  con en la educación de sus hermanitos.

      Lo que desea es que con ello  pueda  ir teniendo sus propios ahorros para  comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta para ella.
texts.en:
Ana Isela is from  neighborhood that is very close to a town called Coapilla. It is a very beautiful place. She is single and nineteen year old and lives with her parents.  

She asked for the loan to invest in buying clothing to later sell outside of her neighborhood. She tells us that it has gone well for her and she has improved  her income to support her family.      

She was inspired to do this activity by an aunt, since she needs to have her own income to help her parents with her siblings education.   

What she wants is to have her own savings to buy a few things she needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Felix Amada

texts.es:
Doña Felix Amada, tiene su negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, venta de nacatamales. Pues lleva dieciocho años, logrando mantener sus ventas, es madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales la apoyan con el trabajo.
Comenzo con capital propio, luego introdujo, capital atraves del financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo de gran oportunidad para aumentar las ventas, captar mas clientela al ofertar mas producto en la venta de carne, nacatamaes, fritos, manteca.
Es un trabajo agitado, pero da, para sobresalir con los gastos del hogar, tambien por que desde joven comenzo las venta y se ha acostumbrado al trabajo de preparacion de la carne del cerdo.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de un cerdo y compra de verduras para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Felix Amanda sells pork, and she sells nacatamales (a traditional Central-American dish wrapped in leaves and steamed).  She has been doing this for 18 years, and she has managed to keep up her sales.  She has four children, and they support her in her work.

She started with her own capital, and later she put in funds from the loan from Afodenic.  This is a great opportunity to increase sales and gain more customers by offering more products to sell along with the sale of pork, nacatamales, fried food, and lard.

It is hectic work, but it gives what is needed for the household expenses.  Also, she started the business as a young woman, and she has become accustomed to the work of preparing pork.

Now, with this new loan, she will buy a pig.  She will also buy vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy a pig to butcher and vegetables to increase her sales.

loans.name: Carmen Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a Carmen, tiene 22 años de edad, está recién casada y todavía no tienen hijos. Su esposo es albañil pero por el momento no trabaja porque sufrió un accidente.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado ganar su propio dinero y ahora con lo que su esposo no trabaja es quien se hace cargo de los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja en una fábrica en la ciudad de Manta y también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta en sus horas y días libres aunque también vende a sus compañeros de trabajo. La mercadería la compra en Manta o Portoviejo.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos  y le gusta porque con los créditos pudo salir adelante en momentos muy difíciles. 

Sus sueños es seguir adelante y tener una bonita familia.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, that’s full of dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest and only know how to work and devote themselves to their families.  We met Carmen, 22, here.  She’s recently married and has no children yet.  Her husband’s a bricklayer but isn’t working at present because he had an accident.

Our friend is a very tenacious, hardworking woman who has always liked to earn her own money and now that her husband isn’t working she’s in charge of household expenses.  She works in a factory in the city of Manta and also sells all types of clothing.  She sells door to door during her free time and days off although she also sells to her coworkers at work.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or in Portoviejo.

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for two cycles and she likes it because the loans helped her get through very difficult times.  Her dream is to continue to make progress and to have a beautiful family.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Campo Verde Group

texts.es:
La señora Mari Cleidy, es casada con el señor  Francisco Javier y con quien procreo  un hijo de la edad de   dos meses y vive en un lugar muy bonito  en donde celebran la fiesta de la virgen de candelaria el 2 de febrero.

    Ella  es ama de casa y es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación realidad y es para invertirlo en la compra de  ingredientes como son: harina, huevo, queso, aceite, entre otros para la  elaboración  de pan. En donde lleva practicando  tres mese y le va bien.

    En esta actividad se inspiro ya que su abuela le pidió ayuda a elaborarlo y le gusto y es como se asocio con ella  para trabajar juntas así tener un mejor ingreso y apoyar a su esposo en la solvencia económica.

     Lo que más se desea  es que con esta actividad pueda continuar trabajando para tener sus propios ahorros para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

     Las persona que también integran en el grupo son: las señora  Antonia quien solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tostadas, así también se integra la señora  Rasura quien  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de cosméticos y así  también en su pequeño negocio de abarrotes  y por último se integra también la señora  Amelia quien invierte en su molino.
texts.en:
Mari Cleidy is married to Francisco Javier with whom he has a two month old son. She lives in a very pretty place where the celebrate the festival of the  Virgen de Candelaria on February 2. 

She is a housewife and this is the first time that she has asked for a loan from the Foundation. It is to invest in buying ingredients such as: flour, eggs, cheese, oil and more to make bread. She has been doing this for three months and it is going well for her.  

She was inspired to do this activity by her grandmother who asked for her help doing it. She liked it and is a partner. They work together to have more income and she helps her husband with expenses.

What she wants the most to to be able to keep working in this activity to be able to have her own savings for her household expenses.

The other members of the group are: Antonia, who asked for the loan to invest in buying ingredients to make tostadas, and Rasura, who will invest the loan in buying cosmetics and to invest in her small store. Lastly, there is Amelia, who will invest in her mill.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor de 28 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia.Flor con el apoyo de sus padres abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ella abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar mayores consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes, ya  lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien y gracias a ello apoya en los gastos de alimentación de sus padres, con el dinero del crédito comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega.Este será su primer crédito de Flor  y esta muy contenta de saber que contara con el apoyo crediticio de los financistas y a la vez agradece a las socias de su banco comunal por permitirle trabajar con ellas.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mercaderías como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc.
texts.en:
Flor, 28, is a young, single, cheerful, hardworking woman who wants to succeed in life.  She lives in her own house and what she most wants is to earn better income to provide her future family with economic stability.  

With help from her parents, Flor opened a grocery store where she offers basic need items.  Her stand generates good profits.  She opens up for business very early in the morning awaiting her first buyers.  She mentions that the key to securing more consumers is providing kind service and to help them with their purchases.  

What she enjoys about her work the most is pleasing her customers.  She’s been in this business for four years now and considers the most difficult part having to remain on foot all day.  She does well in her store and thanks to this she’s able to help pay for her parents’ food.  She will use the money from the loan to buy large amounts of stock merchandise for her sales stand.  In time, she hopes to be able to enlarge her house and thus enlarge her store too.

This will be Flor’s first loan and she’s very happy to know that she will have financial support.  At the same time, she thanks her fellow communal bank members for allowing her to work with them.  She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise like: sacks of rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: El Tesoro Group

texts.es:
La señora  Gloria Isabel, vive en un barrio  muy  grande en donde celebran la fiesta de santo domingo los días 24 y 25 de abril, lo celebran en grande ya que esta comunidad tiene un ex convento muy  bonito. Gloria es casada con  el señor Jorge Enrique y con quien procreo  tres hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella es la primera vez que solicita  un préstamo en fundación  y es  para invertirlo en la compra  de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos, lleva practicando esta actividad seis meses, y comenta que le va muy bien  ya que con ello ha  tenido  un buen resultado.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó  por querer apoyar a su esposo con los ingreso de la casa, así también darle lo más necesario a su pequeña familia que es su motivo de trabajar para salir adelante.

   Lo  que más desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo pueda  aumentar sus ingresos como también a horrar para  comprar un local e donde puedas vender más cómoda.
  
     La persona que integran en el grupo son: la señora  Glafira quien invierte el préstamo e  la compra de  ingredientes para la elaboración de panes, así también se integra el señor Abinael  quien invertirá  en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
Gloria Isabel lives in a very large neighborhood where they celebrate the Fiesta de Santo Domingo on the 24th and 25th of April.  They celebrate in a big way because this community has a very pretty former convent.

Gloria is married to Jorge Enrique, and they have three children who are still their responsibility.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from the Fundación.  The loan is to buy ingredients to make tacos.  She has been practicing this business activity for six months.  She says that it is going very well for her because she has had a good result.

The inspiration for this business started because she wanted to help her husband with the household income.  That way she also gives her little family what is most needed.  Her motive for working is to get ahead.

What she wishes for most of all is that with the loan she will be able to increase the income from her small business.  Also, she wishes to save in order to buy a place where she is able to sell more comfortably.

The members of this group are:  

Glafira will use the loan to buy the ingredients to make bread.

Abinael will buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, tortillas, and oil, among others to make tacos.

loans.name: Indaura Ismelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Indaura, tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tienen 8 hijos, 7 de sus hijos son mayores y el menor  de 17 años estudia en un colegio a distancia, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga tiene un local en su casa en el cual  vende artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días  desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando sus clientes necesitan algo. Tiene su negocio ya por más de 15 años y nos cuenta que le gusta mucho ya que en él se entretiene.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar como: regalos, tarjetas, peluches  y útiles escolares. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 20 ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños son aumentar su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, that’s full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.  Indaura, 57, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has 8 children. Seven of her children are adults and the youngest is 17 years old and goes to a distance learning school.  Two of her children still live with her.   Her husband’s a merchant.

Our friend has a locale at home where she sells general merchandise and stationary items.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm and sometimes even later when her customers need something.  She’s had the business for over 15 years and she tells us that she likes it very much because it keeps her entertained.

This loan is to buy general merchandise like: gift items, greeting cards, stuffed toys and school supplies.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for 20 cycles and she likes it because of the additional services the institution provides.  Her dream is to increase business and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy gift items, greeting cards, stuffed toys and school supplies.

loans.name: Higinia Alejandrina

texts.es: La Sra. Higinia es madre separada de su esposo hace 20 años, es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante sola con sus hijos; la Sra. Higinia se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cerveza, gaseosas) y a la venta de comida; ya lleva en el negocio más de 4 años. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en el mantenimiento de su negocio (compra de mesas, andamios y vitrinas) para así tener  mayores ventas. Su sueño de la Sra. Higinia es hacer crecer su negocio y comprarse otra casa. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que contribuye a mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Higinia is a mother separated from her husband for the last twenty years.  She’s a tenacious woman who has managed to succeed by herself with her children.  She sells beverages (beer, soft-drinks) and food.  She’s been in business four years.  She is going to use the loan granted to her to maintain her store (to buy tables, shelving and display cases) to increase sales.  Higinia’s dream is to make her business grow and to buy herself another house.  She is very grateful for the loan granted because it contributes to her improving her business.

loans.use: to buy tables, shelving and display cases.

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 11 y 9 años de edad, todos estudian en escuela. Su esposo ebanista.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual tiene taller de ebanistería en su casa, allí el transforma la madera en bellísimas obras tales como muebles en todas las formas y modelos, puertas, camas, ventanas entre otras muchas cosas más, nos cuenta que el trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes que siempre lo visitan por la calidad de su trabajo y porque es muy puntual en sus entregas. Tiene muy buena clientela por lo cual nunca le ha faltado trabajo en los 15 años que tiene su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, clavos, lacas, pega, lijas y otras materias primas para elaborar sus obras. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, that’s full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.  We met Gloria, 30, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 12, 11 and 9 years of age; all of them are in school.  Her husband’s a cabinet maker.

Our friend took out this loan for her husband’s business.  He has a home-based cabinet making shop where he transforms wood into beautiful works like all shapes and models of furniture, doors, beds, windows and many other things.  She tells us that he works based on prior orders placed by his customers that always come by to see him because of the quality of his work and because he’s always very punctual with his deliveries.  He has quite a good clientele so he’s not lacked work for the fifteen years he’s been in business.

This loan is to buy wood, nails, lacquer, adhesive, sand paper and other raw materials to manufacture his items.  This is the communal bank’s second cycle and she likes it because getting loans is very easy.  Her dream is to provide her children with the best and that they never lack anything.

loans.use: to buy lumber, nails, lacquer, files, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Evelyn

texts.es: Rosa usará el crédito para pagar un postgrado, en un futuro ella quiere ser regente farmacéutico de alguna distribuidora o enseñando en la universidad. Aspira tener un mejor ingreso económico y también mejorar su estatus académico. Esta es su segunda carrera universitaria, la primera que estudi{o fue medicina pero por motivos económicos no pudo pagar una especialización, tiene una responsabilidad económica en su familia y no puede pagar este curso de una sola vez
texts.en: Rosa will use the loan to pay for a postgraduate.  In the future she wants to be a regional pharmacist of a distributor or teach at the university. Rosa aspires to have a better income and also improve her academic status. This is her second university degree, the first was in medicine but for financial reasons she couldn't afford a specialization.  She has a financial responsibility to her family and can not afford this course all at once.

loans.use: to pay for a postgraduate in Pharmaceutical Sciences.

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, ella tiene 63 años de edad, hace algunos años su querido esposo falleció y  de esa relación tuvo 13 hijos que fueron su fuerza para seguir adelante, todos sus hijos  ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos aun viven  en su casa.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida se dedica a  la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación, trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana en las mañanas ya que es más fresco y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes.  Ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería la compra en Quito y Guayaquil ya que dos de sus hijos viven allá y le mandan la ropa cuando necesita.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años  y le gusta porque  sus compañeras del grupo son muy solidarias y se entretiene en las reuniones. 

Sus sueños son gozar de una vejez muy feliz y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The  María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the Sequita parish, part of  Montecristi, in the prosperous Manabita canton.  It is made up of hardworking people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish where the people are honest and know how to work and take care of their families.

Mercedes, 63, lives here and some years ago her dear husband passed away.  They had 13 children who were their reason to strive to get ahead.   All of their children are grown now but two still live at home.

To make a living our friend sells all kinds of clothing by going house to house, and also by taking orders that her customers place ahead of time.  She works three or four days a week in the mornings since it is cooler, and she can also sell to her customers from her house. She sells on credit and 
collects once a week.  She buys the merchandise in Quito and Guayaquil since two of her children live there and they send her the clothing when she needs it.

She will use this loan to buy: pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.  She has been in the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it because the members are united and they enjoy themselves at the meetings.

Her dreams are to have a happy old age and good health.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta por la responsabilidad y puntualidad con los créditos. Tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y  5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hace cinco años con la ayuda de uno de los créditos que recibió de La Fundación Espoir pudo adecuar un local para poner una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, la cual mantiene hasta la actualidad y que ha ido crecido con el paso de los días, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que este es un negocio que lo realiza al mismo tiempo que realiza las labores del hogar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos y que  su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, that’s full of hardworking people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish inhabited by honest people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.

María is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the sergeant at arms and likes it because of the responsibility and punctuality of the loans.  She’s 30 years old, married and has two children who are 10 and 5 years old; both go to school.  Her husband’s a driver.

Five years ago with help from a loan from Fundación Espoir and wanting to help her husband meet household expenses, our friend was able to set up a grocery store at home.  She still has it and it has grown over time.  She works there daily from 6am until 8pm.  She tells us that it’s a business she runs while doing her household chores.

She will use the loan to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic staples.  Her dream is that the business grows more each day and to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Arelly Cristina

texts.es: Arelly tiene muchos deseos de superación, pero su situación económica no le permite poder pagar su curso de titulación por el elevado costo que éste tiene, por lo que solicita el crédito para poder finalizar sus estudios universitarios, dentro de algunos años se ve como una profesional ejerciendo su carrera, gracias al sacrificio de sus padres ha podido desarrollar sus estudios. Le inspira su familia porque ellos le han apoyado y han creido en ella.
texts.en: Arelly really wants to improve her situation, but her economic position doesn't leave her enough to pay for her expensive college courses.  So she is requesting the loan to be able to finish her studies at the University.  Within a few years, she expects to be a professional working in her field.  Thanks to her parents' sacrifices, she has been able to advance in her studies.  Arelly's family inspires her because they have supported and believed in her.

loans.use: to pay for her college courses.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 1 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es albañil. Para ella este es su tercer ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda.

Es una gran ama de casa que además de cuidar su hogar y sus pequeños hijos también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana y esto lo hace por las tardes cuando su esposo está en casa y cuida de sus pequeños,  sus  productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva con su negocio un año y empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.

En la fotografía está nuestra socia con su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora Community Bank meeds in the La Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous area in Manabi province. Montecristi is full of hard-working people who are proud of their heritage. People who live in La Sequita are honest, industrious, and care for their families. 

Alexandra lives in this area. She is 25 years old, in a common law relationship, and has three children, ages 7, 4 and 1. Her eldest is in school, and her partner is a mason. This is Alexandra's third term with the Auxiliadora Community Bank, which she likes because the loans she has received have been a big help.  

Alexandra is a wonderful homemaker who not only cares for her residence and her children, but also sells all kinds of clothing. Her business is door-to-door, and she works three days a week. She only works in the evenings, when her partner is home to watch the kids. She takes orders on credit and collects payments every weekend. Alexandra has been running her business for one year, beginning with the first loan she received from her community bank. 

She will use this new loan to buy more merchandise, including pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  

Her dream is to own her own home, because she currently lives with her in-laws. 

In the photograph, our new member is holding her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Magaly Lucia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Magaly, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un  bebe  de 1 año. El marido es ebanista.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el mismo que tiene un taller de ebanistería en su casa, él realiza una gran variedad de productos con la madera como por ejemplo: camas, muebles, puertas, cajoneras, anaqueles entre otras muchas obras, trabajan a base de encargos de personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y cuando tiene mucho trabajo para entregar hasta más tarde.
 
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas, selladores entre otros productos que se necesitan para fabricar sus productos. Para ella este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque con los créditos puede ayudar a su esposo y contribuir al hogar. 

Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi in the prosperous canton of Manabita.  It is full of hard-working people who are dedicated and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

In this area lives Señora Magaly.  She is 22 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has a one year old baby.  Her partner is a carpenter.

She is taking the loan to help her partner, who has a carpentry workshop in their home.  He makes a large variety of products from wood, such as - for example - beds, furniture, doors, drawers and shelves among many other things.  He works on the basis of orders from the people who come to their establishment.  He works everyday from 8 a.m. through to 4 p.m., and when there is a lot of work to deliver, he works late.

This loan is to buy wood, paints, and sealants, among other products that they needs for making their products.  This is her fourth lending cycle with the Communal Bank, and she is grateful because the loans can help her partner and contribute to the household.

Her dream is to have her own home, as she lives in her in-laws' house.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, sealants, etc.

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana está formado por 9 mujeres y  1 hombre, quienes en su mayoría viven por el cantón Habón, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en varias actividades. Su gente es tradicionalista y mantienen la cultura de sus padres. Nuestras socias son personas amables, carismáticas y luchadoras que día a día trabajan para salir adelante y darles un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Blanca, vive hace varios años en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal. Tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Blanca se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y Esika, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y se dedica a sus ventas todo el tiempo que tiene libre de domingo a domingo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería para su negocio.
 
Su meta es de tener otro negocio propio, como una tienda.

Por esta ocasión nos acompaña en la fotografía el esposo de una de las socias, el Señor esta vestido con una chompa verde con mangas negras.
texts.en:
Communal bank "Entrada a Chunazana" is comprised of nine women and one man. Most of them live in the canton of Habón, a place of cold climate. People there work in sales, agriculture and raise animals, and a lot of them work in the city of Cuenca in various activities. People there are traditional and keep up their parents' culture. The members are kind and charismatic people - fighters who work every day in order to get ahead and give their families a better future.
One of the members of this group is Blanca, who has lived in the city of Cuenca for many years. This is her second loan with the communal bank. She's 23 years old and married, and from her marriage she conceived a 3-year-old son. Her husband is a privacte sector employee. They don't own a house of their own, so they rent.
Blanca sells cosmetics of the brands Yanbal and Esika. She has been doing this for the past two years and makes her sales during all of the free time she gets, from Sunday to Sunday.
She will use the money from this loan to purchase perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry for her business. Her goal is to have another business of her own, such as a store.
On this occasion, the group is joined in the photograph by the husband of one of the female members, the gentleman wearing a green coat with black sleeves.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en: Chinzorig is 44 years old and lives with his three children and wife in Tosontsengel in Mongolia. His wife helps the family business and also plants vegetables. He started his family business in 2009 with his wife by selling retail goods and materials. He and his wife used to manage different types of service and micro- businesses. His current family business, a carpentry business, is stable. He is planning to expand his business and to build his own house. He is a diligent and calm man who says, "My eldest daughter is becoming a college student. I need to pay her tuition fee." In the future, he is planning to expand his wife's business by opening a vegetable shop. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more wood to make furniture.

loans.use: To buy more wood.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en:
Batbileg is 30 years old and lives with his two daughters and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His first daughter is a high school student. His wife is currently staying at home and taking care of their youngest daughter. 

Batbileg started to repair cell phones and sell spare parts. Now he rents a commercial space at the local market and provides services. He is planning to expand his business and his rented space at the market by selling a diverse range of cell phone parts and services. Last month, he brought spare parts and phones from Erlian city, China. His monthly sale volumes are between 1,500,000 to 2,000,000 MNT. His monthly income is from 300,000 to 500,000 MNT and is spent for family consumption. His business is the only income source. 

With the profits he earned, he purchased a piece of land and yurt in April 2011. He is a very open-minded and hardworking man who says "I want to expand my business in the near future." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase cell phones and spare parts for phones from China.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and spare parts

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter is a college student and the other two are high school students. Narantsetseg started her business by selling retail goods at the local market. She sells home product such is a dipper, pot, sewing string, needle, sink etc. She has many years of experience in her field. With the profits she earns, she pays the college tuition fee of her daughter. She is a a diligent woman who is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more products and goods, such is a toilet paper, towel, dipper to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products, such is a toilet paper, towels and diapers, for resale

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 41 years old and lives with her three children and husband in a private house in a Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her first son is a college sophomore at the Labor University and two other sons are high school students. Her husband was an assistant driver in rural transportation and became a driver in April 2011. Currently, he is fixing his broken car and soon will go for the domestic transportation. If he starts working, his monthly salary will be between 500,000 MNT and 800,000 MNT. 

Altantsetseg started her business by selling lunches and dinners at the local train station from 1996 to 2004. Then, with the profits she earned, she started to sell meat at the Baldanzasag market. She sells 2 or 3 goat or sheep meats on a daily basis. She never changed her sales location and has made many regular clients and sales channels. She is very experienced in her field. 

Altantsetseg became a driver in 2009 after completing the driver's training course. Now she saves her business profits to her savings bank account at Xas bank. She is a loyal customer of Xas bank.
