She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to pay her son's tuition fee and to buy more meat to increase her sales turnover.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fee and buy more meat for her business

loans.name: Gulbarshin

texts.en:
Gulbarshin is 45 years old and lives with her two children in a house in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her two children are both college students. 

Gulbarshin started to sell clothes in 1999 at the local market. From 2002, she diversified her business and started to operate a grocery shop business. She has gained much business experience in her field. With her profits earned from the business, Gulbarshin pays the college tuition fee of her children. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says "I will devote my everything to my children." 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase clothes and more grocery products from Tashkent due to the start of the school new year.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and more grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain the rice production

loans.name: Erdenemunh

texts.en: Erdenemunh is 48 years old and lives with his four children and wife in a ger in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His eldest son is a college student. His other two children are high school students. The youngest daughter attends kindergarten. His wife plants and sells vegetables. Erdenemunh started his business in 2009 with his wife by making wooden furniture. Currently he is doing his business at his home. He is planning to expand his business, buy a car for his family and build a house to live in. He sells wooden products and furniture. He is a diligent, self-confident, and open-minded man who says, "I want to develop my business along with this loan. I have many plans to accomplish in my life and some of them are already on the way. I want to be a successful businessman." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and materials

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La señora Rita tiene la edad de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto año de primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Bulmaro que trabaja de operador de maquinas, ellos tiene 3 hijos que se ya se encuentra casados, ella y su familia viven en una region que se  caracterisa por ser una zona cañera.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años tal vez un poco mas decidio inicar con su propio negocio de venta de ropa pues queria apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Rita realiza sus ventas de ropa casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos  dice que algunas veces levanta pedidos, cuando  los surte los entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos,ella nos dice   que cuida a sus clientes y les da un trato amable ya que  asi aumentaran dia a dia sus ventas..

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de ropa interior para dama y caballero, vestidos, blusas, faldas, playeras, calcetines, shorts, camisas, pantalones para su posterior venta.

Doña Rita espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere, tambien nos platico que se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por la confianza que a brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Rita is 54 years old and has a 4th grade education.  She is married to Señor Bulmaro who works as a machine operator.  They have 3 children that are married.  She and her family live in a region known as Zona Cañera.  

She tells us that a little more than 3 years ago she decided to start her own business selling clothing because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and to be able to have a better quality of life.  

Doña Rita sells her clothing door to door to her friends and neighbors in her community.  She says that she takes care of her customers and gives them friendly service since this is how she increases her sales every day. 

She needs this loan to buy undergarments for men and women, dresses, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, socks, shorts, shirts, and pants for subsequent sales.  Doña Rita hopes that with this investment her business will prosper.  

She also tells us that she is very grateful to Fundación for the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon is an old father of three children living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Presently, he is a farmer. He is married to Keo who has been generating her income by selling soft drinks and groceries. From this business, his wife gains about $2 each day. His wife wants to expand her business but she lacks capital, so she has decided with him to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva to purchase more soft drinks and groceries. His wife believes that this loan will make her business grow, gain more profit and meet prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and groceries.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina shows patience and determination in achieving her dreams. She would like to give a better life to her family. Educating all her children is one of the ways she has been thinking of. This will be a great legacy to pass on to them and will help improve their own family someday.

Josefina did not finish her education. To generate income, she keeps busy all day long managing her sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. This is what occupies her daily schedule. She had been operating this business for almost three years and she earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month in this business. 

She had six children. Three of her children are attending school and might need daily allowances. Josefina is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar and cooking oil to sell in her store. She needs to stock more commodities in her store to increase the capacity of sales from her business.  From this time on, Josefina could generate more income and save enough money for unexpected expenses from the school.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Nowadays, life becomes difficult due to the high cost of commodities and transportation, but according to Estrelita, "Life must go on whatever happens." She is a hardworking mother who is now 55 years old and has seven adult children. Through her patience and sacrifices, most of their children are graduated from college. Rice farming is the main source of their income. Her husband is her only partner in managing their rice fields. They have been in this business for almost 40 years, earning a profits of 25,000 Philippines pesos (P) in every harvest season.

They aimed to increase their yields this coming harvest season so that they will earn a higher income to acquire their daily needs and save for future emergencies. But due to inadequate capital, Estrelita is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice production. They believe that the loan will help a lot to increase their yields, and they hope that in the future, they will become financially stable as they continue to work and strive.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es:
La señora Ruperta que tiene la edad de 58 años, ella no estuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se encuentra casada con el señor Conrado que trabaja en el campo como jornalero, ellos tuvieron 4 hijos los cuales 3 trabajan y uno trabaja, ellos viven en una zona cañera dela cuenca del papaluapan.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de tortillas y masa porque quiere apoyar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar, tambien porque dice que como esta la situacion economica el dinero ya no alcanza.

Doña Ruperta realiza su venta de tortillas todos los dias, ella un dia antes pone a herbir el  maiz y al dia siguiente se  levantan muy temprano a prender el molino de niztamal, moler el maiz y despues ponerse a hacer sus tortillas que en ocasiones ya son pedidos de sus clientes pero que en otras ocaciones pues tiene que salir a vender con sus amigos y vecinos, nos comenta  tambien que hay dias en los que le va muy bien la venta de sus tortillas pero que que otras ocasiones la venta esta bajas pero que no se desanima pues sabe que asi son los negocios y que hay que trabajar muy duro para salir adelante.


Ella necesita este credito para la compra de refacciones para su molino, maiz para su posterior realizacion de sus productos.

Doña Ruperta espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere pues quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Ruperta is 58 years old, and didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  She is married to Señor Conrado, who works in the fields as a laborer.  They have four children, of whom three work and one does not.  They live in a sugarcane area of La Cuenca del Papalaupan.

She tells us that she decided three years ago to start her business selling tortillas and dough because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, and also because she says that due to the economic situation, money was tight.

Doña Ruperta sells tortillas everyday.  She sets the corn to boil the day before, and the following day she gets up very early to use the corn mill to grind the corn; afterwards she gets to make the tortillas.  Occasionally, they have already been ordered by her customers, but on other occasions she has to go sell to her friends and neighbors.  She also comments that there are days when things go very well for her with selling her tortillas, but there are other occasions when sales are low.  However, she does not get discouraged as she knows that this is the way of business, and that she has to work very hard to get ahead in life.

She needs this loan for the purchase of spare parts for her mill and corn for making her products.  

Doña Ruperta hopes that with this investment her business will prosper, as she wants to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela que tiene la edad de 49 años, ella estudio hasta el tercero de primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Erasmo quien trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya se encuentra casado, ella y su esposo viven en una region donde la actividad principal es la elaboracion de azucar.

Ella nos platica que dese hace un años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de refrescos y venta de antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, tostadas, tacos dorados, picadas) porque queria apoyar a sus esposo con los gasto de sus hogar y tengar una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Adela  nos platica que ha rentado un pequeño local junto a la primaria  donde realiza sus venta de refrescos y dulces, tambien vende antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, tostadas, tacos dorados, picadas) en la hora del recreo pone sus puesto de sus alimentos sobre una mesa, dice que le va bien pues los niños compran su desayuno alli y ya tiene popularidad entre los alumnos de la escuela primaria.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de masa, tortillas, aceite, queso, carne, refrescos, jugos, crema, platos desechables, refrescos y dulcespara su posterior venta de productos.

Doña Adela espera que con esta inversion su negocio postere.
texts.en:
Señora Adela is 49 years old and has a 3rd grade education.  She is married to Señor Erasmo who works as a laborer.  They have 7 children who are married.  She and her husband live in a region where the main activity is sugar manufacturing.  

She tells us that a year ago she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks and Mexican snacks (empanadas, tostadas, fried tacos, picadas) because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and have a better quality of life.  

Doña Adela  tells us that she has rented a small local next to the elementary school where she sells soft drinks and sweets as well as Mexican snacks (empanadas, tostadas, fried tacos, picadas) at recess.  She puts her food on a table.  She says that things are going well for her as the kids buy breakfast there and she is popular with the students.  

She needs this loan to buy dough, tortillas, oil, cheese, meat, soft drinks, juices, cream, paper plates, and sweets to sell later.  

Doña Adela hopes that with this investment her business will prosper.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks and food.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and lives in the peaceful village of Baculud. She has been residing in this village together with her family for almost 11 years. She is a responsible mother and a wife to her husband. Her husband buys and sell junk in the village. She wanted to supplement her spouse's income; that is why she established a small variety store in front of her house. A minimal net income of 5,000 Philippines pesos (P) monthly from the business goes to the allowances of her two children, electric bills and daily meals for the family. 

With the crisis in life she encountered, she strives hard and doesn't lose hope to lift her family out of poverty. She wants to educate her children to have a degree someday to seek better employment for their own families.

She is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy instant noodles, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell in her store and increase her sales.

She wants to strengthen her business to achieve her dream goal for her family.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa  tiene la edad de 43 años, estudio hasta el tercero de secundaria, esta casada con el señor Amado que trabaja de musico, ellos tiene 3 hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela. Doña Nicolasa y su familia viven en una region productora de azucar.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de cosmeticos porque queria apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y tambien porque quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y en un futuro ofrecerles una profesion.

Doña Nicolasa realiza sus ventas por catalago con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, camina casa por casa para mostrarles sus catalagos, levanta pedidos, se surte de pro ductos y despues  entrega a sus clientes y ella recibe el pago por sus productos. Ella nos dice que aunque es un trabajo donde se debe caminar mucho le gusta ya que tiene la oportunidad de conocer mas personas y ampliar su negocio.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de catalogos, maquillajes, lapiz labial, perfumes, desodorantes, delineador, maquillaje en liquido, esmalte, para su posterior venta.

Doña Nicolasa espera que con esta inversion su negocio pospere pues desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Nicolasa is 43 years old and studied through the third year of high school.  She is married to Sr. Amado, who works as a musician.  They have three children who are attending school.  Doña Nicolasa and her family live in a region that produces sugar.

She says that three years ago she decided to start a business selling cosmetics because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  Nicolasa also wants to help her children move forward and offer them a profession in the future.  

Doña Nicolasa makes catalog sales to her friends and neighbors in the community.  She walks from house to house in order to present her catalogs and to take orders.  After obtaining the products, Nicolasa delivers them to her customers and then collects payment.   She says that her job requires a lot of walking, but she likes having the opportunity to meet with more people and to expand her business.  

Nicolasa needs a loan to buy catalogs, make-up, lip pencils, perfumes, deodorants, eye liner, liquid foundation, and nail polishes for eventual resale.  

Doña Nicolasa hopes this investment will prosper her business because she wants to provide her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy catalogs, make-up, lip pencils, perfumes, deodorants, eye liner, liquid foundation, and nail polishes.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mr. Em is a farmer and has been in this business for a long time. This is an occupation he learned from his grandparents when he was young. He earns about 4 USD each day. He has four children, two of whom attend school. The other two are married and live in separate houses. Em wishes to have a motorbike, but he lacks the money. He has decided to request a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner. He will use this loan to purchase a new motorbike. He hopes that the loan and the motorbike will help his family to be happier and more prosperous. This is his fifth loan with HKL. He is very thankful to all kind lenders that always help his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta que tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio la secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor M. que trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentra estudiando y uno tiene un año de edad. Ella y su familia viven en una region que se caracteriza por ser una de las mayores productores de azucar.

Doña Benedicta nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 5 años decidio inciar con su negocio de venta de ropa porque penso que queria apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y como la situacion economica cada vez es mas dificil pues los gasto con sus hijos estudiando son mas y ella quiere ofrecerles una educacion a sus hijos y en un futuro una profesion.

Ella nos platica que  realiza sus ventas de ropa casa por casa mostrando sus prendas a sus amigas y vecinas,  algunas veces levanta pedidos y cuando se surte ya solo los entrega, ella nos dice que le gusta mucho ser comerciente porque ha conocido y hecho muchos amigos ademas de que con el tiempo ha hido aprendiendo muchas cosas sobre el comercio, tambien nos dice  que quiere que su negocio siga crediendo y continuara trabajando muy fuerte para lograrlo. 

Doña Benedicta necesita este prestamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, camisas, playeras, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior para dama y caballero para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que con este credito su negocio pospere y tambien nos dice que se encuentra muy agradecida con fundacion realidad por la confianza que le dan.
texts.en:
Sra. Benedicta is 27 years old and has a high school education.  She is married to Sr. M., who is a laborer.  They have three children, two of whom are in school while the other one is only a year old.  Benedicta and her family live in a region that is known for being one of the largest producers of sugar.  

Doña Benedicta says that she started her business selling clothes a little more than five years ago because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  Their financial situation gets more difficult each time now that they have children in school, yet she wants to offer her children an education so that they can pursue a profession in the future.  

Benedicta says that she sells clothes by going house to house, presenting her merchandise to her friends and neighbors.  Sometimes she takes orders and then handles the delivery by herself when the merchandise arrives.  Benedicta says she greatly enjoys being a merchant because it has allowed her to meet and make many friends.  Over time, she has learned many things about the retail business.  She also says that she wants her business to keep growing, so she will continue to work hard to make that happen.  

Doña Benedicta needs this loan to buy blouses, dresses, trousers, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, undershirts, and underwear for women and men that she can sell later.  

She hopes that this loan will prosper her business.  Benedicta also expresses her appreciation to Fundación Realidad for the trust that has been demonstrated to her.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, trousers, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, undershirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza loves to cook. With minimal capital, her passion drove her to establish a food stall in front of her house. She cooks and sells daily meals such as pork and chicken meat for the people in her village. Flordeliza had been doing this for 10 years. She still wants to enhance her skills in cooking different dishes to meet all of her customers' demand for delicious meals.
She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy pork meat, chicken, and eggs to cook and sell in her food stall. 

In the future, she wants to construct a more convenient food stall to attract more customers in her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy pork meat, chicken, and eggs to cook and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Veronica tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta la primaria, esta casada con el señor Guadalupe que trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 3 hijos los cuales 2 estudian la secundaria y 1 la primaria. Ellos viven en una zona cañera. 

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de topper y cosmeticos por catalogo porque queria apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y ademas penso en un futuro sus hijos querian seguir estudiando y pues ella quiere ofrecerles una profesion.

Doña Veronica realiza sus ventas de topper y cosmeticos por catalogo casa por casa,  su manera de trabajar es mostrandole a sus amigas y vecinas sus catalogos, levanta pedidos y ella suerte esos pedidos los cuales entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de topper, lapiz labial, esmalte, perfumes, delineadores, maquillaje en liquido, sombras y topper para su posterior venta de sus productos.

Doña Veronica se encuentra muy agradecida con fundacion Realidad, y tambien espera que con este credito su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica is 33 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is married to Sr. Guadalupe, who is a laborer.  They have three children, two of whom are in high school while the other is in elementary school.  Veronica and her family live in a sugar cane region.  

She says that three years ago she decided to start her own business selling Tupperware and cosmetics through catalogs because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  In addition, she thinks about her children’s future and wants them to continue their studies so that they can pursue a profession.  

Doña Veronica sells Tupperware and cosmetics by going house-to-house.  By working in this manner, she is able to present catalogs to her friends and neighbors.  After taking their orders, Veronica stocks up on merchandise and then delivers the orders to her customers and collects payment.  

She needs this loan to buy Tupperware, lip pencils, nail polish, perfumes, eye liners, liquid foundation, and eye shadow for eventual resale.  

Doña Veronica is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and hopes that this loan will prosper her business.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware, lip pencils, nail polish, perfumes, eye liners, liquid foundation, and eye shadow.

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
La señora Petra tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentra estudiando uno estudia la educacion primaria y el otro la secuendaria. Ella y su familia viven en una zona productora de azucar.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace unos años decidio iniciar con su propio de negocio de venta de ropa porque queria apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y porque querie ofrecerle en un futuro a sus hijos una profesion.

Doña Petra realiza su venta de ropa casa por casa, mostrandole a sus amigas y vecinos su ropa, dice que en ocasiones ya le llegan a pedir su ropa pues sus clientes la ocupan para dar un obsquio para una fiesta por eso siempre le gusta estar surtida de varidad de ropa, es por eso que ella quiere en un futuro tener un pequeño localito para  poner mostrar su ropa y pueda su negocio posperar.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de blusas, faldas, calcetines, ropa interior para dama y caballero, playeras, camisas, pantalones, vestidos para su posterior venta.

Doña Petra espera que con esta inversion su negocio aumente y pueda ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Petra is 39 years old and studied through the preparatory school level.  She is married and has two children, one in elementary school and the other in high school.  Petra and her family live in a sugar producing region.  

She says that a few years ago she decided to start her own business selling clothes because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and provide her children the chance to pursue a profession in the future.  

Doña Petra sells clothes by going house-to-house, showing her merchandise to friends and neighbors.  Sometimes her customers will order clothes to give as party gifts so she always tries to remain stocked with a variety of fashions.  For this reason, she wants to have a small shop in the future where she can exhibit her merchandise and see her business prosper.  

She needs this loan to buy blouses, skirts, socks, undergarments for men and women, t-shirts, shirts, trousers, and dresses for eventual resale.  Doña Petra hopes that this investment will increase her business so that she can offer a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Dulce Maria tiene la edad de 29 años, estudio la preparatoria, es madre soltera de un hijo que estudia el preescolar. Ellos viven en un aregion que se caracteriza por ser productora de azucar.

Doña Dulce Maria nos comenta que desde hace 5 años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de ropa y que hace poco de 3 años para tener mas etradas de dinero decidio iniciar con su venta de carne de cerdo porque queria sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo y ofrecerle una mejor oportunidad de vida.

Ella realiza su venta de ropa, saliendo a caminar casa por casa enseñando a sus amigos y vecinos su ropa para que puedan comprarle y asi poder ella hacer crecer su negocio, y su venta de carne de cerdo la vende los fines de semana (Vienes, sabados y domingo) un dia antes la ofrece a sus vecinos o vecinos de la comunidad, y al siguiente dia ella se levanta muy temprano a aliniar su cerdo, despues entrega sus pedidos y posteriormente le pagan por su alimento.

Doña Dulce Maria necesita este credito para la venta de ropa para dama y caballero como son blusas, pantalones, camisas, camisetas, vestidos y compra de carne de cerdo y bolsas de plastico para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere y pueda ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Dulce Maria is 29 years old and has a preparatory school education.  She is a single mother and has a son who is in preschool.  They live in a region that is known for sugar production.  

Doña Dulce Maria says that five years ago she decided to start her own business selling clothes.  A little more than three years into her business, she decided to use some of her money to start another business selling pork so that she could help her young son get ahead and offer him a better opportunity in life.

Dulce Maria sells clothes by going house-to-house and showing the merchandise to her friends and neighbors, which has helped her business to grow.  She sells pork on the weekends (Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays).  A day before, she offers first choice to her friends and neighbors in the community.  After that, she wakes up very early to prepare the pork before delivering her orders and collecting payment.  

Doña Dulce Maria needs this loan to buy clothing for women and men such as blouses, trousers, shirts, t-shirts, and dresses.  She will also buy pork and plastic bags so that she can sell the meat later.  

Dulce Maria hopes that this loan will prosper her business so that she can provide a better quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing and pork.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is married and her husband is involved in the agriculture profession. He grows different fruits & vegetables and sells to the market for a profit. 
Kalsoom is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very well. She has two daughters to whom she couldn’t provide an education, unfortunately. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizer in bulk to gain maximum output of his efforts and earn better profits. He has a lot of experience in his business and Kalsoom is confident that an investment will help him improve his business and income.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To buy seeds & fertilizer for growing fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru:
Хошим трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 1 ребенка. Более 2 лет он занимается купля продажей скота. Он откармливает скот дома и имеет хорошие условия для них. Его жена помогает ему бизнесу, она ухаживает и откармливает скот, когда Хошим ездит за покупками. Он продает скот на местном рынке. Кроме этого он имеет землю и там он выращивает сельскохозяйственных культур, а также корм для своего скота. Хошим старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни, и обеспечить своего ребенка. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать своего дохода. Хошим благодарен всем кто поддерживает его. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Hoshim is a hard-working and conscientious person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over two years.  He fattens up livestock at home and has suitable conditions for it there.  His wife helps him in this business.  She takes care of and feeds the livestock, when Hoshim goes shopping.  He sells livestock at the local market.  Besides this business, he has land, where he grows agricultural crops and feed for his livestock.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock, in order to expand his business and maximize his income.  Hoshim is grateful to all who supports him.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy clothes and laces in bulk quantity, which will allow her to offer more variety of clothes to her clients and make more profits. Bulk purchasing will also minimize her cost of traveling. She is a very experienced lady and has been doing her business for the past 10 years. Her clothes collections are very famous among her clients and they prefer to buy from her because of her reasonable rates and the quality of the dresses. She does this work purely to support her husband financially. She is married and has four children. Two of her children work and the others are studying. She is confident that an investment will help her expand her business further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameeran.

loans.use: To buy clothes and laces for her boutique business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
From the Ornlong Veng District, Siem Reap Province, Mrs. Chan is a 33-year-old married woman, and she is a good mother of five children. One of her children is married and lives independently. Chan is a hardworking mother for supporting her family expenses. Chan generates her income by selling fish-paste. She has been in this business for many years. From this business, she earns about $2 each day. 

She is married to Vong, who is a soldier in a commune where he must go to work far away from his house every day. Her husband spends some money for a motor taxi every day, so it is a problem that cuts down her income; therefore, she and her husband want to purchase a motorbike, but they lack money. Chan would like to request a loan to buy a motorbike for facilitating her husband’s work. She hopes that this loan will make her family meet happiness.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Huch

texts.en: Mrs.Huch, from the Baray District of Kompong Thom Province, is a 36-year-old married woman and good mother of six children. They are all single and living under her care. Mrs. Huch generates her income by raising pigs. She has been in this business since 2004. She married Naran who is a police officer in a community far away from his house where he goes to work every day. Her husband spends money for a motor taxi everyday which is a problem since it cuts down her income. Therefore, she and her husband want to purchase a motorbike but they lack money. Mrs. Huch would like to request a loan in order to buy a motorbike thus facilitating her husband’s work. She hopes that this loan will help her family find happiness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señoraMartina tiene la edad de 39 años, estudio la primaria, esta casada con el señor Eduardo que trabaja de taxista, ellos tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno se encuentra estudiando. Doña martina y su familia viven en un aregin que se caracteriza por ser unos de los principales productores de Azucar.

Doña Martina nos comenta que desde hace 9 años dedicio iniciar con su negocio de venta de tamales porque quiere ofrecerle a sus familia una mejor calidad de vida y a su hijo que se encuentra estudiando darle una profesion.

Ella realiza sus ventas de tamales, un dia antes de elaborar sus tamales levanta pedidos y al dia siguiente se levanta muy tempranos para hacer sus tamales despues de que ya estan hechos los reparte entre sus clientes y recibe el pago por su alimento, pero tambien nos cuenta que hace un poco mas de tamales para salir a caminar casa por casa para que pueda tener un poco mas de ganancias, en otras ocasiones le hacen pedidos grandes para dar en la fiestas de cumpleaños.

Doña Martina necesita este credito para la compra de hojas de elote, variedad d chiles, aceite, sal, carne, elotes para la elaboracion de sus productos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio pueda prosperar y asi sus ganancias aumenten para darles un poquito mas a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela y pueda mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Martina is 39 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is married to Sr. Eduardo, who works as a taxi driver.  They have three children, but only one of them is in school.  Doña Martina and her family reside in a region that is known for being one of the main producers of sugar.  

Doña Martina says that nine years ago she decided to start her business of selling tamales because she wanted to provide her family a better quality of life.  She also wanted to help her son who is in school so that he can pursue a profession.  

Martina sells tamales by taking orders on the day before she makes them.  On the following day, she wakes up very early so that she can make the tamales.  Afterwards, she delivers them to her customers and collects payment.  Martina says that she makes extra tamales so that she can sell them by going house-to-house to earn some additional income.  On other occasions, she receives large orders for birthday parties.  

Doña Martina needs this loan to buy corn husks, a variety of chili peppers, oil, salt, meat, and corn for making her products.  She hopes that this investment will prosper her business and increase her income so that she can provide a little more for her children in order for them to go to school.  This will also help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy corn husks, a variety of chili peppers, oil, salt, meat, and corn for making tamales.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita's dream is to educate her two children, for it is the only treasure she can give to them. She did not pursue her studies due to lack of financial support. At 46 years old, she continuously manages their rice farming business with the help of her husband. They want to increase their yields and income so they can support the education of their children and acquire their daily basic needs.

To generate additional income, Lita is engaged in a hog-raising business in their village. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business. She mentioned that she needs to work hard and strive harder to make her business grow. She is hoping that in the future, their children will finish their studies and her business will become viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is married. Her husband is a motor mechanic and known as an expert in his field of work. People trust his repair services and come from different areas to get their motorcycle repaired. Jameela is the mother of five children. Her two elder children are in college and the others are studying in a local school. Jameela is very supportive and sews clothes for her neighborhood clients to afford the education expenses of her children. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her current machine is creating problems and doesn’t produce quality work. She is confident that after buying a new sewing machine, she will be able to complete her clients' orders on time and earn more profit.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Jameela.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz Maria tiene la edad de 44 años, estudio la secundaria, esta madre soltera de 5 hijos los culaes se encuentran estudiando, ella y su familia viven en una region de siembra de caña para la produccion de azucar.

Doña Luz Maria nos platica que decio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de cosmeticos y zapatos por catalogo porque quiere  sacar adelante a sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella realiza sus ventas de cosmeticos y zapatos, saliendo a caminar casa por casa, les muestra los catalogos a sus amigas y vecinos, levanta pedidos y despues de tener varios pedidos sale a comprarlos, para posteriormente luego entragarlos a sus clientes, y despues ella recibir el pago por sus productos. ella nos dice que es un trabajo donde se camina mucho pero ella le hecha muchas ganas ya que quiere sacar a delante a sus pequeños


Doña Luz Maria necesita este credito para la compra catalogos, zapatos, maquillajes, sombras, delineadores, lapiz labial, esmalte, perfumes, para su posterior venta de sus productos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere porque espera salir adelante con su negocio y ofrecerle a sus hijos una profesion.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Maria is 44 years old and has a high school education.  She is a single mother of five children who are in school.  Luz Maria and her family live in a region where sugar cane is grown for producing sugar.  

She says that she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics and shoes through catalogs because she wanted to help her children get ahead and offer them a better quality of life.

Luz Maria sells cosmetics and shoes by going house-to-house.  She presents her catalogs to friends and neighbors, takes their orders, buys the products once she has several orders, and then delivers the merchandise to her customers and collects payment.  Luz Maria says that her job requires a lot of walking, but it has resulted in good earnings that have helped her children move forward.  
 
She needs this loan to buy catalogs, shoes, makeup, eye shadows, eye liners, lip pencils, nail polish, and perfumes for eventual resale.  Luz Maria hopes that this investment will prosper her business so that she can more forward and help her children pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy catalogs, shoes, makeup, eye shadows, eye liners, lip pencils, nail polish, and perfumes.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana  tiene la edad de 44 años, estudio la secundaria, esta casada con el señor Alberto que trabaja de operador, ellos tiene 2 hijos, uno estudia la Universidad y otro la preparatoria. Ellos viven en una zona cañera.

Ella nos dice que desde hace 6 años inicio con su negocio de venta de pasta de mole porque quiere apoyar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, tambien nos comenta que decidio iniciar con su negocio porque la situacion economica es muy dura y no hay dinero que alcanze.

Doña Susana realiza sus ventas de pasta de mole el cual le enseño a elaborar su madre y cometa comente que le sale muy rico, es por eso que ella decidio empezar a venderlo,Doña susana se levanta muy temprano para elaborar su mole y sale a ofrecer casa por casa con sus amigas o vecinas, ademas nos comenta que en ocasiones sus clientas ya llegan a buscar el mole a su casa, cosa que la llena de orgullo pues sabe que les gusta su mole y ella gana mas aganas de seguir trabajando y se siente muy orgullosa.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de variedad de chiles, chocolate, cacahuate, platanos, tortillas, pan, aceite, manteca, agonjoli, para posteriormente preparar su alimento.

Doña Susana espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y pueda ofrecerle a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
Sra. Susana is 44 years old and has a high school education.  She is married to Sr. Alberto, who works as an operator.  They have two children, one is a student at the university and the other is attending preparatory school.  Susana and her family live in a sugar cane region.  

She says that six year ago she start her business selling pasta with mole sauce because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and provide her children a better quality of life.  Susana also says that she decided to start her business because her financial situation is very difficult and there is not enough money.

Doña Susana sells pasta with mole sauce using the recipe she learned from her mother.  She says that this dish is very rich, which is why she decided to start selling it.  Susana wakes up very early to begin preparing the mole sauce and then goes house-to-house to her friends and neighbors.  In addition, there are times when her customers come to her house in search of mole sauce.  She is proud of the fact that people like her sauce, which motivates her to continue working.  

Susana needs this loan to buy a variety of chili peppers, chocolate, peanuts, plantains, tortillas, bread, oil, lard, and sesame seeds for preparing her dish.  

She hopes that this investment will prosper her business so that she can offer her children a nice inheritance.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making mole sauce.

loans.name: Rahmonali

texts.ru:
Рахмонали более 12 лет занимается скотоводством. Он честный, умный и добросовестный человек.  Он женат и у них 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он научил свой бизнес от отца и дедушки. Раньше они занимались, а Рахмонали наблюдал и помогал им.  Рахмонали хочет расширить данный бизнес, чтобы получить максимум прибыли. Он хочет обеспечить свою семью и содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его жена и сын. Рахмонали хочет покупать скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес для получения прибыли. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 1200$ США. Рахмонали благодарен Киве и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрения.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rahmonali has been involved in animal husbandry for over 12 years.  He is an honest, smart and conscientious person.  He is married and has three children.  He is involved in buying and selling cattle and learned this business from his father and grandfather.  They used to be in this business before, and Rahmonali observed and helped them.  Rahmonali wants to expand this business in order to make a maximum profit.  He wants to provide for his family and maintain good living conditions for them.  His wife and son help him in this business.  Rahmonali wants to buy livestock in order to expand his business and make a profit.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1200 for this purpose.  Rahmonali is grateful to Kiva and Kiva creditors for their support and help.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
Jose Valentin, tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 17 y 14 años, y junto a su familia reside en la Aldea Casa Blanca en el Departamento de Francisco Morazan. 

Jose se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos. El inicio este negocio porque en su lugar de residencia no existia ningun lugar donde ir a comprar refrescos y/o golosinas, y para hacerlo tenian que caminar una larga distancia. Asi que Jose hablo con su esposa de la idea de poner un pequeño puesto de golosinas y ella acepto. Y poco a poco han ido surtiendo su negocio de otros productos. Su horario de atencion inicia desde las 5:00 pm hasta las 11:00 pm, asi que Jose luego de su jornada laboral, llega a su casa e inicia a ayudar en el puesto de golosinas como mesero, ya que su esposa cocina y el sirve a los clientes. 

El prestamo que Jose esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar refrescos, verduras, carnes, harina, aceite, minimos verdes, salsas, condimentos, entre otros productos como ser galletas, churros, dulces. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio estara mejor surtido y sus ventas incrementaran. Su meta es llegar a tener un restaurante de comida buffet grande y prospero para sostener su hogar y ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.

Este es el segundo ciclo de Jose en FAMA y gracias a los prestamos recibidos tiene una fuente de ingresos y confia que hara sus pagos de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Jose Valentin is 41 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 14 and 17. He and his family reside in the neighborhood of Casa Blanca in the Department of Francisco Morazan.

Jose sells snacks and soft drinks. He started this business because there was no other place in town where one could buy soft drinks and snacks without having to walk a long distance. Jose talked with his wife about his idea of opening a small snack stand and she agreed. Little by little, he restocked his business with other products. His schedule of operation is from 5pm to 11pm. When Jose gets home after completing his work day, he starts helping out at the snack stand as a waiter. His wife takes care of the cooking while he attends to the customers.

The loan Jose is requesting will be used to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meats, flour, oil, miniature greens, sauces, condiments, and other products such as cookies, donuts, and candy. With the support of this loan, his business will be well-stocked and his sales will increase. His goal is to open a restaurant with a large buffet so that he can sustain his household and help his children finish their studies.

This is Jose’s second loan cycle with FAMA and he expresses his gratitude for the loans he has received because they provide a source of income. He is confident that he will complete his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meats, flour, oil, miniature greens, sauces, condiments, cookies, donuts, and candy.

loans.name: Misbah's Group

texts.en:
Misbah is married and has six children. Five of her children are studying while her youngest son is only five years old and has not started his education yet. She is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her tasks very well. 
 
Misbah has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business making sofa covers. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past 20 years. He has a good clientele base that comes to him for buying sofa covers and giving orders for making sofa covers. With the loan, he will buy cloth and thread in bulk for making sofa covers of a better quality, which will help him improve his income. Misbah is hopeful that after the loan investment, his business will grow further and his income will increase. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Misbah.

loans.use: To buy cloth and thread to make sofa covers

loans.name: Navruz

texts.ru: Навруз проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 19 лет. Он холост. У него имеется среднее образование. Навруз уже три года как предоставляет услугу, такси. Он развозит людей с одного места на другое. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Navrus lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  He is 19 years old, single and has a secondary education.  Navruz has been providing a taxi service for three years.  He transports people from one place to another.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Atiya's Group

texts.en:
Atiya is a very skillful lady. She owns & operates a business sewing clothes to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband has a business selling spare parts. His shop is located in a nearby market and from there he operates his business. He sells different vehicle spare parts to his customers and generates income for the family. Atiya is the mother of four children. Her youngest son is four years old and stays at home while the others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
 
Atiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will invest the loan in his business and purchase different spare parts for motorbikes and cars. This will help him fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past six years and Atiya is very hopeful that after an investment, his business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 29, married and has two infant-age children. Due to the lack of job opportunities, he is engaged in a hog-raising business while his wife does the household chores. He aims to become financially stable so that they can build their own house and he can support his family. He wants to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income and satisfy their needs and save for the future of their children.

Due to inadequate capital, Jayson is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that the loan will help a lot to make his business grow. He mentioned that he is ready to endure whatever trials and difficulties he will encounter, for he believes that these are the stepping stones toward success.

loans.use: buy pig feed, vitamins and pigletes

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora  Virginia tiene la edad de 60 años, estudio la primaria, esta casada con el señor Ciro que se encuentra pensionado, ellos tuvieron 2 hijos los cuales ya se enceuntran casados.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace un poco mas de 5 años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de venta de tamales y antojitos mexicanos porque quere que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña Virgia realiza sus ventas desde la comodidad de su casa, los dias viernes vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tacos dorados, garnachas, gorditas, platanos) y llegan sus vecinos y amigos a comprarle, tambien dice que los dias Jueves vende tamales levanta los pedidos un dia antes y al dia siguiente los entrega y asi dia a dia va teniendo mas popularidad con las personas de su comunidad.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de masa, hojas de platano, variedad de chiles, carne de res y de pollo, tomate, cebolla, col, tortillas, queso, aceite, platos desechables, frijol para posteriormente la preparacion de sus alimentos.

Doña Virginia espera que con este credito su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia is 60 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is married to Sr. Ciro, who is a pensioner.  They have two children who are already married.  

Virginia says that a little more than five years ago, she decided to start her own business selling tamales and Mexican street food because she wanted her family to have a better quality of life.

Doña Virginia conducts her sales from the comfort of her home.  On Fridays she sells Mexican street food such as empanadas, hard tacos, “garnachas” (tortillas topped with shredded meat, cheese, and cabbage), gorditas, and plantains.  Her neighbors and friends come to buy her food.  Virginia says that on Thursdays she sells tamales based on the orders she received the day before.  With each passing day, she gains more popularity with the people in her community.  

She needs this loan to buy corn meal, banana leaves, various chili peppers, beef, chicken, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, tortillas, cheese, oil, disposable plates, and beans for preparing her foods.  

Doña Virginia hopes that this loan will prosper her business.

loans.use: to buy corn meal, banana leaves, various chili peppers, beef, chicken, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, tortillas, cheese, oil, disposable plates, and beans.

loans.name: Ventura

texts.es:
La señora Ventura tiene la edad de 48 años, estdio hasta quinto de primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Cristino que trabaja de campesino, ellos tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian. ella vive en una zona cañera.

Ella nos platica que desde hace unos años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de pollo porque vio que la economia esta casa vez mas dura y no alcanza con lo que gana su esposo es por eso que decidio hecharle la mano a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Ventura realiza sus ventas 3 veces por semana, se levanta muy tempranos a limpiar el pollo, y despues afuera de su casa pone una mesita, sobre la mesa pone el recipiente de pollo para despues esperar a sus clientas para la preparacion de sus alimentos.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de pollo en pluma, bolsas de plastico para la venta de sus productos.

Doña ventura espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y pueda ofrecerle a sus hijos una profesion en un futuro.
texts.en:
Ventura is 48 years old and studied until fifth grade of elementary school.  She is married to Cristino who works as a farmer.  They have 2 children who are in school.  She lives in a sugar cane zone.

She tells us that a few years ago, she decided to start her own business of chicken sales because she saw that the economy was becoming more and more difficult and what her husband makes wasn't enough to cover expenses.  For this reason, she decided to lend her husband a hand with the household expenses.

Doña Ventura makes her sales 3 times per week, rising very early in the morning to clean the chicken.  Later, she sets up a table outside of her house, upon which she places the container of chicken, waiting for customers for the preparation of the food.  

She needs this loan in order to buy chicken and plastic bags for the sale of her products.

Doña Ventura hopes that with this investment, her business will prosper and she will be able to offer her children a professional future.

loans.use: to sell chicken

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.ru: Юлдузхон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 22 года. Замужем. У нее 4 детей. Она уже три года как занимается растениеводством. Юлдузхон выращивает овощи и сеет пшеницу для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Yulduzkhon lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 22 years old, married and has four children.  She has been involved in agriculture for three years.  Yulduzkhon grows vegetables and wheat for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.ru:
Зиёдулло более 5 лет занимается купля продажей скотов. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребёнка. Он добрый и ответственный молодой отец. Когда Зиёдулло был  маленьким, его отец занимался скотоводством, а он помогал ему и мечтал о том, что он тоже когда-то начнет данный бизнес. Наконец-то его мечта сбылась, он начал свой бизнес в 2006 году с трудностями и вложил в нем все свои силы и старался, чтобы бизнес развивался. Теперь его бизнес расширяется день за днем, и он хотел бы получит займ для 1000$ США для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их поддержу и милосердие. 
      
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ziyodullo has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over five years.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  He is a kind and responsible young father.  When Ziyodullo was little, his father was involved in animal husbandry.  Ziyodullo helped him and dreamed that one day he would start this business.  His dream finally came to fruition when he started his business in 2006 through hardships, and invested all his efforts into it and tried to keep his business growing.  Currently, his business grows every day, and he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of livestock.  He is grateful in advance to all creditors for their support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia is married and her husband is a school teacher. He teaches different classes of students. His students admire his style of teaching and like him very much. Fouzia is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her two elder sons are rickshaw drivers and her remaining two children are getting their education. Fouzia is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for one of her sons who wants to buy a new rickshaw. Currently, he drives a rented rickshaw, which has minimized his income potential. By purchasing his own rickshaw, he will be able to earn more profits and will become an owner of his own business asset. Fouzia is very hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her son and her family will be able to enjoy better living facilities as a result of his better income.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Fouzia.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is a 45-year-old married woman.   She is a mother of four children who are living under her income.  Leng is a hardworking woman who supports her family. Presently, Leng generates her profit by farming. She is married to Pheap, who is a farmer too.  Aside from farming, Leng also has another business as a vermicelli seller in a market near her community. She earns about $5 each day. 

Leng and her husband wish to purchase a plowing machine to do her farm work and to employ labor, but they lack capital, so she and her husband would like to request some funds through HKL partner and Kiva. Leng has requested a loan for US$1,100 to add to her working business capital. She hopes that this fund will help her family make more profit and be happy.

loans.use: purchase a plow

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn believes that "hardships and difficulties are the stepping stones to success".  She is a mother who is now 53 years old and has six adult children. She endures hardships and difficulties in life until all her children had finished their studies. Her husband has been her only partner in managing their rice field business for almost 38 years now.  

Marilyn is also engaged in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She wants to strengthen this business to increase her income to support their basic needs and save for future emergencies. She wants to ask for a loan of P7,000 to buy feeds and vaccines to sustain her hog-raising business.   She believes that the loan will help her make the business grow as she works hard for it. She is hoping that her patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vaccines

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Шухрат умный и добрый человек. Он женат, любящий и ответственный отец 4 детей. Он начал свой бизнес 12 лет назад с куплей продажей автозапчастей. Теперь его жена занимается этим, а он открыл свой новый бизнес. Шухрат открыл мастерскую для того чтобы он мог там обслужит диагностики и ремонта автомобилей. Шухрат хочет получить стабильный доход от данного бизнеса и расширить его. Шухрат  запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового оборудования для диагностики автомобиля. Шухрат хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Shuhrat is a smart and kind person.  He is married and is a loving and responsible father of four children.  He started his business twelve years ago with the sales of auto parts.  Currently, his wife has taken over that business, and he opened a new business. Shuhrat opened his repair shop in order to provide automotive diagnostic and repair services.  Shuhrat wants to receive a stable income from this business and to expand it.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 in order to purchase new automotive diagnostic equipment.  Shuhrat wants to thanks you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase diagnostic equipment

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda tiene la edad de 24 años, estudio la preparatoria, esta casada con el señor Gilberto que trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando.ell avive en una region cañera.

Ella nos platica que desde hace unos años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de desayudos, porque dice que la situacion economica cada vez es mas dificil y piensa que debe ayudar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y la educacion de sus hijos.

Doña Yolanda nos platica que su esposo trabaja en el ingenio y que ella todos los dias le manda su lonche algunas veces su esposo compartia su comida con sus compañeros que no les ponian desayuno y como les gusto mucho los guisos y el sazon que le daba su esposa a la comida iniciar a pagar a doña yolando por enviarles desayuno y desde entonces vende desayunos y almuerzos a los emprleados del ingenio, ella se encuentra muy feliz porque gracias e ello gana un poco de dinero extra haciendo lo que mas le gusta cocinar.

Ella necesita este prestamo para la compra de huevos, queso, frijoles, arroz, naranjas, melon, platanos, carne, pasta de mole, tortillas, vasos de platicos y vasos para posteriormente realizar sus alimentos.

Doña Yolante espera que con esta inversion pueda en un futuro tener local para poder alli poner su desayunador y asi su negocio cresca.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda is 24 years old. She attended high school. She is married to Señor Gilberto, who works as a laborer. They have two children, who are in school. They live in a sugar cane producing region.

She tells us that a few years ago she decided to set up her own business selling breakfasts, because she says that the economic situation is more and more difficult and she thinks that she should help her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children.

Doña Yolanda tells us that her husband works in the sugar mill and that every day she sends him his lunch. Sometimes her husband shared his food with his fellow workers who did not have breakfast, and as they very much liked the dishes and the seasoning that she gave to the food, they began to pay Doña Yolanda to send them breakfast. Since then, she has sold breakfasts and lunches to the employees of the sugar mill. She is very happy because, thanks to this, she earns a little extra money doing what she most likes to do -- cook.

She needs this loan to buy eggs, cheese, beans, rice, oranges, melons, bananas, meat, mole sauce, tortillas, plastic cups, and glasses to prepare her foods.

Doña Yolanda hopes that with this loan she can in the future have a shop where she can set up her breakfast room and thus her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare breakfasts to sell.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum, 28, is a resident of the Baray District of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. She has four children who live under her revenue. All of them are enrolled in a local school. She now runs a business as a piglet raiser. From this business, she earns about $2 per day. Her husband works as a firewood seller, for which he earns approximately $4 per day. To improve their business, Mrs. Sum and her husband wish to purchase a new motorcycle. So, she would like to borrow some funds from Kiva Partner, HKL, in order to purchase it.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 37 years old, married, and is a mother of 5 school-aged dependents. She lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, Lita manufactures and sells clay products to local businesses and community members. It has been five years since the business was started and it continues to exist. This business has allowed Lita to generate PHP 25,000 a month, which also includes other income sources from her spouse.

Earlier this year, Lita applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She aims to produce more and more of these products to accommodate orders and gain more income for the family. The possible revenue generated from this is intended to expand and improve the business, leading to more growth.

loans.use: buy raw materials to make clay products

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory, 50, is a single woman who lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.  To make a living she owns and operates a general store in her community for subsistence and to enhance her business ability. She earns about PHP 8,000 a month. Over the past 12 years, Dory has maintained good relationships with her neighborhood customers because she stocks what they need and because she is a good person.

Dory has successfully repaid two previous loans and has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.  Dory is seeking a loan of PHP 30,000 to expand her business.  She hopes to sustain her livelihood and expand her store's range of products so that she can have on hand enough money as roll-up capital.

loans.use: to increase her store's inventory.

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity, which will allow her to offer better variety to her clients and increase her chances of sales and profits. She started her business to financially support her husband whose income was not enough to meet the financial expenses of the family. Ghulam fatima is the mother of four children. Her eldest daughter has a business selling ready-made garments and her second child is a school teacher. Both of her sons are doing different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. Besides her work, she also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She has been operating her business for the past three years and is very confident that an investment will help her make her family’s financial life better. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ghulam fatima.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Kat

texts.en:
Mrs. Kat is a 44-year-old married woman who is a good mother to her four children. She lives in the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province in Cambodia.

Mrs. Kat is a hardworking farmer who earns a small daily profit to support her family.  All of her children are single.

To help pay her family's expenses, Kat's lovely husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day.  He spends money every day to take a motor taxi because his job is located far away from their village.  

Kat and her husband wish to have a motorbike but don't have enough money to buy one. 

Kat would like to request a loan to purchase a motorbike so her husband can get to work more economically.  She hopes that the motorbike will help make her family happier and save them money.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to help her husband get to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is married and her husband has a business selling spare parts. He is an expert in his field and his clients come from different areas to buy spare parts for their vehicles. Farzana is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. Besides her work, she also carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She has given birth to four sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy spare parts for different vehicles to put in his shop and sell. He started doing his business two years ago and Farzana is very confident that her husband’s business will grow towards betterment after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Boniface Sirikwa

texts.en:
Boniface is a 27-year-old married man. He has 2 children, aged 1 and 5. He describes himself as a visionary man.

Boniface operates a retail store where he sells sugar, bread, soda, cooking oil and rice in a shopping centre. He has been in this business for 2 years.  Before this, he was involved in farming.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power of customers due to inflation.

Boniface will use his KES 30,000 loan to purchase rice and sugar to sell in his retail shop. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into wholesale. He would also like to buy a plot of land to put up rental houses within 5 years.

loans.use: buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 40 years old and single.  She supports her parents.  She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for a period of eight years, making a monthly profit of KES 5,000.  This is her first loan from KADET Ltd.  She has been loaned KES 20,000, which she plans to use to buy sugar, cooking flour, maize, beans, rice, etc.  She will use the anticipated profit to invest in assets like tractors, land, computers and to pay school fees.  She hopes for a better future.

loans.use: buy sugar, flour, maize, beans, rice

loans.name: Chahongir

texts.ru:
Чахонгир умный, образованный и добрый человек. Он женат и у них двое детей. Он работает инкассатором в финансовом группе «Вавилон». Его зарплата не хватает ему для содержанию своей семьи, он хочет содержит их в хороших условиях и улучшить своё жилищное условия.  С этой целью он начал дополнительный бизнес, чтобы максимизировать своего дохода. Он  занимается скотоводством более 5 лет. Он хочет расширить данный бизнес и получить большую прибыль для содержания своих детей. Он хотел бы получить кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки скота и корм для них. Чахонгир заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за их доброты и милосердие.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
