texts.en: Chahongir is a smart, educated and kind person.  He is married and has two children.  He works as an armoured guard at the "Babylon" financial group.  His salary is not enough to support his family, and he wants to provide good living conditions for them and improve his housing situation.  He started a secondary business in order to maximize his income and achieve this goal.  Chahongir has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years.  He wants to expand this business and make a large profit to support his children.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock and livestock feed.  Chahongir is grateful to all creditors in advance for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is 41 years old, married and has four children. All of them are studying in different classes. She is an expert in sewing clothes. She learned this art from her mother before marriage and now she is getting the benefits from it and helping her husband financially. Her husband is a motor mechanic and operates a motor workshop. He provides his customers’ good repair service. That’s why his clients trust him and give him good rewards for his work.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some repair tools for the betterment of his business. This will allow him to provide better quality services to his clients and earn better profits. He has been doing his business for the past 10 years and Perveen is hopeful that an investment will be more profitable for him and it will help her family to have a better standard of living as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle repair tools

loans.name: Tal

texts.en:
Mrs. Tal is a 48-year-old farmer who lives in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province. Mrs. Tal is married to Mr. Ra, also aged 48. The couple, who work together raising pigs, have five children: three of them are single and another is married and lives in a separate house. To assist her profits, her daughter works in a sewing factory and her son is a local construction worker in Phnom Penh, where they earn enough salary per month. 

To earn a living, Mrs. Tal has begun a business as a fish seller in one market far away from her house. Because of the long distance, Mrs. Tal would like a motorbike to help generate her income over time but she lacks the money, so she has decided to request some funding from HKL. 

She hopes that this funding will bring her family happiness and prosperity and help her to gain more profit every day. From these businesses, she expects she will have a bigger house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is  30 years old.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 7, 3 and 2.  He has been farming for five years, producing milk and vegetables which he sells to the local market.

Martin has made a loan request of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says this second loan from Juhudi will improve his family's living standards and help him educate his children.  For additional income, Martin also runs a motorcycle business where he is just an employee but hopes to buy his own from the farming proceeds.

Martin says dairy feeds are usually expensive during the dry seasons and remains a persistent challenge in the dairy business.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is married and her husband is involved in selling spices and noodles. He gets orders from different grocery and general stores and fulfills their orders at a profit. He is a very hard worker and loves doing his work. Samina is a seamstress who supports her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is the mother of four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy spices and noodles in bulk quantity, which will help him complete the larger orders on time and earn more profit. Samina is very hopeful that her husband’s business will improve after the loan investment and her family will enjoy a better standard of living as a result. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Samina.

loans.use: To buy spices and noodles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more cooking fat, flour, eggs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 42 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 17, 14, and 12. She is a farmer and owns a piece of farmland in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice crops for 17 years.  Gloria earns about 9000 PHP per month doing this farming. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to continue earning from her farm.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan is a mother of six children. Her two elder sons couldn’t get an education due to poor financial condition but her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are continuing their studies. Her husband is involved in a livestock business. He gets milk from his cattle and sells it to the community clients and to milk shops for a profit. He is a very hard worker who gets up early in the morning and takes milk from his cattle to sell. Siddiqan is a very supportive lady in nature. She operates a business selling goats. She purchases goats from the animal market and sells them to the customers after raising them.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo, which will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk to sell. He has a vast experience in his business and Siddiqan is hopeful that a loan investment will prove to be a profitable one for him. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Siddiqan.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru:
Мухаммаджон честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей скота и корма. Он начал свой бизнес 10 лет назад и успешно продолжает. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальной прибыли. Мухаммаджон с удовольствием занимается и любит свой бизнес. Он хочет получить максимум прибыли для содержания своей семьи и обучение своих детей. Он хотел бы получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.  Мухаммаджон заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их доброты и милосердие.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Muhammadjon is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock and livestock feed.  He started his business ten years ago and successfully continues it now.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  Muhammadjon runs his business with satisfaction and loves it.  He wants to make a maximum profit to support his family and educate his children.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.  Muhammadjon is grateful in advance to all creditors for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and is married to Rehema. They are not yet blessed with children.  David has been selling clothing materials for the past four years, making a monthly profit of KES 20,000.  

He has been loaned KES 30,000, which he plans to use to purchase more materials for sale.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to open another shop to supplement the profits made.  In the near future, he hopes to have a big boutique in his home town.

loans.use: purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old and is a married woman with 6 children.  Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is 7.

Josie and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and corn crops to sell. They also buy coconuts and make copra. Josie does her best to help provide for her family and send her children to school. She applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and school supplies. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and school supplies

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Liberty helps her husband plant rice and corn crops on their land. She also runs a sari-sari store business. She sells canned goods, noodles and other items to the people in her community. Liberty plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.  In the future, she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is married and her husband is a carpenter. He makes beautifully designed wooden furniture. Due to his good quality work, he receives regular orders every month. His work is very well known among his customers and they prefer buying furniture from him due to its durability and attractive design. 
Shahida is the mother of four children. She could not complete her education and had to leave after fifth grade due to financial constraints. She does not want the same destiny to befall her children, which is why she has enrolled all of her children in school. 
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s furniture-making business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails and furniture polish in bulk quantities to be able to make more furniture to sell. The marriage season is near and the demand for furniture is increasing. Shahida is hopeful that this loan investment will help her husband receive and fulfill more orders and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and furniture polish for furniture-making business.

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya where he has been in farming for the last 6 years, producing and selling maize and milk. He is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children who are all attending school.  He also gets additional income from employment.

Gibson has made a loan request of 61,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow for 31,200 KES and chickens for 30,000 KES for a poultry venture. He says this second loan will  improve his family's living standards and improve his farming businesses.

He says farming in the area is affected by prolonged droughts.  He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's intervention by approving farming loans.

loans.use: buy/insure a dairy cow & buy chickens

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a 62-year-old married man with 7 children. He is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato, where he and his family also live.

Manuel plants rice, corn and bananas on his land. He works hard to have an abundant harvest. He said he also wants to be able to support his grandchildren.

Manuel requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for his family to be healthy and happy always.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a very supportive lady by nature. She operates a boutique business where she makes well designed clothes and displays them in her boutique, which attracts many customers towards her and helps her increase her sales. Her collection and designs helps her to get regular orders. She mainly receives orders from customers in her neighborhood. Razia's income helps her pay school fees for her three children, who are getting an education. 
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will purchase cloth in bulk quantity to be able to prepare dresses and fulfill customer demand in a timely fashion. She is very confident that a loan investment will help her grow and improve her business and increase her profits.  
Razia is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: to buy cloth for preparing dresses for her boutique.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a very active lady who performs her household duties at home. Besides her household work, she also operates a milk sales business with her husband. She has some cows and buffaloes. She takes care of them by providing timely food and water and keeping their shelter clean. Her husband sells the milk to community customers for a profit. Azra's husband also runs a grocery store where he sells daily use items such as sugar, spices, rice etc. 
Azra has six children. One of them is studying while the others do different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s milk sales business. He will use the loan to buy another buffalo, which will help him produce more milk for selling therefore increasing his profits. Azra is very confident that an investment will help her husband make larger profits.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's milk sales business.

loans.name: Irshaad

texts.en:
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s livestock business. He will use the loan to buy another buffalo, and this will help him sell a larger quantity of milk and increase his profits. 
Irshaad has two sons, neither of whom are of school-going age yet. Irshaad is a housewife who stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also helps her husband to operate his milk sales business. Her husband has run this business for the past 15 years and Irshaad is very confident of the success of his business expansion after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's milk sales business.

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Langat is a farmer in Litein, South Rift Kenya. He is 41 years old and has been farming for 20 years and currently employs 2 farmhands. His farm produces tea, milk and horticultural products.

Langat has requested a loan of 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter to help him feed his dairy cows.  He adds that the increased income from the improved production from his cows will go into educating his children. He also wants to improve the quality of his breeds in the future.

He says unreliable markets and fluctuation in milk prices are challenges in dairy farming.

loans.use: purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Sughran Mai

texts.en:
Sughran Mai is 44 years old, married and has three sons. Her youngest son is studying in 9th class while the other two sons work to contribute to the family financially. 
Sughran Mai's husband has a livestock business. He has some buffaloes from which he gets milk and sells it to customers in the community for a profit. His rates are very fair and he also believes in selling good quality milk. This is why he has a good number of customers. 
Sughran Mai is a housewife and performs her household duties, but in her spare time she also helps her husband in his business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. He will buy another buffalo with the loan amount. This will help him to increase his business' milk productivity and help him serve more customers and increase profits. He has been operating his business for the past ten years and Sughran Mai is hopeful that, after the loan investment, his business will expand further.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's milk sales business.

loans.name: Irshaad

texts.en:
Irshaad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s livestock business. By using the loan, her husband will buy another cow that will help him get a larger quantity of milk. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 10 years. 
 
She is a housewife and a mother of two children. Her eldest son is studying while her youngest son spends time at home and doesn’t go to school. 
Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for her husband as it will not only help him buy a business asset but also increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is married and her husband is a salesman by profession. He sells different edible items likes candies, chips and biscuits at different departmental stores for a profit. He has good number of business contacts and makes a good number of sales every month. Bushra is very talented and knows the art of sewing clothes. She uses her skills to earn money for her family. She is also a very good administrator and runs her household expenses very well. She has given birth to four children. All of them are getting their education except the youngest one who is only five years old and hasn’t started his education yet.
 
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy edible items in bulk quantity to increase his sales and profits. Bushra is very confident that her husband’s business will grow well after the loan investment.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy candies, chips, biscuits, etc to sell

loans.name: Aliya's Group

texts.en:
Aliya is married and her husband operates a business selling shoe buckles. Aliya got married after completing her matriculation and couldn’t study any further. Now she operates a business selling ready-made garments. She is the mother of five children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who is a salesman and sells candies, biscuits and chips at different general stores at a profit. With the loan, he will buy these products in bulk, which will allow him to fulfill the larger orders on time and make more profits. Aliya is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and increase his profits. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy candies, biscuits and chips to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 39-year-old single mother of 3 children with ages ranging from 5 to 12. She considers herself to be a visionary woman. 

Rose operates a retail store where she sells sugar, rice, beans, maize, sodas and bread in a shopping centre. She has been in this business for 3 years.  Before this she was involved in farming. She describes her biggest business challenges is inflation and seasonality. 

Rose will use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase sugar and maize to sell at her store. She hopes to be able to expand her business to wholesale and to open retail shops in various towns one day in the future.

loans.use: purchase sugar and maize

loans.name: Rofina

texts.en:
Rofina is 40 years old.  She is married and has 7 children -- 3 of whom are still in school. She has been active in farming 10 years and currently employs 2 farmhands. Her farm produces vegetables, milk and tomatoes. She also runs a grocery shop at the local market in Kitale in Western Kenya for additional income.

Rofina has requested a loan of 48,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase  and insure a dairy cow. This is her second loan request and she reiterates that the loan has improved her family's living standards.  She hopes to generate enough income to raise the number of cows she has to 6 in five years.

Rofina points to animal diseases and costly feeds as the main challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a movie maker and photographer. He offers his services at different parties and marriage ceremonies. With the loan, he will buy a new digital movie camera that will allow him to offer better quality movie-making services to his clients and earn him better profits. 

Fehmida herself is very caring lady. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Fehmida is hopeful that an investment will help her husband grow his business and increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Fehmida.

loans.use: To buy a new digital movie camera

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Kipunguni Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is a member of the "Kipunguni" group, which consists of seven members.  He has a business selling doughnuts stuffed with minced meat.  He works from 4:00 p.m to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Married and in his 40s, Mohamed has two children who go to school.

He seeks a loan to buy 50 kilos (110 pounds) of baking flour, a small bucket of cooking oil, two kilos (4.4 pounds) of sugar and a sack of charcoal.  This will be Mohamed's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  His other loans were used to increase his stock for his business, and he repaid these in full.

Mohamed will share this loan with his "Kipunguni" group members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and charcoal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jhune

texts.en:
Jhune is now 27 and still single. He finished his tertiary education but due to lack of job opportunities, he engages in a hog raising business to help his parents in financing the education of his youngest brother and sister who are still in college. He has operated this business for almost three years earning profits of only 6,400 PHP selling two heads of pigs on a live weight basis.

He aims to raise more pigs so that he can earn more income when he sells them. Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an additional 7,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that through his patience and hard work, he will be able to improve the business someday. He hopes that in the future he will be able to build his own house and raise his own family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 23, married with three children age seven and below, and has been farming for three years in the Kitale area of western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, eggs and maize which she sells to the local market. She runs a motorcycle business for additional income.

Christine has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, this being her third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. She says the loan will enable her purchase more birds for her poultry business. She says her focus is to be a major supplier of poultry birds and eggs in the area and expand her farm to 2,000 birds in number.

Christine says she will pay back the loan, since Juhudi loans have been of great help to her family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her livestock business. She operates this business and currently has two goats. She purchases the goats from animal markets and sells them for a profit after raising them. With the loan, she will buy a buffalo to start a milk-selling business. The milk business is in great demand in her community and people earn good profits from this business. 

She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her eldest daughter is studying while the others are not of school-going age yet. She is very confident that after the loan investment, she will be able to establish her milk-selling business and makes it profitable as well.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zareena.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to start a milk-selling business

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is 37 years old, married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school getting their education. 
Ameeran owns and operates a dairy business at her home. For this purpose, she has a buffalo. She gets up early in the morning, milks the buffalo and than supplies the milk to her community clients. She sells the milk at reasonable rates. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo, which will help her get a larger quantity of milk and increase her sales and profits. She has been doing her business for sometime now and is confident that her business will grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 32 years old, married to Rael, and not yet blessed with children. He offers photocopying and printing services to the students of Kenyatta University. He has been doing this business for the last twelve years and gets an income of 10,000 KES per month.

He is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. with which he plans to buy more plain photocopying and printing paper. He will use the extra for future investments.

Sammy hopes to venture into M-PESA (phone money transfer) services. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy more plain photocopying and printing paper.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 37 and married with six children between the ages of four and seventeen years old. He has been farming in his hometown of Litein South Rift, Kenya, for the last 10 years and currently employs one farmhand. His farm produces tea, milk and maize which all go to the local market.

Simion has made a loan request of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says the additional income will help him build a modern dairy unit for his dairy cows and pay school fees for the children. This is Simion's third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo.

He is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the financial support and sees animal disease as the main challenge in his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Raut's Group

texts.en:
Raut is very active and caring lady. She does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is the mother of two sons. Both of them are enrolled in school and getting their education. Her husband is a factory worker who earns a reasonable income every month. 

Raut has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who has a business selling animals. He buys animals from the animal markets and sells to butchers and other customers for a profit. With the loan, he will buy a cow that will allow him to fill the order of his client and earn profit. 
 
Raut is very confident that her brother-in-law’s business will grow in a positive direction after making a loan investment in it.

loans.use: To buy a cow to sell.

loans.name: Samih

texts.ru: Самих проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Самих занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива, чтобы посеять на 1 га земли лук и морковку.
texts.en: Samih lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 36 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Samih is involved in agriculture.  He grows vegetables for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel in order to plant onions and carrots on 1 hectare of land.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
A caring lady, Razia carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She makes the utmost effort in providing comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.  She is known in her community for her hospitality. She is always ready to help her family members and in general. No one gets complaints from her on any reason.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a computer center where he sells computer parts (cables, computer mouse and keyboards etc) to his customers on reasonable rates. He sells the genuine items, and that’s why people prefer buying from him than others. With the loan, he will buy computer parts to put in his shop for selling. 

Razia is confident that her husband’s business will be established better after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy computer parts for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 29 and married with three children between the ages of six and eight. He has been actively farming in his hometown of Litein South Rift, Kenya, for the last 10 years. His farm currently produces maize and milk, which both go to the local market and supplement the family's food requirements. He also works as a mason.

Charles has made a loan request of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this second loan will help him pay for his children's education and improve his family's standard of living. He is optimistic his farming business will continue to grow.

Charles says the lack of animal feed and drought make farming, especially dairy farming (which requires water and feed), quite challenging.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very efficiently. 

Her husband is a vegetable seller and is the only breadwinner in the family. Mumtaz is the mother of five children. All of them are enrolled in local school and getting their education.  

It is very difficult for Mumtaz and her husband to afford the living and education expenses of their children, and that’s why her husband wants to improve his vegetable selling business for which reason Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell to his customers. He has a good experience in his business and Mumtaz is confident that his business will be improved further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Victory

texts.en:
To generate additional income, Victory has engaged in a hog-raising business in their village for almost eight years now. He is 35 and married, and has only one child. They live in a village where they plant and harvest rice and vegetables for sale. He wants to become financially stable so he can provide all his family needs, especially the education of their child. They want him to finish his studies and become a professional someday. 

Despite the hardships of life, they continue to work and strive to earn income and satisfy their needs. Due to financial difficulty, Victory is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines peso (P) to buy feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. He believes that with his patience and sacrifices, he can be able to make the business grow. He hopes that someday, he will put up a variety store for his wife to manage.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Mrs. Min is a 36-year-old married woman from the Baray District, Kompong Thom Province. She is a good mother of eight children who are all single. 

Min is a woman who works hard to support her family’s expenditure. At present, Min generates her profit by farming. From this micro-enterprise, she earns a low daily income. Taking time from this business, Min also tries hard to sell fish at the market. She earns around 2 USD per day. To help her with additional income, her two daughters are working as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh City where they earn a sufficient salary every month. 

Min wants to buy a piece of farmland to increase her output and advance her living standards. However, she lacks the money, so Min has already decided with her family to request funding through HKL, a partner of Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase a piece of farmland. She expects that this financing will help her family gather prosperity and increase output.

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Mumtazan's Group

texts.en:
Mumtazan is married and her husband has a business selling milk. Mumtazan also offers her full support to her husband in his business. She takes care of his cow by giving timely food and water. She milks the cow every morning while her husband delivers the milk to people's homes. 

Mumtazan is 34 years old and doesn’t have any children.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another cow to get a larger quantity of milk for selling. He has a good experience in his business and he has a good number of clients in his region. 

Mumtazan is very hopeful that an investment will help him make more profit by selling a larger quantity of milk. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another cow for milk selling business.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is 36 years old and has six children. Her son works while her daughters are getting their education. Her brother also lives with her and operates a washing machine spare parts business.  

Shabana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her brother’s business. With the loan, her brother will buy spare parts in larger quantity to sell to his customers and earn better profit.  

Shabana is hopeful that after the loan investment, her brother’s business will grow further and he will be able to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy washing machine spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar, rice, maize flour, etc. to sell

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip has been in active mixed farming for 17 years, with his produce of tea and milk going to the local market. He is married with 6 children aged 16 and below with the first five still schooling.

He has requested for a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for a venture in a transportation business. He adds that the income will help him in educating his children and improve their living standards. He hopes to manage the business and buy a car in future.

Philip says the poor roads network in the area is making all the businesses expensive to run.

loans.use: To purchase a motocycle

loans.name: Fatima Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Fatima bibi is a caring lady who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She performs her work very efficiently. She takes care of everyone's needs and makes the utmost effort to fulfill them. 

Her husband runs a tea stall in the market where he serves tea of different flavors, such as green tea, milky, and creamy tea. He has a good customer base and serves them with good and tasty tea. He also serves them with good quality biscuits and nimko (a snack mix) which enriches the taste of his tea. 

Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's tea stall. With the loan, he will buy tea, sugar, and milk in bulk to offer better services to his clients and earn a good income. 

Fatima is hopeful that her husband's business will be established further after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy tea, sugar and milk for a tea stall business

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr:
Cliente 47 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et 30 ans. Ayant vu la charge de sa famille, elle se met dans la vente des bananes fruits, elle vend en moyenne 15.000frs a 20.000 frs par jour.

A l'octroi de son prêt elle va acheter des régimes de bananes vertes au port soit a la grande gare, qu'elle fait murir chez elle et vend tous les jours dans un marche de son quartier du matin jusqu'au soir.

Tres entreprenante, elle fait vivre sa famille avec les recettes de son activité et elle épargne beaucoup pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif, celui de louer un camion  et aller elle même acheter la banane sur place  dans les régions productrices de bananes et a la fin devenir fournisseuse des bananes .
texts.en:
The client is 47 years old, married and the mother of 5 children whose ages vary between 8 and 30 years. Having assumed the responsibility of her family, she began the sale of bananas. She sells, on average, 15,000 frs to 20,000 frs a day.  

Once this loan is granted, she is going to buy bunches of green bananas at the port at the big station. She ripens them at her home and sells them all day in a market in her district from morning until night. 

Very enterprising, she makes a living for her family with the profits from her business and she's saving a lot in order to achieve her goal, to rent a truck and to go herself to buy the bananas locally in a banana-producing region and, in the end, to become a banana supplier.

loans.use: To buy bunches of bananas

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Nasreen, has a sewing business at her home. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to supplement the income of her family. She sews clothes with perfect measurements, which are admired by her customers. In her working experience, she has never received any complaints from her customers. 

Her husband has a livestock business. He buys animals from animal markets and sells them to butchers after raising them. He has been in this profession for many years. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) for selling to earn better profits. 

Nasreen is hopeful that her husband's business will be established further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for selling

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a widow and a mother of 9, with only two still minors and schooling. She has been in farming for the last 35 years and currently produces milk and tea which go to the local market. She currently employs two farm hands on the farm. She gets additional income from her pension.

Jane has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 52,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will help enable her to educate her last two children. She remains hopeful her business will continue to grow and give better returns.

Jane mentions the lack of ready markets for farm produce as the challenge in farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Aloe Vera products and gourmet coffee to sell

loans.name: Badmaa

texts.en:
Badmaa is 38 years old and lives with her daugther and husband in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver and his monthly salary is 450,000 MNT. Badmaa operates flour and rice selling business. She buying flour and rice from the factories and selling them at retail prices, since 2003. She is continuously managing the business. She pays 78,000 MNT in rent for the commercial space. Her daily sales income is 150,000 MNT while her monthly profit is between 400,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT. She has gained much business experience and skills in her field. 

She is a diligent and nice woman who says, "I think people learn by doing and making mistakes." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase 185 bags of flour.

loans.use: To purchase 185 bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat is 35 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in a house in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His daughter is a high school student and his wife helps him to manage the family business. He started his business at Hangai wood trade market in 1990 and now is continuously managing the business. He buys wood that fills one truck at 600,000 MNT from wholesale market and retails smaller quantities of wood at 5,000 MNT, 15,000 MNT and 20,000 MNT.  He pays monthly rent for a commercial space of 45,000 MNT. His daily sales income is 100,000 MNT and his monthly profit is between 700,000 MNT to 800,000 MNT. 

He is planning to expand his business. He is very experienced at his field. He is a diligent and responsible man who says, "I want to fix my house with the profits I will earn from my business." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase 2 truck loads of wood.

loans.use: To purchase 2 truck loads of wood to sell

loans.name: Umitker

texts.en:
Umitker is 44 years old and lives with her four children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or circular tent) in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her three children go to the high schools and her youngest son goes to kindergarden.

She started to sell dairy products in 2003. She buys dairy products at 5,000 MNT during the summer time and sells them back at 8,000 MNT and earns the profit from the difference price. She is planning to buy dairy products now and store them. She plans to sell them back when the price goes up. She also plans to open a shop that sells dairy products.

She is a very optimistic and hard-working woman who says "I want to educate my children very well, expand my business and open a dairy-product shop." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy dairy products for her business.

loans.use: to buy dairy products

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr:
Dodji est un homme âgé 27 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant.
Dodji travaille comme revendeur  depuis 2008. Il achète et revend des chaussures pour les hommes. Il travaille avec un seul employé. 
Dodji a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter les marchandises. Il veut augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. 
Dans les prochaines années, Dodji voudrait ouvrir une nouvelle boutique de vente de chaussures. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit aider sa famille.
texts.en: Dodji is a 27-year-old man. He is single and doesn't have any children. Dodji has been working as a reseller since 2008. He buys and resells men's shoes. He works with a single employee. Dodji has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy goods. He would like to grow his business. In the coming years, Dodji would like to open a new boutique to sell shoes. He says that, with the profits, he plans to help his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 41 years old, married to Solomon, and they are blessed with two children who are over 18 years of age.  She has been in the hardware business for the last two years, making a monthly profit of 40,000 KES.  She has been loaned 60,000 KES and this is her second loan. She plans to purchase tiles, sinks, etc. for sale.

With the anticipated profit she plans to expand her business and also invest in other profitable businesses. In the near future she hopes to be a great supplier of building materials in the area.

loans.use: to purchase tiles, sinks, etc. for sale

loans.name: Ethan

texts.en:
Ethan is 35 years old, married to Jane and they are blessed with two children aged eight and three years old. He has been selling and supplying charcoal for the past eight years, making a monthly profit of 32,000 KES. He has been loaned 50,000 KES, which he plans to use to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale and supply.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to expand his business and also educate his children to higher levels of education. In the near future, he hopes to grow his business, buy a lorry (truck) for transportation and also build a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot is the father of two children aged 8 and 4 years. He resides in Litein, South Rift, Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for four years. He is himself 29 years old.

Cheruiyot has made a loan request of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business. He says this second loan will help him spread the risk experienced in farming business and harsh weather conditions. He adds that lack of market for farm produce, too, is a great challenge and the main reason he decided to venture into a transportation business. He says the loan will uplift his living standards.

Cheruiyot reiterates that harsh weather conditions and poor markets for farm produce are the greatest limitations in the farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been a farmer in his hometown of Kitale for over 10 years, producing and selling milk, eggs, maize and vegetables and selling to the local market. He has also been in a motorcycle transport business. He is married with four children, two adults and two minors who are still in school.

James has made a loan request of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds at 30,000 KES as well as build a bigger and better poultry unit (building) at 60,000 KES. He says this third loan from Juhudi will make his farming business better and improve his family's living standards.

He adds that diseases and poultry feed scarcity are real challenges, though they are surmountable.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds and construct a poultry unit

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon, a 29-year-old married father of two children aged five and four years, is a resident of Kitale,Western Kenya, where he has been a farmer for four years, producing and selling milk, beans and eggs.

Nixon will be receiving his third loan from Juhudi Kilimo, this time for 60,000 KES, to purchase more poultry to increase his egg production. Providing more income for his family and quickly repaying the loan are his immediate priorities.

Nixon says a scarcity of both animal and poultry feeds remains a challenge to the farmers.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 50 years old and is married with four children. Two of his children are adults and two are still in school. Joel has been a farmer and dairyman for over 10 years and he also runs a retail shop at the local market to supplement his income.

Joel is requesting a 61,200 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and to construct a dairy at 30,000 KES.  He says this will improve his farm’s output and ensure that his family gets milk for consumption as well as having milk to sell. Joel says his greatest business challenge is the high cost of artificial insemination. He will use his increased income to provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and to build a dairy

loans.name: Diégane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié polygamme avec deux femmes et 7 enfants.Il vend des produits agricoles en saison sèche et  pratique l'agriculture et l'embouche bovine en période hivernale.Cette diversité d'activités lui permet d'avoir des revenus correstes pour nourrir sa grande famille.En cette période d'hivernage, il sollicite un pret de 500000F pour acheter deux boeufs afin de les engraisser et de les revendre sur le marché local.Son ambition est d'avoir une grande ferme d'élevage.
texts.en: Diégane is a polygamist with 2 wives and 7 children. He sells agricultural products during the dry season and practices farming and cattle fattening during the winter months. This range of activities allows him to earn enough money to feed his large family. He is requesting a loan of 500 000 francs for the coming winter, so that he can buy 2 oxen to fatten and resell at the local market. His ultimate ambition is to own a large cattle farm.

loans.use: to buy 2 oxen.

loans.name: Koufoula

texts.fr:
Koufoula travaille comme couturière depuis 2009. Elle achete des bazins et pagnes qu’elle confectionne pour revendre à sa clientèle dans sa maison. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école, le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 6 ans.
Elle travaille dans son entreprise. 
Koufoula a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter d’acheter des bazins et pagnes. Elle veut accroître ses ventes.
Dans les prochaines années, Koufoula voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Koufoula works as a tailor since 2009. She buys traditional cloth, bazins and pagnes, that she fashions to resell to her customers at her home. She has 3 children who all go to school, the oldest is 12 and the youngest is 6.  Koufoula has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy the traditional cloth bazins and pagnes. She wants to increase her sales. In the coming years, Koufoulaouw would like to open a boutique. She says that, with the profits, she plans to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth bazins and pagnes

loans.name: Stanly

texts.en:
Stanly is 52 years old and the father of two children, ages four and 11. Both of his children are in school. For the past 10 years, Stanly has been a farmer in Kitale, his hometown. He sells his milk and vegetables at the local market. 

Stanly is requesting a 30,000 KES loan through the Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. He says the poultry business will provide his family with eggs as well as additional income to provide for other family needs. Stanly’s major business challenges are the high cost of poultry feed and disease management.

In the future, he will focus on becoming a large-scale farmer in the region.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Groupe Bok Joubo

texts.fr: Le groupe "Bok Jubo" est composé de femmes mariées qui pratique l'élevage durant toute l'année.Elles achètent des chèvres ou des moutons qu'elles engraissent et revendent avec une marge bénéficiaire allant de 50000 à 70000F.Ces revenus leur permettent de satisfaire leurs besoins, ceux de leurs enfants et de participer également aux dépenses d'alimentation de leurs familles respectives.Le chef de groupe (en beu à droite) , pratique cette activité depuis l'age de 17 ans, à coté de sa grande mère maternelle. Elle vit avec son mari et ses quatre enfants.Le groupe sollicite actuellement un pret de 500000F pour acheter 10 moutons qui seront élevés durant 6 mois et revendus sur les marchés hebdomadaires de la zone.
texts.en: The Bok Jubo group is made up of married women who spend the year livestock farming. They buy goats or sheep which are then fattened up and resold for a profit between 50 000 and 70 000 francs. This income allows them to provide for their own needs and those of their children, as well as to contribute equally to the household expenses of their respective families. The group´s leader (the woman in blue on the right of the picture) has been livestock farming since she was 17, alongside her maternal grandmother. She lives with her husband and four children. Bok Jubo are requesting a loan of 500 000 francs with which to buy 10 sheep which will be kept for 6 months and then resold at the weekly markets in the area.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 35 years old and married with two children between the ages of three months and seven years. For the past four years, he has operated a shop where he sells items such as soap and unga (flour). Amos describes himself as a go-getter who never gives up. His biggest business challenge is competition.

Amos is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy more merchandise and expand his business. This will be his third loan with SMEP. In the future, Amos hopes that he will have a wholesale distribution business.

loans.use: to buy store merchandise

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 56 years old and married. She is a hardworking businesswoman who is blessed with four children. For the last five years, she has been operating a green grocery to make a living. Beatrice earns additional income from dairy farming. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

Beatrice is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy cabbages, onions, and cereals to sell. In the next five years, she would like to expand her business into wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and married to Christine.  They have one child.   John has been manufacturing candles for the last year, making a monthly profit of KES.6,000.  He is requesting a loan of KES.30,000,  with which he plans to purchase raw materials for making candles.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to purchase another machine for making candles.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for making candles,

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is 41 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 19 years old.

Nerissa is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She and her husband till their land together. They grow rice and corn crops to sell. Aside from farming, Nerissa also sells barbecue and chorizo to the people in her community.

Nerissa has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She will also pay the rent for the tractor. She hopes to have a stable income that will enable her to sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 41 year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with five children. For the last five years, he has been managing a hardware business to support the family. He has employed three people to help him to manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to open another outlet of his business. His dream is to expand his business and to improve his living standards. 

He is requesting a loan of KES.50,000 to buy paints and spare parts.  Thanks to the ability to easily access Faulu Kenya's loans,  he was able to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and paints

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is 41 years old and is a married man with 2 children, aged 12 and 3.  He works as a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Norberto plants rice and corn crops on his land and sells his harvest to traders. He earns about 8000 PHP per month doing this farming business.

Norberto has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent. He hopes to improve his family’s living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39 year-old businessman.  He is married and blessed with one child.  For the last five years, he has been operating a welding business to support the family.  He has another source of income in dairy farming. In the next five years, he wants to be successful in his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 57 year-old married woman with 7 children. She works as a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato.  Susan grows rice and corn crops to sell.  She is able to provide for her family through her income from farming.

Susan has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Edouard

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune qui pratique le maraichage sur des terres de plus d'un hectares léguées par ses parents.Il a arrété ses études au lycée et s'est directement engagé dans l'activité agricole qui l'a de tout temps passioné.Il a démarré l'exploitation des terres en 2001 et s'est ensuite marié.Il est aujourd'hui père de deux enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Il cultive des choux, des tomates, des piments et des oignons. Son activité lui permet de bien entretenir sa famille. Il sollicite un pret à l'UIMCEC de 400000F pour réaliser un puits firage dans son champs, ou l'eau n'est réllement disponible suffisament que durant l'hivernage. Son ambition est d'élargir et d'équiper son exploitation.
texts.en: Edouard is a young man who runs a market garden on over a hectare of land inherited from his parents. He left high school in order to start farming, an occupation which he has always been passionate about. He started farming the land in 2001, and then got married. Today, he is the father of 2 children, who both go to school. He grows cabbages, tomatoes, peppers and onions. His business allows him to take care of his family properly. He is asking for a 400 000 francs loan from UIMCEC so that he can drill a well in his field, which does not get enough water, except during the winter months. His goal is to equip and grow his business.

loans.use: to fund a well drilling project.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 51 years old and is married.  She has 8 children.  Her children are between 32 and 14 years old. Veronica’s husband works as a farmer and driver.

Veronica has been engaged in farming for 25 years. She helps her husband till their land and plant crops, such as rice and corn. Veronica applied for a loan because they do not have the capacity to buy the farm inputs that they need. Veronica plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent.

In the future, Veronica hopes to improve their house. She also hopes to have a good business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with 7 children. She is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Virginia plants rice and corn crops on her land and sells her harvest at the market. She earns about 5000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Virginia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Virginia hopes to continue earning from her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. He wakes up early in the morning to attend to his farming duties. Pablito plants rice and corn crops on his land. He said he earns just enough to buy his family’s basic needs.

Pablito works hard to support his family of a wife and 2 children. His children are 5 and 10 years old.

This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers. Pablito hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 36 year-old hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last 8 years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. He earns extra income by selling cereals. In the next 5 years, he wants to be successful in dairy farming. 

He is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en:
Paquito is a hard-working man from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. He tills his own land where he plants rice and corn crops. He also raises pigs in his backyard. Paquito sells his harvest and pigs at his town’s market. Paquito works hard to improve his earnings and his family’s living situation.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and feeds. Paquito hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feeds.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hardworking businessman, age 33. He is married and blessed with a child. 

For the last 10 years, he has been managing a retail business where he sells utensils. He also sells cereals for more income. In the next five years, he wants to be stable in his business. 

He is requesting for a loan of 10,000 KES to buy more utensils.

loans.use: To buy more utensils.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a hardworking businesswoman, age 27. She is married and blessed with one child. 

She has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has been able to access financial resources, hence improving her business.  

In the next five years, she wants to become financially stable. Her dream is transform her business to wholesale. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar.

loans.use: To buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 15 years old.

Anabelle is engaged in farming. She plants rice and corn crops on her land. Anabelle earns enough to buy her family's basic needs. She said it is hard to sustain her children's education, especially now that tuition fees get higher every year.

Anabelle is requesting a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide. She hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a hardworking business woman, age 28. She is married and blessed with two children. 

For the last four years, she has been operating a mobile-phone money-transfer business. She also sells eggs and cereals to earn more income for her family. 

In the next five years, she wants her business to be successful. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy eggs, beans, maize and rice. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been educated to manage the business.

loans.use: To buy eggs, beans and rice.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a 53-year-old married man with five children. The oldest child is 22 years old.

Andres is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Andres works hard to support his family, especially his children's education. One of her daughters needs books for school and Andres does not have the capacity right now.

Andres requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and books for his daughter. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and books for his daughter.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.es:
La señora Soraida vive en un barrio en donde celebran la fiesta del  San Francisco de asís  en el mes de   agosto. Ella es casada con el señor Rubiel  y con quien procreo tres hijos que aún están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella invirtió el préstamo en la actividad de venta de cosméticos de la marca avon y jafra en donde lleva practicando 9 años y 8 meses y comenta que le va muy bien ya que le ha dado un buen rendimiento y ha tenido una mejor ganancia.

   Para dedicarse a esta actividad se inspiro ella sola ya que quiere  apoyar a su esposo  quien trabaja en la construcción de block y ella deseaba apoyarlo con los ingresos de la casa para así darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

    Lo que le gustaría es que con el tiempo se distribuidora  de cosméticos para darle empleo a otras personas y también puedan iniciar un negocio.
texts.en:
Soraida lives in a neighborhood where the celebrate the festival of St. Francis of Assisi in August. She is married to Rubiel and with him she's had three children who are still in her care. 

She invested the loan into the business of selling Avon and Jafra cosmetics for nine yeas and eight months, and she says that she has done well and gotten a good salary. 

She motivated herself to do this business because she wants to support her husband who works in block construction and she wants to help him with the household costs in order to give her children a better life. 

What she would like is that, with time, to distribute cosmetics herself to give employment to others and they can also start a business.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of avon, jafra, and other types of cosmetics.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 39-year-old farmer working in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Arlene does her best to keep her farm productive. She wants to be able to support her family financially.

Arlene has requested a loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide. She hopes that this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and one liter of insecticide.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
La señora  María Estela vive en un barrio  en el que las personas   viven en un lugar que es como una ladera y se puede ver todo el pueblo, ella es casada  con el señor  Jorge Amín y con quien procreo  dos hijos  que aun  viven con ella.

   Estela se dedica a su hogar y también  trabaja de afanadora en  banco, así también solicito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la  compra  de materiales  para elaborar piñatas en la que  practica desde hace cuatro año  y le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido también  buen resultado.

   Ella se inspiro en esta actividad ya  que  recibió  curso y le gusto practicarlo y ve que si le está  dando buen resultado ya que le encargan  en la fiestas de cumpleaños  y la elabora como sus clientes prefieren.

    Lo que más desea es que a hora que ya tiene un local  pueda agrandar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos  y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Señora María Estela lives in a neighbourhood that is like living on a hillside where you can see the whole town. She is married to Señor Jorge Amín with whom she has 2 children who live with her. 

Estela takes care of her home and also works as a cleaner in a bank. She asked for the loan in order to buy the materials to make piñatas, something she has been doing for 4 years and which is going well with good results. 

She was inspired to take up this craft as a result of a course she took. She likes to practice and see that it is paying off, being hired for birthday parties and making the piñatas that her clients prefer. 

What she wants most of all, now that she has a place to work, is to grow her business to improve her income and continue working.

loans.use: to buy the materials necessary to make piñatas.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  señora María del Carmen, vive en un barrio muy lindo y todas las personas pertenecen a la misma religión, ella es casada con el señor Adán y  a su responsabilidad tienen una hija de 20 años de edad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en ala comprar de pollos de granja  para luego venderlo destazado en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva 4 años y 4 meses, comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  ha tenido un buen ingresos para sostener a su  familia.

 Inicio esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar y así él no se vea muy presionado con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
María del Carmen lives in a very beautiful neighborhood and all the people belong to the same religion. She is married to Adán and they have a 20 year old daughter in their care. 

She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of farm chicken to later sell butchered in the same place. She has been in this business for four years and four months. She says that she is doing well since since with it she has good income to support her family. 

She began this business to support her husband with the household costs and so that he does not feel very pressured by the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of farm chickens to later sell butchered.

loans.name: Deicy Leany

texts.es:
Desde hace 9 años Deicy Leany se ha dedicado a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos, y conocidos, labor que le ha permitido generar ingresos para su hogar. Sin embargo actualmente enfrenta dificultades económicas, lo que le ha impedido el progreso de su negocio y sus ganancias ya que no cuenta con capital para comprar la mercancía que sus clientes solicitan, y es por tal motivo que hoy solicita un crédito, el cual invertirá en surtido de mayor variedad y cantidad, ya que así generará mas utilidades y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida mejorará. 

Deicy sueña con un mejor futuro, y día a día trabaja con la motivación de hacer este sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Deicy Leany has been selling merchandise to her family, friends and acquaintances for nine years. This work has allowed her to generate income for her household. Nevertheless, she is currently facing economic difficulties that have impeded the progress of her business and her earnings, as she does not have enough capital to buy the merchandise that her customers request. This is why she is now requesting a loan, which she will invest in stocking a greater variety and quantity of merchandise. This way, she will generate more profits and her quality of life will improve proportionately.

Deicy dreams of a better future and day by day, she is motivated to work to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy, 43, lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur, with her family. She is married and has two children age 19 and 18.

Daisy is a farmer. She has been growing and selling rice for five years. Daisy does her best to support her family. She hopes to have enough capital to start another business.

Daisy has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Delcker De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Delker de Jesús,  es de un lugar donde la gente es muy unida ya que cuando hay alguna fiesta todos se organizan  para celébralo. Ella es casada con e l señor salvador  y con quien procreo  un hijo  que aun esta a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ropas para damas, caballeros, niño y niñas,  para luego  venderlo en las comunidades cercanas del pueblo, en donde lleva practicando dos años y ocho meses y comenta que le va bien ya que le ha dado un buen resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo  ha esta actividad fue su familia  para aportar también con los  ingresos d el casa y así mejorar su calidad de vida y sí está viendo un bien resultado.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad  pueda ahorrara para   agrandar mas  su negocio que es lo que lo motiva  a seguir trabajando como también apoyar a su  hijo en su educación.
texts.en:
Delker de Jesus is from a place where the people are very united, because when there is a festival everyone helps to organize the celebration.  She is married to Salvador, and they have a dependent child.

Delker requests a loan to purchase clothing for women, men, boys and girls.  She will later sell this clothing in the communities close to her town.  She has been doing this work for 2 years and 8 months, and she comments that it is going well and is giving her good results.

She was motivated to start this business so that she could help out her family by contributing more income to the household.  This way she can improve their quality of life, and in fact, she is seeing this happen. 

What she most desires is that with this activity, she will be able to save to expand her business. This is what motivates her to keep on working so that she can support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy clothing to later sell

loans.name: Katie

texts.en:
“The future of our business is bright. My hope is with time and dedication to our customers we will continue to grow and be able to help others reach their dreams.” 

Katie's retail business began operating from her Amazon site in January of this year and has been very successful in selling toiletry, crafts and variety products. When she discovered that she could turn her hobby into a business, she and her family dedicated their time to making it a success. Katie decided to devote the website to craft and scrapbooking supplies.  In an effort to formalize the business, she incorporated in July and began revamping her existing website, which was separate from her Amazon site. The improved website--due to be launched next month--will be connected to her Amazon site. Katie also works full-time as a paramedic instructor and helps support her family with her business.

She will use this loan to increase her inventory purchases and finalize payments for the website.

loans.use: To buy inventory for business growth and pay for a website

loans.name: Obelva

texts.es:
La señora   Obelva, es casada con el señor Francisco y con quien procreo   tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y estudian en secundaria y primaria.
 
    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  herramientas para su taxi, en donde lleva practicando   diez años y comenta que le va muy bien ya que con ellos ha logrado estar sacando    adelante su familia.

   Lo que lo  motivo  a dedicarse a esta actividad fue su papá quien la animo a  tener un negocio  que le deje ganancia  y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingreso de la casas y no verse limitada con el dinero.
 
    Lo quemas desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir obteniendo un  poco mas de ahorro para ir aumentado día con día su actividad  y así a poyarse con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Obelva is married to Francisco, and they have 3 dependent children who are in elementary and middle school.

She is requesting a loan to purchase tools for her taxi.  She has had this taxi business for 10 years, and she says that it is going very well because with it she and her husband have managed to get ahead with their family.

Her father encouraged her to have her own business and income, and so this motivated her to devote herself to this business.  With the business, she can contribute income to the household and not be constrained by a lack of money.

What she wants the most is to save money over time with this activity, so that she can gradually expand the business and rely on this income.

loans.use: to pay for tools for her taxi

loans.name: Edwelyn

texts.en:
Edwelyn is 48 years old and married. She has three children. The oldest child is 19 years old.

Edwelyn and her husband are both farmers. She helps in tilling their land and planting rice crops. Edwelyn does her best to support her family. She makes rice cakes and other delicacies and sells them to the people in her community.

Edwelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She said she wants to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Las señora Teresa, vive en un barrio lejano  que para bajar a la ciudad  se  tiene que caminar hasta la carretera y de ahí trasladarse en transporte colectivo. Ella es casada con el señor Orbelin y con quien procreo  dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en al compra de ropas para damas y caballero, en donde lleva practicando cinco años y comenta que le va bien  pues ha visto un buen resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad  fue su  esposo quien le dijo que le daría unos ahorros para que pusiera un negocio y ella solicito el préstamo  para apoyarse y compra algo de mejor calidad.

  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda ir mejorando  día con día y tener sus propios ahorros para sacar adelante a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in an outlying neighborhood - in order to go down into the city she has to walk to the highway and take collective transportation from there. She is married to Orbelin and they have 2 children who are still in her care.

She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of clothes for women and men. She has been doing this for 5 years and says that it's going well and she has seen good results. She started this activity because her husband gave her some savings to put into a business and she took out a loan to support her and buy better quality goods.

What she wants most from this small business is to improve daily and to have her own savings to help her children get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fredy Alberto

texts.es:
Félix Alberto  tiene 37 años de edad, es casado, vive  junto a su esposa su  hijo de 16 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 28 DE ENERO  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Retorno Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Canton Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agricolas de ciclo corto siembra de maiz y arroz.

Félix se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en un Comercial en Puerto Pechiche y las Vende en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, abono y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a la familia y que el negocio se incremente.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felix Alberto, 37, is married and lives with his wife and 16-year-old son in the canton of Ventanas in Los Rios province. 

The village bank 28 de Enero is located in the area known as El Retorn Puerto Pechiche which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The bank members work in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops like corn and rice.

Felix is a farmer who plants corn and rice. He buys his products in a business in Puerto Pechiche and sells them there and in Ventanas.
