loans.name: Maximo Alejandro

texts.es:
Máximo Alejandro tiene 43 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos de 23, 18 años de edad en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Máximo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno para poder hacer una casa para la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Máximo Alejandro, 43, is married and lives with his wife and two children, 23 and 18, in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the Caminando Hacia el Futuro Communal Bank, located in the Jesús de Gran Poder area of Ventanas Canton, work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Máximo works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  He buys his products in Marlín Store and in the stalls there and in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for his crops.  The support of the loan would help him economically to supplement his needs, to confront challenges like disease and illness.  His dream is to be able to buy a piece of land to build a house for his family.

In his spare time, Máximo likes to go for walks and spend more time working.

loans.use: to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Digna Patricia

texts.es:
Digna Patricia tiene 21 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos de 5, 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Digna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Digna Patricia, 21, is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 8, in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of Caminando Hacia el Futuro Communal Bank, located in the Jesús de Gran Poder area of Ventanas Canton, work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Digna works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  She buys her products in Marlín Store and in the stalls there and in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for the crops.  The support of the loan would help her economically to supplement her needs, to confront challenges like disease and illness.  Her dream is to be able to have her own piece of land to be able to work better.

In her spare time, Digna likes to go for walks and spend more time working.

loans.use: to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Rachel Edith

texts.es:
Rachel, administra un comedor, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad, este negocio de Rachel fue heredado por su madre, lleva 11 años trabajando en él, lo atiende de 7:00am a 5:00pm de lunes a domingo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo construir una galera en el solar, para cocinar en un lugar más amplio, comprara laminas, madera, clavos, alambre, arena y cemento, mano de obra, para poder realizar el trabajo.
Este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ampliándolo y mejorando así su condición de microempresaria.
texts.en:
Rachel runs a small eatery. She lives with her husband and two children, ages 15 and 11. 

Rachel's business was inherited by her mother. She has been working there for 11 years, and her hours of business are from 7:00am to 5:00pm, Monday to Sunday.  

Now she is applying for a loan to build a shed on the lot, in order to have a larger space to cook in.  To carry out this work, she will buy metal sheeting, wood, nails, wire, sand, cement and labor. This loan will help her to make her business better; enlarging it and improving her status as a small business owner.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, nails, wire, sand, cement and labor.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 38 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos en la primaria que dependen de la señora Aurora. Ella tiene un negocio de renta de trajes para caballeros y tiene con este negocio desde hace 7 años, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo y vende pan en las tardes, en la tienda de ropa donde rentan los trajes para caballero su suegra es la que le ayuda a atenderlo mientras ella en la mañana sale a vender sus productos por catalogo y a las 3 de la tarde va a una panadería y compra conchas y las vende en su colonia. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de trajes, camisas, corbatas, moños en diferentes colores, corbatines, chalecos de diferentes colores para eventos de quinceañeras, y también para invertir en el pan ya que es un muy buen negocio que le deja buenas ganancias. La meta que tiene Aurora es salir adelante con sus pequeños hijos y darles una buena educación, además ella quisiera poner una panadería estable en su casa.
texts.en:
Aurora, 38, is married and has three children in elementary school who depend on her.

For seven years she has had a business renting men's suits.  She also sells beauty products from a catalog and sells bread in the afternoon.  In the clothing store where they rent the men's suits, her mother-in-law helps her in the morning while Aurora goes out to do her catalog sales.  At 3 in the afternoon, Aurora goes to a bakery and buys "conchas" (sweet rolls shaped like shells) to sell in her neighborhood.

Aurora is requesting a loan to buy suits, shirts, ties, bows in different colors, bow ties, and vests in different colors for "quinceañeras" (galas for girls' 15th birthdays), and also to invest in the bread since it's a very good business that produces good earnings for her.

Aurora's goal is to get ahead with her young children and give them a good upbringing.  She also would like to put a stable bakery in her house.

loans.use: to rent suits for events.

loans.name: William Heriberto

texts.es:
William, es empleado, soltero, vive con su madre y una hermana, el joven trabaja en la alcaldía municipal, lleva 6 años laborando, él apoya mucho a su familia, cubriendo algunos gastos del hogar.
Actualmente necesita cubrir los gastos educativos de su hermana, por esta razón solicita el préstamo, ya que por su trabajo se le dificulta disponer de una sola vez de esta cantidad.
El objetivo de William es apoyar a su familia en lo que sea necesario, más que todo a su hermana que desea que se supere académicamente.
texts.en:
William is an employee.  He is single and lives with his mother and sister.  This young man works for the council.  He has been working for six years and is a big support to his family, covering some of their household expenses.

William currently needs to cover his sister's education expenses.  He is requesting this loan because it is difficult for him to have this sum of money available in one go from his work.

William's goal is to support his family and their needs and above all his sister as he would like her to succeed academically.

loans.use: to cover his sister's education expenses

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María dedicada a la venta de productos de primera necesidad  en su tienda de barrio el crédito que solicito actualmente es para el incremento de capital y compra de una heladera grande para conservar todos lo refrescos y  productos que ofrece a sus clientes, este es su segundo crédito con el financiamiento kiva en el primer crédito ella se encontraba embarazada y para este crédito su hijo ya nació, esta es una de las razones mas fuertes para que ella continúe trabajando con mucho mas esmero y dedicación por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
María sells basic household necessities in her neighborhood store, The loan she is applying for now, is to increase her working capital, and to buy a large refrigerator for keeping soft drinks and other products that she sells to her customers.

This is her second loan financed by Kiva.  At the time of her first loan, she was pregnant, and by this loan, her son was already born.  This is one of the strongest reasons why she continued working, with much more effort and determination, for her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. las edades D. 26 y 21 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. pupusas desD. hace 7 años, trabaja D. lunes a domingo, D. este negocio dependen sus hijos, ya que logra comprarles lo necesario.
Ella invertirá un préstamo en la compra D. láminas para la vivienda, ya que el techo se encuentra deteriorado y esta será una gran ayuda para tener una mejor casa, más segura, sin temor al invierno.
Su objetivo es que a través D. presamos logre crecer, y mejorar aun más el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos para que se superen.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her husband and her two children who are 26 and 21 years old.  She has been selling pupusas for 7 years.  Vilma works from Monday to Sunday and her children are dependent on her business as it enables her to buy what they need.

Vilma will invest her loan in buying sheets of metal for her house as the roof is in a bad state of repair.  This will be a great help as it will improve her home and make it safer, ensuring she doesn't have to fear the winter.

Vilma's goal is to use her loans to grow and further improve her business and to help her children improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal for her roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juices, corn and beans for her store.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Doña Ana, trabaja en servicios domesticos, es casada, madre de tres hijos, su esposo labora como albañil, y junto han logrado la construccion de su casa.
Tiene varios años laborando, ya que ambos apoyan a sus hijos, y todo esta ah altos costos. Y para mejorar su casa, tiene que trabajar. Ahora con los prestamos en Afodenic, se le ha hecho mas rapido avanzar en las mejoras. Ya que son aplazos flexible, equilibran los gastos para cumplir con sus compromiso de pago.
Con el credito anterior logro el repellado en la parte exterior, ahora con este nuevo financiamiento, repellara las paredes de adentro a si como una division para lograr privacidad.
Materiales a comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, arrenilla, esponja, entre otros materiales que ayude con la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Ana works as a housekeeper.  She is married, and the mother of three children. Her husband works in construction, and together they have managed to construct their house.  They have been working on it for several years, since both are supporting their children, and costs for construction are high.

To improve the house, she has to work.  Now, the loans from Afodenic have enabled her to move forward more quickly with the improvements. As the instalments are flexible, they balance their expenditures, so that they can meet their loan payment commitments.

With the previous loan she managed to plaster the exterior part of the house. Now, with this new loan, she will plaster the interior walls, as well as construct dividing walls for privacy. She will buy materials such as stone, sand, cement, fine sand, sponges, and other things that are needed for the project.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for plastering the interior walls of her home, and for dividing it into rooms, for her family's privacy.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: El señor Néstor se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en taxi hace ya mas de diez años en la línea de radio taxi muy solicitado de la zona norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba, solicita el crédito debido  que sufrió un accidente tiene gastos fuertes en la reparación de su vehículo y se quedaron sin capital para la actividad del comercio que realiza su esposa , don Néstor esta casado con la señora María con quien tiene dos niños que se encuentran en edad escolar, el señor es conocedor de la actividad y asegura que cumplirá con sus respectivas cuotas, además que agradece por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Nestor has been transporting passengers by taxi for over ten years.  The radio taxi line has been in great demand in the northern city of Cochabamba.  

He is requesting the loan due to an accident that he suffered and he has expenditures for major repair for his vehicle.  They were left without capital for his wife's business.  Nestor is married to Maria and they have two children who are school age.  He is aware of the activity and ensures that he will meet his respective repayments.  In addition, he is thankful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and get working capital.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor es cliente nuevo  de la institución, Es casado con la señora  Ruth ella es empleada  publica y colabora con su esposo con los gastos del hogar y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar el cliente vive en la zona los  Andes de  la ciudad de el Alto donde tiene su librería, es casa propia,  su esposa también le ayuda en el negocio ya que las ganancias ayuda en la economía de la familia. El préstamo  lo invertirá en la compra de una fotocopiadora para su librería se siente muy contento  por ser beneficiado  con el crédito.
texts.en: Victor is a new client of the institution.  He’s married to Ruth who works in a public office and helps her husband with the household expenses. He has two children in school.  Victor lives a zone in the Andes in el Alto where he has a bookstore in its own building.  His wife helps him in the business since the earnings help the family financially.  He will use the loan to buy a copying machine for the bookstore.  He feels very happy to be receiving financing.

loans.use: to buy a copying machine

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es: La Sra. Obdulia vive en la zona del plan 3000 es casada con el sr. Porfidio tienen dos hijos viven en anticrético desde hace mas de 6 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio su esposo es maestro albañil. El crédito que están solicitando es para construir el techo donde ella vende comida ya que esta al aire libre y cuando llueve no puede salir a vender ya que no es cómodo para la venta de comida, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que la comida que elabora es muy riquísima y también tiene pensionados  a los albañiles que trabajan en las construcciones donde trabaja su esposo. La Sra. Obdulia era ya cliente de la institución, anteriormente era del banco de emprendiendo las fabulosas era la presidenta del grupo,  las fabulosas donde demostró un buen comportamiento de pago. Ella es una persona proactiva con ganas de superación al igual que su esposo.
texts.en: Obdulia lives in the Plan 3000 district, is married to her husband Porfidio, and has two children. For more than six years they have lived with an anticrético rental agreement [a Bolivian agreement whereby a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house instead of monthly rent]. Obdulia sells food from her home and her husband is a master builder. The loan they are requesting is to construct a roof where Obdulia sells food, since the area is open to the elements, and when it rains she cannot go out to sell food in such an inconvenient environment. The food she prepares is very delicious, and so she has many customers, including the construction workers who work with her husband and board with them. Obdulia has already been a client of the institution. Previously she was with the Las Fabulosas communal bank and was president of the Las Fabulosas group where she demonstrated the ability to repay in a timely manner. She is a pro-active person who wishes to get ahead just as her husband does.

loans.use: to build a roof.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 55 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos, el hijo  mayor trabaja con ella, en su negocio de venta de comida, pues inicio con la venta de tortilla, lo que cambia para lograr mejores ventas y ingresos.
Como objetivo, ha sido la mejora a su casa, en donde ha venido trabajando por parte, devido a su condicion economica, ya que tiene que cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar por eso trabaja dia  a dia para obtener resultados positivos.
A traves de este financiamiento que Afodenic, esta haciendo, podra construir la parte frontal de su casa de concreto, ya que es de tabla y piedra, y mejorara esta condicion para el bienestar familiar. Comprando materiales de construccion y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Blanca is 55 years old and a single mother with two children. Her oldest son works with her in her food-selling business, which she started by selling tortillas, but which she has changed to realize greater sales and profits.
Her goal is to improve her house, where, due to her economic situation, she has been working partly, since she has to cover all her household costs. For this reason she works day to day to achieve positive results.
Through this loan from Afodenic, she will be able to build the front part of her house out of concrete, since it is currently made from wood and stone, and improve this condition for her family’s well-being. She will be buying materials and starting the work.

loans.use: to make the front part of her house out of concrete for her family's well-being.

loans.name: Viviana Irene

texts.es:
Viviana de 35 años es vendedora de productos por catálogo (AVON, YANBAL), ella vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (Ecuador). Ella tiene sus clientes fijos que recurrentemente hacen compras de bisuterías, joyas, maquillaje, que es lo que mas se promociona en estas revistas (la mayor parte de personas ofrecen mercadería por catálogos)
Recorre algunos sitios  entregando bajo pedido, pero muchas veces teme ser asaltada ya que la zona en la que vive es insegura.

Está casada con Erick con quien ha procreado un hijo de 13 años que es un buen estudiante de una institución fiscal. En estos momentos desea un crédito para comprar más mercadería como es perfumes, colonias, desodorantes, y también vender otros productos de marca L'EBEL para ver como le va. 

En el futuro y dependiendo como le vaya en sus ganancias con sus ventas, desea mejorar el aspecto de su vivienda para tener mejores condiciones y llegar a ser directora de ventas de las líneas que ofrece.
texts.en:
Viviana is 35 years old and sells catalogue products (AVON, YANBAL). She lives in the suburb of Guayaquil in Ecuador. She has regular customers who regularly buy costume jewelry, jewelry, and make-up. These are the items which are the most advertised in these magazines (the majority of people offer catalogue merchandise). She travels to some places to deliver orders, but often she is afraid of being assaulted since the area where she lives is not very safe.

She is married to Erick, with whom she has a 13-year old son who is a good student at a business school. At this time, she requests a loan to purchase more merchandise such as perfume, cologne, and deodorant, and also to sell other products by L’EBEL to see how it goes.

In the future, and depending on how her sales translate into profits, she hopes to improve her housing situation to be able to live in better conditions and become sales director for the lines she currently offers.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, cologne, and deodorant.

loans.name: Jhonny Agustin

texts.es:
Johnny de 41 años hace su trabajo de Ebanista con dos hermanos de 8:00 a 6:00 pm. El hace 10 años desarrolla esta actividad, hace muebles, modulares, mesas etc. Dice tener el arte en sus manos.
Es unido con Elvia que es ama de casa y tienen 5 hijos (estudiantes).

El necesita comprar materiales como madera, pintura, guaipe, lija para seguir con su labor, por ello solicita un préstamo. Desea seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia y que no les falte nada. Quiere ampliar su línea de muebles a muchos proveedores, tener su negocio dentro o más cerca de su casa y que sus hijos aprovechen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Johnny is 41 years old. He works as a cabinetmaker with his two brothers from 8:00 to 6:00 p.m. He has been doing this work for 10 years. He makes furniture, modular furniture, tables, etc. He says that he has artistic hands. 

He is in a relationship with Elvia who is a housewife and they have 5 children (students).

He needs to buy supplies such as wood, paint, rags and sandpaper to continue to work which is why he is asking for a loan. Hhe wants to continue working in order to support his family and so that they lack for nothing. He wants to expand his furniture line to many suppliers, locate his business inside or closer to his house and that his children make the most of their education.

loans.use: to buy paint and wood supplies.

loans.name: Dorys Narcisa

texts.es:
Dorys, vive con su familia y sus hijos, ella es ama de casa y también se dedica al cultivo de maíz,  sus hijos le ayudan en las labores de mayor peso, con el cultivo logra obtener alimentación para su hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para el cultivo, pues su propósito es administrar bien el cuido de la plantación y tener una abundante producción.
El sueño de Doris es superar a sus hijos, con su trabajo quiere contribuir para que ellos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Dorys lives with her family and her children. She is a housewife and she also engages in growing maize. Her children help her with the more demanding tasks; the crop also provides food to her family.
She is requesting a loan to buy manure for her crops, as she intends on properly tend to the plantation and get an abundant production.
Dorys’ dream is to see her children excel in life, and with her job she wants to help them have a better future.

loans.use: To buy manure for her maize crop.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La señora Victoriana y su esposo el señor Juan Martín tienen una hermosa familia. 
Están solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene los gastos escolares y no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar la inscripción y comprar lo útiles que son libros, cuadernos, carpetas, plumas y lápices. Desean que sus hijos tengan la mejor educación y los estudios necesario para que su futuro se mejor. 
Doña Victoriana se dedica a la atención y cuidados de sus hijos, el que se encargas de los gastos familiares el Don Juan Martín, con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de maquinaria pesada. Con una parte de este ingreso pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Victoriana and her husband Juan Martín have a beautiful family.
They are requesting a loan as they have to pay for school expenses and do not have the money they need to pay for registration fees and to buy school supplies such as books, notebooks, folders, pens and pencils. They want their children to study and to get the necessary education to have a better future.
Victoriana dedicates herself to tending to and caring for her children; it’s Juan Martín, who works as a heavy machine operator, who is in charge of paying for family expenses with the wage he earns from his job. They will repay the loan with part of this income.

loans.use: To pay for registration fees and school supplies for the education of her children.

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es:
Mirna, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, ella administra un chalet desD. hace 10 años, este surgió por iniciativa propia y hoy en día es su gran apoyo para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente comprara mercadería con un préstamo, ya que desea reforzar el inventario con compras D. gaseosa, jugos, pan, estos productos le ayudaran para mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Su propósito es que a través D. los préstamos se pueda desarrollar en el negocio y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna lives with her husband and three children.  She has managed a snack shop for 10 years. This occurred due to her own initiative and nowadays is a great help in covering household expenses. 

Currently, she will buy merchandise with a loan since she wants to bolster her inventory by purchasing soft drinks, juices and bread. These products will help her to improve her service to her customers.

Her objective is, through loans, to be able to expand her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices and bread for her business.

loans.name: Flores De Pascua Group

texts.es:
Sra. Hilda   cuenta con 43 años de edad es casada con 7 hijos los cuales 4 depende de ella. Sus hijos estudian, Sandy lu estudia la secundaria y óscar y Antonio estudia la primaria, su esposo se llama Sergio él se dedica al campo. Ella  se dedica al comercio  vende ropa sale a los pueblos a vender  ella invirtió su préstamo en comprar más ropa para vender.
Ella tiene una meta la cual es arreglar un local y establecer una tienda de ropa en su casa, ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio da las gracias al préstamo ya que le ayudo mucho en su negocio.
Sra. Hilda pertenece al grupo flores de pascua le pusieron ese nombre ya que el grupo esta integrado por puras mujeres, el cual está integrado por  10 miembros, hay 9 miembros más que a continuación son mencionados:
1.	Sra. Romalda quien tiene una zapatería y invirtió su préstamo en surtir nuevos modelos de zapatos, 2. Sra., Verónica quien tiene una dulcería y invirtió su préstamo en surtir más dulces, 3. Sra. María Félix tiene un pequeño negocio de dulces, 4.Sra. Nely tiene un pequeño negocio de refrescos y invirtió su préstamo en comprar más refrescos, 5. Sra. Elia tiene un negocio de verduras y invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verduras, 6. Sra. Adelfa tiene un negocio de refrescos y invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas refrescos, 7. Sra. Reyna productos de campos como maíz, calabaza, sandia, etc. Invirtió su préstamo en herramientas para trabajar en el campo, 8. Sra. Epifanía ella vende tamales y atoles y lo invirtió en los insumos que utiliza para hacer sus tamales y su atole, 9. Sra. Fabiola tiene un negocio de verdura invirtió su prestamos en comprar más verduras.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda is 43, is married, and has 4 children, 4 of whom are still her dependents.  Her children go to school.  Her daughter, Sandy Lu, is in secondary school.  Her son, Antonio, is in elementary school.  Her husband's name is Sergio, and he works in the field.  She sells clothing and goes to various towns to sell it.  She invested her loan in buying more clothing to sell.

She has a goal, which is to fix up a location and to establish a clothing store in her house.  She wants to make her business grow, and she is thankful for this loan because it has helped her a lot in her business.

Hilda belongs to the communal bank, "Flores de Pascua," (Easter Flowers).  They named their group this because all of the members are women.  There are 10 members, and 9 are mentioned below:

1. Romalda has a shoe store and invested her loans in new styles of shoes.
2. Verónica has a candy store and invested her loan in more candy.
3. María Félix has a small candy store.
4. Nely has a small soft drink business and invested her loan in more drinks.
5. Elia has a vegetable business and invested her loan in the purchase of vegetables.
6. Adelfa has a soft drink business and invested her loan in more drinks.
7. Reyna sells agricultural products like corn, squash, watermelons, etc.  She invested her loan in tools to work in the field.
8. Epifanía sells tamales and "atoles" (hot corn drinks).  She invested her loan in supplies to make her tamales and atoles.
9. Fabiola has a vegetable business and invested her loan in the purchase of more vegetables.

loans.use: to invest in buying more clothing

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de crema, queso, frutas y verduras, ella es una persona de familia, comprometida a llevar el sustento diario, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio.
Ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de frutas como: manzanas, sandia, jocotes, y también verduras como pipianes, güisquiles, ayotes, yuca , con este aporte surtirá el negocio, mejorando la atención a los clientes.
El propósito de ella es mantenerse en el negocio, expandirse hacia otros mercados y ser un buen cliente con mucha responsabilidad en los prestamos.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and their two children. She has been selling cream, cheese, fruits and vegetables for 8 years. She is a family woman, committed to providing for their daily sustenance.
She will invest her loan in the purchase of fruits such as apples, watermelons, red mombins, as well as vegetables such as pipiánes (pipián is a variety of squash known as ‘cushaw’ in the United States), ayotes, and yuca. With this provision she will stock up her shop improving the service she offers to her customers.
Her goal is to keep her activity running, to expand in other markets and to be a good and very responsible customer with the loans.
.

loans.use: To buy apples, watermelons, red mombins , pipianes, chayotes, pumpkins and cassava.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, está casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, tiene dos años de dedicarse a la venta de tortas mexicanas y tacos, es un negocio de familia, de esta actividad han logrado cubrir sus gastos y estar atento a todas las necesidades.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio como: pan, tomates, cebollas, condimentos, carnes, aceite y demás cosas que se necesitan para mantener el negocio estable y dar un buen servicio a los clientes.
Su objetivo es buscar alternativas para invertir en el negocio, y darle un giro, invirtiendo en materiales que le ayuden para aumentar su negocio, generando más ganancias para el hogar.
texts.en:
Juan is married, and lives with his wife and three children. He has been selling Mexican tortas and tacos for two years. It is a family business, and from it, he has managed to cover his expenses, and be attentive to all his customers' needs. 

He is applying for the loan to buy products he needs for the business, such as bread, tomatoes, onions, condiments, meats, cooking oil, and other things that are needed to keep the business running, and give good service to his customers.  

His goal is to look for ideas for investing in his business, and try them out; buying materials that will help him increase his business, and generate more earnings for his household.

loans.use: To buy bread, tomatoes, onions, condiments, meats, and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, vive con su madre, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta de mariscos y cosméticos de revistas, tiene 9 años en los negocios, con los ingresos que consigue de las ventas, ayuda a su madre a cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Ella necesita invertir un préstamo en la compra de mariscos frescos que le permitan mejorar la venta, los productos más demandados son pescados de varias clases, camarones, mejillones, filetes, con esta compra estará mejorando su condición de comerciante.
El proyecto de Juana es mejorar el inventario, buscar nuevos mercados para atender con el negocio, teniendo mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her mother, she has no children and she has been engaged in selling seafood and catalogue cosmetics for 9 years. She helps her mother paying for family expenses with the money she earns from selling her products.
She needs to invest the loan in the purchase of fresh seafood that will help her improve her sales. The most requested products are various kinds of fish [such as] shrimps, mussels and fillets. Thanks to this purchase she will grow as a merchant.
Juana's project is to stock up her inventory and to search for new markets where to establish her activity, thus gaining higher profitability.

loans.use: To buy shrimp, mussels and fillets.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresita De Jesus es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la inscripción de la escuela don de estudian sus hijos, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar. Desea que sus hijo sigan estudian, aprendiendo un buena educación, para que tengan un futura y  puedan ser persona con una carrera profesional. 
Dona Teresita De Jesus es empleado de una maquiladora en el área de producción, este ingreso es la fuente que tiene para su familia y con el cual un parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresita De Jesus is a single mother and has two children in her care.  

She is requesting a loan to pay for school tuition for her children since she does not have the necessary funds right now.  She wants her children to study and get a good education for a better future and so they can become professionals.

Teresita De Jesus works in the production area of a factory and her salary is the only source of income for the family.  She will use part of it to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and school expenses.

loans.name: Glenda Maria

texts.es:
Glenda, vive con su madre y dos hijos, es comerciante D. especias, platos, velas, carteras y golosinas, ha este negocio sus padres le dieron inicio hace mucho tiempo, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal.
Actualmente está nuevamente solicitando préstamo, para compra más especias, platos y boquitas, es su segunda inversión al negocio que le permite variar el negocio y ofrecer mayor cantidad a los clientes.
El objetivo D. ella es tener surtido el negocio, realizar buenas inversiones que le ayuden a crecer más competente, y proveer para sus hijos todo lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Glenda lives with her mother and two children.  She sells spices, plates, candles, billfolds and sweets.  Her parents started the business, which is located in the municipal market, a long time ago.

She is requesting a new loan to buy more spices, plates and snacks. This will be her second investment in the business aimed at offering wider variety and more goods to customers.

Her goal is to continue investing to build her inventory so her business will grow and become more competitive.  This will allow her to proviD. her children with everything they need to grow.

loans.use: To buy more spices, plates and snacks for her business.

loans.name: Paula Benita

texts.es: Paula Benita tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 8 años que tiene de experiencia en este negocio. Paula es una mujer muy responsable que disfruta de su negocio todos los días ya que tiene que interactuar con sus clientes todos los días pues recibe diferentes pedidos. Ella comienza su labor desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche que llega a su hogar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, perfumes, toallas, sabanas y manteles.
texts.en: Paula Benita sells general merchandise and has been in business for over eight years.  Paula is a very responsible person who enjoys what she does because it allows her to talk to the customers every day when taking orders.  She begins her workday at 8:00 a.m. and ends it at 7:00 p.m. when she arrives home.  The loan she is requesting is to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes, towels, sheets and tablecloths.

loans.use: To buy , , cosmetics, towels, sheets and tablecloths.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta, se dedica a la venta D. comida y tortillas, es viuda, vive con un hijo, el negocio tiene 15 años D. estar administrándolo, lo aprendió cuando joven por su madre.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra D. gas propano, ya que por su negocio consume varios en el mes, este préstamo le ayudara a solventar esta necesidad y poder realizar su negocio sin ningún atraso.
Ella quiere tener siempre el negocio, tener siempre la alternativa D. los préstamos para invertir y trabajar con el negocio por mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Marta sells food and tortillas for a living and has been in business for 15 years after learning the traD. from her mother.  She is a widow and lives with her son.  

She needs the loan to buy propane gas since her business consumes quite a lot in a month.  This loan will help cover the cost and keep the business running without delays.

She wants to keep the business going for a long, long time and hopes she will always have loans available to do so.

loans.use: To buy propane gas to make tortillas.

loans.name: Veronica Siomara

texts.es: Verónica Simona tiene su negocio que es la venta de ganado. Hace más trece años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Inicio este medio de vida por su Mama que le enseño y con el esfuerzo de su esposo es que ella pudo iniciar su propio negocio, que está ubicado en su vivienda. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de vacas, toros, chivos entre otros.
texts.en: Verónica Simona has a business selling livestock.  She has been in this line of work for more than thirteen years.  Her mom taught her the business and, thanks to her husband's effort, she was able to set up her own business which is based at home.  She is requesting this loan to buy cows, bulls, goats, etc.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls and goats

loans.name: Jimmy Santiago

texts.es: Jimmy Santiago tiene 40 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte. Desde hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, él es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de proporcionarle a sus hijos los ingresos necesarios. El desea obtener otro camión que le ayude a generar más ganancias a su hogar. El crédito que actualmente solicita es para la compra de llantas, focos, vidrios entre otros repuestos que su camión necesita.
texts.en: Jimmy Santiago is 40 years old and provides a transport service.  He has owned his business for more than five years.  Jimmy is a very responsible person and he uses his income to provide his children with what they need.  He would like to buy another truck which would help him to make more money for his household.  The loan that Jimmy is currently requesting will be used to buy tires, headlamps, windows and other spare parts that his truck needs.

loans.use: to buy tires, headlamps, windows and other spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, salt, oil, fruit, vegetables, bags, disposable plates and cutlery

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
"Nothing is impossible to a willing heart" this is what Maricar says. She is 42 years old but still hopes that someday she will uplift her family's living condition. She is operating a small sari-sari (variety) store in the window of her house. She has been managing it for almost five years. She wasn't able to construct a store outside her house due to the expensive cost of construction materials, such as gravel and sand. Instead of buying these materials, she would rather use a loan to buy groceries for her store. She earns about P4,000 each month doing these activities. She has four children and all are attending school and need daily allowances. 

Maricar is now asking  for a loan of P10,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and instant noodles to sell in her store. Additional groceries to sell will attract more customers and increase the capacity of sales from her business. She will then earn more profit and will be able to save a part of it for emergency purposes.

In the future, Maricar would like to earn consistent profits to construct a store in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and instant noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 42 years old and blessed with two children. Her spouse works as a local farmer. 

Amparo raises hogs. She usually sell them to butchers who come to their village. She earns about PHP 3,500 for each pig she is able to dispose. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs to ensure good nutrition. A hog that has had good nutrition can be offered at a higher cost when it's ready for disposal. 

In the future, she would like to strengthen her pig selling business and earn enough money for house repair.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita is 34 years old and married. 

She has never been employed in any organization with monthly payrolls because she wasn't able to finished her studies. When she got married, Vita stayed at home to nurse her two children. 

She was not contented being a plain housewife and Vita wanted to generate income too. With minimal capital, she established a small variety store in front of her house. Daily profits of  PHP 200 from the business were enough to cover her family's daily meals and snacks for her children. 

Vita wants to attract more customers to her store so she needs to stock groceries in it. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell in her variety store. This will help increase her sales and generate more income.

Being a business-oriented woman, Vita would like to strengthen her variety store and someday establish a hog raising business for an additional income too.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is from the village of San Isidro in the province of Isabela. She is 47 years old and married with four adult children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for the past 20 years. She provides economic support to her family. 

Mercedes considers herself to be a hardworking, honest person. She hopes to save enough money to renovate the family home. 

She would like a loan to purchase an additional pig. She expects her income to increase by 20 percent with this investment. She is pleased with the services of microfinance and says the prices are reasonable. She wants to continuing living in Quirino, surrounded by her relatives and friends.

loans.use: to buy feed and a piglet to raise.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is from the village of Santa Filomena. She  has been engaged in farming for the past three years. With her honesty and hard work, she hopes to continue growing her business. 

Teresa is looking for a loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She prefers microfinance institutions because of their products and customer-friendly attitude. 

This loan will increase her total investment in the business by 25 percent, and she expects her income to increase by 20 percent. 

Teresa enjoys the nature of Santa Filomena and lives close to her relatives.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bat-Ulzii

texts.en:
Bat-Ulzii is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two sons and one daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. After her husband passed away, the family started to live on her father’s plot of land. 

Her two sons attend local college and secondary school and her daughter is in kindergarten. Since 2007 she has been operating a used clothing business at a small stall in the second largest outdoor market, selling women's blouses, t-shirts, etc. 

Bat-Ulzii is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) from Kiva lenders to buy more clothes for the upcoming season, which is a high shopping season. She is an accomplished entrepreneur who is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell in the upcoming autumn season.

loans.name: Marirose

texts.en:
Due to financial burdens, Marirose did not pursue her college education. She is married to a farmer and is raising their family in a village while planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is now 28 years old and has two infant-age children. With her husband, they are striving hard to cultivate their rice field to earn income and support their family needs.

They aim to increase their yields and income to renovate their house to have a comfortable shelter and also to save for the future of their children. But due to inadequate capital, Marirose needs to ask for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to sustain their rice production. They are hoping that this loan will help them to increase their yields and income as they work hard for it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production.

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Anu, a 31-year-old married mother of an eight-year-old, established her tailoring business in 2005. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. Having already received and repaid three loans from Patan BPW, she will use her new one to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Anu plans to improve the economic condition of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase their production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth, a 37-year-old married mother of three, lives with her family in The Philippines where she has a store in her home selling basic products of excellent quality at affordable prices.

Lilibeth believes that working hard is the key to success, and one of her business goals is to grow her enterprise by stocking it with more products. To this end, she is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy groceries such as sugar, assorted biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, detergent, etc. to sell in her shop.

Lilibeth has faith that her efforts will give her the opportunity to provide her family a better quality of life, most especially her school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as sugar, assorted biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo, detergent and other ingredients for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Dhan Kumari

texts.en:
Dhan is 25 years old, married and has two children who are 9 and 6.  In 2000, she went into business farming vegetables, and works seven days a week, four hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is determined to improve her family's life and thanks Kiva lenders for their support. 

Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural, and most families grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to buy greater amounts of seed and fertilizer and increase their land's output. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for a small farm.

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en: Enebish lives with her family in a ger (or traditional nomadic tent) in a remote part of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia which does not have infrastructure. She is 43 years old and makes a living selling clothes in a large outdoor market. Her husband is often out of town on business, which means that she must raise their children and run her business on her own. She imports her clothing from Ereen, a border city near China, and is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks to import more clothing to sell. She is working hard to improve her business and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell this autumn.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda was 16 years old when she got married, and is now 43 years old, separated and blessed with four children. Because her family had no stable source of income, she went abroad to work as a domestic helper. She did this for eight years, then came home and opened a sari-sari (or variety) store where she makes most of her income by selling snack foods, breads and drinks. Imelda is determined to give her children the best possible life, and uses much of her income to send them to school. She hopes to be able to send them to college someday. To make this possible, she has also gone into business selling meat such as chicken and pork, as well as lipstick, lotion and fragrances. She would also like to begin selling rice, but does not have enough capital to do this. That is why she is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 to to open a new business. In the future, she hopes to buy a car, grow her businesses and send all of her children to college.

loans.use: to go into business selling rice.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en: Imee is 29 years old, married and has one school-aged child. Her husband makes a living as a driver for the local government of Mallig. She started a sari-sari (or variety) store in 2003 and makes a living selling bread, drinks, snack foods, diapers and rice. She usually earns PHP 10,000 monthly but would like to improve her life by buying a used car to help out in her business, and also open a new business selling rice. To do this, she has applied for a loan for PHP 50,000. She also plans to use the additional income she earns to send her child to college.

loans.use: to open a new business buying and selling rice.

loans.name: Armel

texts.en:
Armel has two children whom he is sending to college. Their eagerness to learn is an inspiration for him to keep producing rice crops twice a year. Armel has been very patient in managing his farming business and, for the past 10 years, he has cultivated a one-hectare rice field. He sells his harvest to traders in the village and earns a minimum profit of 20,000 PHP. 

Armel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. With the help of his loan, he will be able to improve his crop production. In the future, Armel wants to achieve financial stability and see his children someday holding college degrees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 26 years old and blessed with two children. Her children serve as an inspiration for her to strive harder in her farming business. For the past five years, Noemi has worked together with her husband, planting and harvesting rice. During the last harvest season, she earned 16,000 PHP and covered the allowances of her children, electric bills, groceries, and daily meals. She was also able to use some of her income as revolving capital for her business. 

Noemi is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to hire laborers to help plant and transplant rice seedlings. In the future, she wants to continue harvesting a good crop each season to earn more profit that she will use to educate her children.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help plant rice

loans.name: Sheryl Jane

texts.en:
Sheryl Jane is 26 years old and has three young children. She and her family enjoy living in the village where they have a farm and where they plant rice and vegetables and raise livestock. Sheryl Jane’s husband is her business partner and together they manage their farm. 

Sheryl Jane and her husband want to increase their yields to increase their income, but they have inadequate capital. Therefore, Sheryl Jane is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy seed and fertilizer and to pay the labor costs required to produce rice. She believes that, along with their hard work, her loan will help increase their yields. In the future, Sheryl Jane and her husband plan to save for their children’s education and hope to start a variety store someday to provide another source of income.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Ngai's Group

texts.en:
Ngai was born in 1970 and lives in Nhoi Duoi village, Co Loa commune. She is married with three children. Ngai and her family have a shop where they sell glass and aluminum, and also manufacture aluminum doors. She and her husband work producing doors from aluminum and glass. They earn a monthly income of about 7,000,000 VND. Ngai has had her job for many years and has borrowed previously from SEDA to improve her business. Ngai will use her 7,194,000 VND portion of this group loan to buy glass and aluminum to make the doors.

Other borrowers in her group are Be and Xuan. Be is 27 years old and has two children. She will use her 6,322,000 VND portion of this group loan to invest in her restaurant. Xuan is 23 years old. She will use her 6,322,000 VND portion of this group loan to buy shoes to sell in her shoe shop.

loans.use: to buy glass and aluminum to make doors

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is an optimist who believes that patience is bitter but its fruits are sweet. She is 42, married, and blessed with four children. With God's guidance and her hard work and patience, she has been able to send them all to school. Bibiana works hard to help her husband maintain their farm. The couple owns a two hectare field that they have been cultivating for 20 years, planting and harvesting rice to sell to traders in the village.  Last harvest season, Bibiana earned about 50,000 PHP. Her profits were just enough to cover tuition fees and allowances for her children along with providing for daily groceries and utilities. 

Bibiana is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for land cultivation. She needs to prepare her farmland thoroughly to gain more profit from the next harvest season. Bibiana hopes someday to provide a better life for her family by producing abundant harvests.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and cultivate her land

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en: Thoa was born in 1967 and lives in Nhoi Duoi village with her husband, who works in construction, and two children, who are too young to attend school.  Her husband earns about 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month. Thoa's family owns a restaurant, and she has supplemented the family's income by working there for many years. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month, and joined SEDA in 2006 as a way to increase her income and improve her family's life. She has already taken out and repaid her first loan, which was for 8,066,000 VND. This time she is applying for a loan for 9,810,000 VND to expand her restaurant by buying new chairs, new tables and other items.

loans.use: to expand a family restaurant by buying new chairs, tables and other items.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vy was born in 1973 and lives in Nhoi Duoi village with her husband, who works in construction, and her three children. She supplements her family's income by running a hardware store where she earns about 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month. She joined SEDA in 2007 as a way to improve and expand her business, and has already taken out and repaid her first loan. Now she is applying for a new loan for 8,502,000 VND to buy construction equipment.

loans.use: to buying construction equipment.

loans.name: Emy Grace

texts.en:
Emy Grace is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. They live in a village to manage their rice farming business. They work hard and endures hardships for they want to continue sending their children to school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they are experiencing a financial shortage. 

In this regard, they want to increase their yields to earn a higher income to support the education of their children and to acquire their basic necessities. Due to lack of capital, Emy Grace is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay labor cost required in rice production. They believe that through patience and hard work, they will increase their yields and income.

In the future, Emy Grace hopes that they will become financially stable and all their children will earn a degree.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay labor costs required in rice production.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 45 years old, married, and has with five children, two of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer. Belinda and her husband increase the family income through farming.

Belinda operates a sari-sari (general) store and sells cooking oil, snack foods, noodles, and coffee. She has had her store for 10 years. Through the income she earns from the business, she is able to send her children in school and meet their daily needs. 

Belinda wants to expand the products she sells in the village and is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy beer, soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil. She knows that the loan will help her access a stocks of goods to sell in the village so that she can minimize her transportation expenses.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline and her husband are blessed with seven children. She is 53 years of age and her husband is a farmer. 

Evangeline is engaged in the hog fattening business while her husband runs a rice farming business. Evangeline and her husband try hard to fulfill their children’s need. They do everything just to feed their children. Evangeline has one child in school, som of the other children already have their own families and the rest are working. Her income in her business is not enough to sustain her family's needs and her children who are working help her in times of financial shortage.

Evangeline is getting old. She wants to grow her business and earn enough profits for her family to save for future emergencies. Evangeline doesn’t want to have to rely on her children for income because someday they will all be having their own families. She is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy feed for her piglets to grow.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets to grow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is a twenty four year old divorced woman. She has four children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Phiona has been dealing in clothes for eight years.She started with a capital of 500,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. Her hardship is bad debtors. Her vision is to start another business and to build a good house. Phionah needs the loan money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
With her determination to help her husband in providing a quality life for their children, Herminia looks for a source of income so that she can help her husband. Now, she is managing her sari-sari store business. She mostly sells canned goods, cooking oil and drinks. Herminia has been in this type of business for over one year.

Herminia is 52 years old and has three children. She is sending two children to school and one is working abroad. Herminia can rely only on her income from her business and the remittance from her child abroad. She doesn’t like to rely, all the time, on her child. Hence, she wants to expand her business. 

Herminia is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy additional goods to sell in their village like breads, coffee, sugar, milk and snack foods. Her goal is to maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in their village like breads, coffee, sugar, milk and snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay labourers who are clearing land for banana growing.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 45 and has three school-age children. Despite of being a widower, he has the strong determination to improve his childrens' status of living and give them a better life. He has owned and managed a rice farming business in their village for almost 28 years, earning profits of P26,000 in every harvest season. He works hard and endures hardships for he wants his children to finished their studies and earns a degree.

Juanito is requesting additional capital of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his rice production. He believes that with the help of this loan he will improve his rice production and increase his income. He hopes that in the future all of his children will finish their studies and find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his rice production

loans.name: Narelie

texts.en: Narelie is a 20 year-old married woman. She has been engaged in selling fish for two years. She enjoys selling milk fish and tilapia in the village where she lives. She has been selling house to house because it's easy to sell with this kind of strategy. She is thankful because since she started borrowing additional capital, her business has grown. She would like to buy more milkfish and tilapia but her funds are not enough which is why she is requesting capital amounting to P15,000 for her business improvement. She hopes that through her requested loan she will be able to encourage more customers and save enough money for her child's schooling.

loans.use: to buy milkfish and tilapia for her fish business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years of age and married. She is a very responsible and hard-working mother to her four children. Two of her children are currently studying and the other two are still infants. For five years, she has been engaged in selling and making balut — a fertilized duck or chicken egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell, commonly sold as street food. She is glad because her business is improving and she is able to start another business — a retail store. She has been managing it for three months and from it she is able to earn about P1,000 a month. Her income from balut and retail store sales was used to cover their daily needs, allowances for her children, and payment of electric bills. 

Evelyn would like to buy her groceries in bulk so that she could minimize the cost of going to and from the market, but her income is not sufficient. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy balut and different kinds of basic items such as sugar, oil, eggs, bread and soft drinks for her shop. She believes that with this loan and hard work she can maintain and improve her business. She is also aiming to support her children until they can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy balut and different kinds of basics such as sugar, oil, eggs, bread and soft drinks for her  retail shop business

loans.name: William

texts.en: William wants a loan to buy more land so as to expand his tea plantation. He is a forty-six-year-old married man living in his own semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a tea farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for twenty years. His dream is to construct a permanent house and buy land for tea expansion.

loans.use: to buy more land so as to expand his tea plantation

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is engaged in farming. Rosie plants rice and corn crops on her land. She is able to buy her family's basic needs through her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs
